story:
Why donate to this campaign?

Starting a business is hard work. It takes diligence, it takes the support of the community, and it also takes capital. I knew all of this. What I didn't know was how much harder it is for women who start a business. My crowdfunding campaign is set up in a way where I am asking less than what I actually need in capital, and with the ultimate goal of raising some funding to go directly into a pay-it-forward fund for other women in business.

"A report from the Institute of Women’s Policy Research (IWPR) shows that women are steadily increasing their presence in the world of small-business ownership... Women business owners still face a significant wage gap and continually have smaller amounts of start-up capital than their male peers... For one, women-owned businesses make only about 25 cents for every dollar their male counterparts earn." -The Atlantic

I really hope to be able to go over my goal and help other small businesses by paying-it-forward. Particularly, to aid other women-owned companies. Help me not only reach my own goal for a portion of my start-up capital, but exceed it and use that capital to help catapult other women in small business to be successful. 

What will A Jones Design Co. do with goal funding?

With the capital I receive, A Jones Design Co. will help businesses fill in the gaps of their outreach, by offering a wider suite of branding, marketing, and design services than the current local market. These services should be affordable and accessible to all start-ups, and in one location. I believe in small companies and their positive impact within their communities. I will help small businesses, with a focus on local food businesses and women-owned businesses.

With combined experience in design, marketing, communications, community organizing and advocacy, product development, community and environmental planning, local food systems, and public relations; I am uniquely deft in helping other small businesses with their branding needs.

Helping me, A Jones Design Co., reach my capital and exceed it elevates the community as a whole. The domino effect.

What I Need & What You Get

The bulk of the funding will go directly to operating equipment, software, and business startup fees; such as a licensure, desk computer and programs, and office and photography equipment. My funding needs are actually higher than my stated goal.

I decided to crowdfund not only to buffer these costs, but mainly to get out there, be visible, and start offering services right away. Being creative and using that creativity to help others is the whole point! Of course, I chose creative funding. I believe in the power of community!

If I do not reach our full funding goal, all rewards and services will still be honored and any funding raised will go towards the original goals as promised. If I can exceed my funding goals, I will pay-it-forward to other women with discounted services to help with that wage gap and lack of capital we have as women in business. I believe in access; all companies should be able to obtain services for their business despite financial difficulties or company size.

The Impact

Again, branding, marketing, and design should be accessible to all businesses. I believe that I can make that happen. With a wide range of services, A Jones Design Co. will be able to fill in gaps in knowledge or just take the weight of marketing off the to-do (someday) list. The returns will have a lasting impact for the clients.

Small business owners can be intimidated by marketing and branding. That impacts their bottom line. It also has a direct consequence on the economy when small businesses do not thrive. "The 23 million small businesses in America account for 54% of all U.S. sales." (Forbes, 2014) 

"Many small business owners are still not adopting modern technology and marketing approaches. Additionally, more than half of SMB owners do not have a website (52%) or even measure the results of their marketing programs (56%)." Forbes

"Only about 1 in 10 small businesses have figured out how to use social media or online advertising to market their product." Forbes, How Small Business Owners Are Wrecking Their Own Chances Of Success

"A new study from Microsoft finds that almost 60 percent of small businesses with websites don’t use any form of paid search marketing, with 9 out of 10 saying they never even tried it. The survey reveals that most small businesses are intimidated by what they believe to be expensive and complex search marketing techniques. Almost 90 percent of respondents feared that keywords were too expensive, with another 25 percent believing it was too complex. Microsoft’s survey found that 72 percent of companies using paid search marketing saw an increase in sales inquiries and 68 percent deemed the technique successful." (Brafton)

With A Jones Design Co., I will be offering tips and tools in a newsletter for small businesses, and also make sure that costs and fees are low. I will help ease the intimidation factor of using marketing and branding techniques and will strive to educate local businesses on small changes they can make that will have large and lasting positive impacts. 

Risks & Challenges

There is no risk in contributing to my campaign for A Jones Design Co. and as I wrote above, all rewards are to be honored regardless of my fundraising outcome.

The risks and challenges for A Jones Design Co. are also minimal. The company will be able to move forward at a slower pace without meeting the crowdfunding goals, though it will admittedly be more challenging to pay-it-forward to the community with discounts and free services right away. I really hope to help other women in business right away.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Encourage small donations! "Skip the coffee and donate $5" It adds up quick!
  • Get the word out to businesses, friends, family, or colleagues that may be interested.
  • Make some noise about my A Jones Design Co. campaign!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help me reach more people.
  • Recommend A Jones Design Co. to businesses that could use services, especially at a discount!

 

Thank you for reading about our campaign!

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Anjelica Billups.  I am a dual licensed massage therapist and esthetician. Witnessing the health struggles of individuals in my family such as cancer (breast and bone), heart conditions, lack of mobility, and the effect it has on one’s self esteem and overall mind and body led me to form Angelic Touch.  I opened my business 5 years ago. It has become my quest to provide individuals with the needed peace to relax, renew and rejuvenate.  In 2012, Angelic Touch opened its doors in a modest 300 square foot one room studio with little visibility, accessibility and security.  I knew that I wanted Angelic Touch to offer clients a relaxing, and tranquil spa experience through an enticing menu of services and excellent customer service. The tiny studio only allows for me to service one client at a time.  Initially, I started with just 3-4 clients per week, however Angelic Touch services 35-40 clients on average per week.  With this expansion of clientele, I will soon need to hire another esthetician/ massage therapist. It is time for Angelic Touch to spread its wings and fly. 

I have been so blessed over the years with my clientele at Angelic Touch. I feel as though my clients have become an extended part of my family. I want to continue to build relationships with them and be able to treat them to a beautiful, relaxing environment that is visible, accessible and comfortable.  I want to expand the service menu to include additional treatments such as makeup application,  result driven facials and body treatments.  Taking the leap from a modest 300 square foot suite to a full space that is 3 times the size is one that requires lots of dedication, love and financial backing. 

What We Need & What You Get

I am looking to raise $7,500 in funding.  This will pay for the opening costs which includes , equipment and supplies.

There are some unique and awesome perks for your help! You can enjoy spa services once relocated and reopened for your assistance in helping the vision become a reality.

  • Despite whether I reach my goal or not, the relaunch and expansion of Angelic Touch will continue.  I am trying to avoid raising the costs to my customers via price increase in current services.

The Impact of Angelic Touch

I strive to offer each client a unique and customized luxurious experience. With so many  well-known brands to choose from, clients have unlimited options.  It is my goal to retain and cultivate new relationships with clients. I want each individual to feel comfortable and know that they have someone who cares about their lives, health and well being.  Visiting a spa is more than just pampering ones self, it is about escaping from the  real world if only for 30 minutes to refill ones mind body and soul.  Clients are encourage to leave their cares at the door and to relax, renew and rejuvenate.

Risks & Challenges

I no doubt or fear of the success that the new location can and will bring, however I  am aware that there are challenges I will face. 

The obvious challenge is that as the current sole massage therapist/esthetician it will become necessary to hire an employee.  It is imperative that any addition to the staff be well trained and knowledgeable of current trends and advancement in their respective field. They will need to able to provide the same or exceed the current level of customer satisfication.

Another challenge is competition.  With so many  well-known brands to choose from, clients have unlimited options.  It is my goal to retain and cultivate new relationships with clients.

Lastly I have some precise desires and requirements for the new location. I am looking to stay in the Southeast Arlington/Mansfield area so that I may continue to cater to my current clientele. The space must include ample parking and be handicap accessible.  The space must be large enough to accommodate at least 3 treatment rooms and still be affordable. I am looking at several options currently, and I know that the perfect building is not far from my grasp.  The contributions from clientele, friends, family and fans will help widen the possibilities so that I can move quickly and efficiently.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that some of you cannot contribute monetarily, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help! Here’s what you can do to help.

Get the word out! Please share my campaign with others via social media and the Indiegogo media tools

Donate time for painting and moving to the new location

Donate time for painting and moving to the new location

story:
It all began when...

Well, actually we're not exactly sure … It could have been on 1st January 2017, when our family embarked on a year of buying nothing new and discovered a whole new world, or a world that was full of good things being sent to landfill … It could have been when my friend and I started to find venues to run craft workshops and found that it was really difficult to make ends meet… It could have been when we thought, gosh we’re lucky that we can ‘make do and mend’ when times get tough and that we weren't sure whether everyone was in that position….It could have been when we moved here with a 6 month old baby and couldn’t find any groups to meet new people and do creative activities with our little one… It could have been when we thought about what we wanted the world to look like when our two little girls grow up…

All we know is that it definitely came about when we wanted to do something, however small, to make a difference to the world around us. To empower everyone no matter what age, ability or situation to create, repair, be self-sufficient in some way and to make sure our kids could too...

Quand tout a commencé...

Beh, en vrai on en es pas vraiment sûre... Ça aurai pu être le 1er janvier 2017 quand notre famille s'est engagée dans une année ou on achetait rien de neuf et on a pu découvrir un nouveau ou un monde rempli de bonnes choses qui sont envoyés à la déchetterie... Ça aurai pu être quand mon amie et moi avons commencé à trouver des endroits où faire des ateliers artisanal et avons découvert que c'était très difficile de joindre les deux bouts... Ça aurai pu être quand on s'est dit qu'on était chanceux de pouvoir se contenter et réparer quand les temps étaient durs et peut être que tout le monde ne pouvaient pas faire de même... Ça aurai pu être quand on a déménagé ici avec un bébé de 6 mois et on ne trouvait pas de groupes pour rencontrer des nouveaux gens ou d'activités créatifs à faire avec notre petite...

Tout ce que l'on sait est que Ça a commencé dans le but de faire quelquechose, peut être quelque chose petit , mais de faire une difference dans le monde autour de nous. De donner le pouvoir à tout le monde, peu importe l'âge, l'abilité ou la situation, de créer, de réparer, d'être indépendant d'un façon ou d'un autre et de faire en sorte que nos enfants puissent faire la même.

 

Then...

We plucked up the courage, bought the bus and stopped its next destination being landfill. Sticking to our challenge we bought a 1980s green doubledecker that had worked for London Central for nearly 20 years. It had then be repainted for its new life in semi-retirement, before sitting in a garage for years. But with the retirement age increasing, we decided its skills were being wasted and it still had so much to give to a community. Since then, we've been busy transforming the interior to make it fit for a more leisurely purpose, but one full of life. With our 'buy nothing new' mantra fixed in our minds, we have repurposed materials and sought out second hand items. We've even managed to find used solar panels. But soon we will have to stop. There is only so much we can do alone...

Puis...

On a trouvé le courage, on a acheté le bus et on a fait en sorte qu'il ne finisse pas à la déchetterie. En restant fidèle à notre challenge, on a acheter un bus double étage vert qui date de 1980 et qui a roulé dans le centre de londres pendant 20 ans. Il avait été repeint pour sa nouvelle vie de demi-retraite et ensuite il a été laissé dans un garage pendant des années. Mais avec son âge entrain d'augmenter, on a décidé que ses compétences étaient gaspillaient dans ce garage et qu'il avait encore plein de choses à donner à la communauté. Depuis, nous avons transformé l'intérieur pour le rendre adapté à des loisirs plus tranquilles, mais pleins de vie. Avec notre mantra de ' ne rien acheter neuf ' nous avons recyclé des matériaux et trouvé des objets d'occasion. Nous avons même réussi a trouvé des panneaux solaires d'occasion ! Mais bientôt nous devrions nous arrêter... il y a une limite à ce que nous pouvons faire seuls.

And how does the story continue?

Well, that's up to YOU! Our aim is to create not just an art, craft and repair space that is accessible to all, but a sustainable, zero waste, SUPER bus.

Et comment l'histoire continue?

C'est à vous de la continuer! Notre but n'est pas que de créer un espace d'art et de réparation qui est accessible à tous mais un SUPER BUS durable et sans déchets.

 

www.viamichelin.com

 

 

 

So what happens next? How can we make this idea reality?

Well, we've done the research and this is the sketch for next chapter...

 

Alors, qu'est ce que c'est la prochaine étape? Comment on peut faire cette idée un réalité?

On a fait les recherches, et voici le plan pour la prochaine chapitre...

And the sums?

To do this we need at least 8,000 euros: 

Et les calcules?

On a besoin de 8,000 euros (a moins):

 

 

We believe that this is the sequel that our lovely bus deserves. We hope you to do. A new life, volunteering in a new guise as Le Bus Vert, still serving the community as all good buses should do, but having fun and inspiring everyone who jumps onboard, including these two...

Nous croyons que c'est l'avenir que notre magnifique bus mérite et on espère que vous aussi. Une nouvelle vie en tant que Le Bus Vert, servant à la communauté comme chaque bon bus devrai, mais en s'amusant et en inspirant chaque personne qui monte à bord , incluant c'est deux ...

 

It will hold:

  • accessibly priced art, craft and repair workshops
  • 'free studio' time where anyone can use the vast array of materials for any project they choose, on a pay as you can basis
  • a monthly repair cafe to mend broken items and teach people how to confidently do it for  themselves next time.
  • plus much, much more

 

Il y aura..

  • Des ateliers d'art, d'artisanat et de réparation à des prix accessibles
  • De temps libre ou tout le monde peut utiliser la vaste gamme de matériaux pour le projet que vous voulez avec un système de payer comme vous le pouvez
  • Un café de réparation mensuel pour réparer les objets des gens et leur apprendre comment le faire eux même avec confiance.
  • Et beaucoup beaucoup plus

 

Now it's over to you...

  • Please donate today to our campaign! Do not delay! We have 38 days to raise our target and beyond! Please make it happen!
  • Spread the word far and wide! Share our campaign with others who might be able to lend a hand and want to be part of Le Bus Vert's next chapter and beyond. We need to get as much support as possible for this campaign. Indiegogo has lots of share tools that makes it easy to connect with your family, friends, colleagues, and everyone you know and convince them to help us! 
  • And if you can't support us financially, we always accept any donations of art equipment that can be used by passengers onboard. Everyone can make a difference!
  • Thank you!

 

Maintenant c'est à vous..

  • Faites un don à notre campagne aujourdhui , nous avons 38 jours pour atteindre notre montant cible et plus ! S'il vous plaît!
  • Parlez en ! Partagez notre campagne avec des gens qui auraient envie de donner un coup de main et de faire partir du prochain chapitre du Bus Vert. On a besoin de beaucoup de soutient dans notre projet. Indiegogo a beaucoup de outils pour partager facilement avec  votre famille , vos amis, vos collègues et tous les gens que vous connaissez pour les convaincre à nous aider !
  • Si vous ne pouvez pas faire un don d'argent , on accepte toujours des dons d'équipement artistique à bord. Tout le monde peut faire une différence !
  • Merci!

Mais bientôt nous devrions nous arrêter... il y a une limite à ce que nous pouvons faire seuls.And how does the story continue?Well, that's up to YOU! Our aim is to create not just an art, craft and repair space that is accessible to all, but a sustainable, zero waste, SUPER bus.Et comment l'histoire continue?C'est à vous de la continuer! Notre but n'est pas que de créer un espace d'art et de réparation qui est accessible à tous mais un SUPER BUS durable et sans déchets.  www.viamichelin.com   So what happens next? How can we make this idea reality?Well, we've done the research and this is the sketch for next chapter... Alors, qu'est ce que c'est la prochaine étape? Comment on peut faire cette idée un réalité?On a fait les recherches, et voici le plan pour la prochaine chapitre...And the sums?To do this we need at least 8,000 euros: Et les calcules?On a besoin de 8,000 euros (a moins):  We believe that this is the sequel that our lovely bus deserves. We hope you to do. A new life, volunteering in a new guise as Le Bus Vert, still serving the community as all good buses should do, but having fun and inspiring everyone who jumps onboard, including these two...Nous croyons que c'est l'avenir que notre magnifique bus mérite et on espère que vous aussi. Une nouvelle vie en tant que Le Bus Vert, servant à la communauté comme chaque bon bus devrai, mais en s'amusant et en inspirant chaque personne qui monte à bord , incluant c'est deux ...  It will hold:

accessibly priced art, craft and repair workshops


'free studio' time where anyone can use the vast array of materials for any project they choose, on a pay as you can basis

a monthly repair cafe to mend broken items and teach people how to confidently do it for  themselves next time.

plus much, much more

 Il y aura.. 
Des ateliers d'art, d'artisanat et de réparation à des prix accessibles
De temps libre ou tout le monde peut utiliser la vaste gamme de matériaux pour le projet que vous voulez avec un système de payer comme vous le pouvez 
Un café de réparation mensuel pour réparer les objets des gens et leur apprendre comment le faire eux même avec confiance.
Et beaucoup beaucoup plus
 Now it's over to you...

Please donate today to our campaign! Do not delay! We have 38 days to raise our target and beyond! Please make it happen!

Spread the word far and wide! Share our campaign with others who might be able to lend a hand and want to be part of Le Bus Vert's next chapter and beyond. We need to get as much support as possible for this campaign. Indiegogo has lots of share tools that makes it easy to connect with your family, friends, colleagues, and everyone you know and convince them to help us! 

And if you can't support us financially, we always accept any donations of art equipment that can be used by passengers onboard. Everyone can make a difference!

Thank you!
 Maintenant c'est à vous..

Faites un don à notre campagne aujourdhui , nous avons 38 jours pour atteindre notre montant cible et plus ! S'il vous plaît!

Parlez en ! Partagez notre campagne avec des gens qui auraient envie de donner un coup de main et de faire partir du prochain chapitre du Bus Vert. On a besoin de beaucoup de soutient dans notre projet. Indiegogo a beaucoup de outils pour partager facilement avec  votre famille , vos amis, vos collègues et tous les gens que vous connaissez pour les convaincre à nous aider ! 

Si vous ne pouvez pas faire un don d'argent , on accepte toujours des dons d'équipement artistique à bord. Tout le monde peut faire une différence ! 

Merci!

story:
Summary 

My name is Jeszika Milton, and with your help I will accomplish my dream of operating a locally sourced farm to table restaurant. As a Chef with over 15 years industry experience, I strive to give customers a 100% homemade menu in a comfortable setting with great customer service; showcasing locally sourced ingredients, beer, and coffee.

Having grown up and completed my culinary studies in Montreal, I had the amazing fortune of working and training with passionate chefs who instilled in me a sense of dedication and pride for real food. I have spent the last 10 years learning in country style kitchens from chefs including Fred Morin, Helena Loureiro, and Karina Lapointe, honing my skills and feeding my fervor of fresh and flavorful fair. Over the past 2 summers I operated a successful market fresh locally sourced food stand at the Fireweed Community Outdoor Market, sourcing all meat and vegetables from Yukon farmers. Farmers and Foragers of Wild will allow me tp turn my food stand into a year round venture.

This campaign isn't just to about funding it's about changing my life.

What We Need & What You Get

In the grand scheme of things I need 30,000$ to get my restaurant started. To secure the 30K I need 3000$ in cash equity.

I have found a beautiful location with a fully equipped commercial kitchen. I need to create a dinning room, and provide tables and chairs, as well as dishes for services. 

Not only will the funds I am seeking allow me to furnish my location and obtain food and beverage inventory, it will allow me to hire qualified staff and pay them a proper wage.

So what's in it for you?

It takes a village, and to be part of a village you need to show respect and appreciation.  Everyone who contributes to this campaign will be rewarded for their contribution. In addition to a heartfelt letter of appreciation, you will have the chance to experience a unique culinary experience. Varying level of perks will be offered based on campaign contributions. From free drinks and desserts, to reserved seating on opening night. I will not hold back and showing you that I appreciate my community helping me make this success.

If I fall short of my funding goal, the money I do raise will still serve towards making this business venture a success. 

The Impact

As a single mom, striving to spend as much time with my kid while still feeding those around me, this opportunity is a life changer for me. It means I finally get to make food that I am passionate about and create a menu I believe in, on my own terms, on a full time basis. This restaurant will allow me to grow and showcase my passion for country cuisine without having to sacrifice the privilege of time with family, while giving locals and tourists a place to experience true Yukon taste year round.

I have over 10 years of culinary experience both as a chef and waitress, in addition to 7 years of business administration experience. I have a head for business and a passion for food.

This passion extends beyond the kitchen to the butcher shop and the farm.

In my 4 years as a Yukon resident, I have spent 2 summers living and working at a local vegetable and meat farm. I have collected eggs in the morning, and  helped sow and grow vegetable under the midnight sun. I have been fortunate enough to live the farm to table experience. From seeing my dinner graze the field in the morning, to assisting my local butcher prepare it for the kitchen. This isn't just a project for me and my family, it's our way of life.

Risks & Challenges

Owning and operating a restaurant is a major challenge, however I am tackling this head on. The failure rate in the restaurants is 80% in their first 3 years. Knowing this I am not deterred. 

Reasons that contribute to restaurant failure in their first years include inexperience, sub-par food quality, spotty customer service, poor accounting skills, and  bad people management. I am fortunate to have experience in customer service, business management, food services, and logistics, and I consider myself very versatile. I am detail and task orientated which gives me the benefit of managing well under the pressure of a fast pace environment of varying energy levels. Being ambitious and driven by a strong work ethic, I took my first cooking job at the age of 13.  My enthusiasm and friendly nature make me a great team leader as well as purveyor of exceptional customer service. My most recent job consisted 3 years as sous-chef and front end manager in a successful locally owned and operated restaurant, and my experience there leaves me confident I have what it takes to make this business venture a success.

In addition to my own experience, I have a strong team of advisers and support staff lined up to help make Farmers and Foragers of Wild a success.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you wont be able to contribute monetarily to this campaign, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Please SHARE SHARE SHARE. If you know or have met me in any capacity that involves food, you know how passionate I am about anything that involves getting people fed. At the end of the day that is what this is about. Putting good food in people's bellies. 

Please share this campaign, spread the word and encourage those you know to contribute however they can.

Thank you!

story:
A Juicy Dream

Hello! My name is Nathalie Sousa, creator of Press &Co., a cold pressed juice + wellness lifestyle company in the making. This business idea was originated when I decided to make conscious and meaningful changes in my life. I began incorporating juicing into my daily routine and quickly realized the superpowers of fruits and vegetables.  I firmly believe that what we put in our bodies plays an integral role in how we live our lives. And I am living my best!

I am launching Press & Co. hoping to motivate and inspire people to live a better lifestyle. I am ready to make healthy living accessible, effortless and FUN in the Gulf Shores community and beyond!

Bringing Press & Co. to life has taken over my days and nights, and it has become the sole object of my dedication. There is so much involved in the making of this business, from education to expensive equipments.  I am so close to making it all happen, but a financial barrier stands in my way. I got to a point where I can no longer hold a full-time job while pursuing this dream. I’m writing to you to humbly ask you to consider supporting me.  Everything is ready to roll, from branding to kitchen space; I even have a few customers and I have already started juicing for them.

With all that being said, I decided to reach out to you in hopes to raise the rest of the money I need to finally open to the public. The community is excited; I have a local business on board to serve as my storefront (a partnership with Foam Coffee & Shop), and also a New Orleans business interested in distributing my juices. There are a lot of things happening right now and I am afraid these opportunities will be missed if I don’t start soon. 

What I Need

Your advance will go toward the total of $4,000 I need for the rest of the commercial equipment approved by health department, supplies, and also to help pay for some of my bills for one month so I can finally start and focus 100% on it. 

I've put everything I have into opening Press & Co., emotionally, physically and financially, but it was a calling and passion I needed to pursue. The success of this campaign is vital to getting Press & Co. off the ground.

Thank you in advance for your contribution. You have no idea how much it means to me to have your support. I can't wait to start juicing for you all!!!

"Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much” ― Helen Keller

The Impact

Press & Co. will provide local access to juices and foods that will help enhance the health of our community. We are providing options to busy workers and families who want to consume fresh unpasteurized, nutrient-dense juice but don't have the time to make it. We want to change the conversation about food and increase awareness that eating clean does not have to be boring! 

In addition to my connection with local health and fitness experts, my own health journey, experiences and understanding of the nutrient value of various vegetables, fruits, superfoods, and supplements will allow Press & Co. to be a hub where health-related topics and food as medicine news will be shared. 

Perks

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone can help financially, and that’s okay! There are other ways to support this campaign.

Follow us on Facebook & Instagram.        

Tell your friends and family about this project who would be interested in helping. 

I appreciate all your support!

Nathalie Sousa

story:
Your Contribution Supports Honeybee Health and Great Mead

Our mission has always been to support Virginia Agriculture by building honeybee population and supporting our local farmers. We are the first and only meadery in central Virginia.

We use locally sourced ingredients to produce award-winning meads.

We provide financial support to local charities. In 2018 we worked with Proyecto Agroecologico Campesino (PAC) to support farmers in need in Puerto Rico, the Pink Ink Fund, and the Humane Society of the U.S.

As we approach our 4th year in business it is time to broaden our footprint.

With your support we will:

  • expand our tasting room in Scott's Addition.
  • grow our apiaries.
  • transfer our production operation to work more efficiently and grow into new markets.

Contribute today to help us meet our goal and become part of our hive. We've got some sweet offerings for you.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's how we will use our funding:

  • 60% goes to equipment, construction, and operation of new facility
  • 30% goes to managing existing hives and establishing new ones
  • 10% goes to support of our fundraising efforts and perks

What's in it for you?

  • Perks are available at different giving levels
  • You will receive a worthy gift that recognizes your support
  • Your efforts help us to transition and grow, support bee health, and local farmers

Our Growth

More than $193,700 in 2017 revenue and 40% annual growth since opening in 2015.

As a small operation, $98,000 in sales in the first year through tastings and bottle sales at the meadery and through wholesale to markets in and around the city of Richmond. Having the mead available at retail locations provides revenue and helps introduce the product to a larger audience.

Your Impact

We have been growing organically and re-investing our profits into the business. While growth has been consistent, we require a bit more capital to take our next step. We would like you to be part of our growth and our future.

  • If you love great mead and the folks associated with it this is your chance to be part of the movement
  • We started our current business on the results of a crowd sourced project in 2014 (RVA Mead Lab)
  • Black Heath Meadery is built upon a commitment to our customers and strong relationships among you, our farmers, and other collaborators in the fermentation industry

Risks & Challenges

Your contributions allow us to move our vision forward, and we are committed to being great stewards of your gifts.

  • We have operated for nearly four years with solid revenues and growth. This doesn't guarantee future success, as market factors can change.
  • We look forward to growing the Richmond market and expanding to Northern VA, south to Tidewater, and into Southwest VA.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand it isn't always possible to help financially:

  • Please share this campaign with as many people as you can!
  • Check out the Indiegogo share tools to make this as effective as possible!

Thanks for helping us share the buzz!

story:
Short Summary

I've been a doula at several births, bringing women to labor and delivery, ensuring the entry of healthy newborns into this world.

Now it is my turn. My partner has gifted me with a own bundle of joy and it is my vision to have a full-lotus- in water-location birth, in the care of my midwife and partner, ensuring the safe delivery of my newborn.

Im aiming for the following locations
Why Hawaii?
Hawaii has healing vibrations and is naturally serene and peaceful. Not only that, I'm experiencing an strong pull to Hawaii and it seems that this being coming through will have it no other way.
Why Jamaica?
It's the land both of our families migrated from. We would have support there. We'd face challenge with citizenship however.
Why Poconos?
It's close enough but far away. Still providing that feel of nature. Allowing accessibility and support for our families to aide us through the process and post-partum.
So please help me to gift this to my first born and give me the opportunity to bring forth life in a non-invasive and natural way, in complete love and gratitude from involving beautiful strangers such as yourself in my birth plan.

We humbly thank you in advance for contributing to this beautiful moment.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We are looking to raise approximately $12,000 USD to cover the expenses of travel/lodging for me to birth and heal postpartum, a midwife, and encapsulating the placenta to be ingested by me! An old practice that helps reduce any postpartum effects and strengthens my connection with baby .
  • All contributors have the comfort of knowing they've added peace to the planet and the joy of being part of a Sacred Birth!
  • If the goal isn't met, any funds raised will still be put towards this cause.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Births are sacred and this practice of bringing newborns into this world while maintaining their peace, and not prematurely cutting their umbilical cords has taken a backseat. These days women look forward to the pain of labor and an epidural. My goal is to begin to restore faith in our power as womben to enjoy our births. My goal is to educate the masses on the detrimental effects of ignorance around birth. The children are our future, and from conception to birth, they should be treated with care and respect!
  • Midwifery care and births such as this one are often not covered by insurance (depending on the residing state), and unfortunately many women  miss out on exploring alternative birthing possibilities simply because they cannot afford it. There is a radical movement happening across the globe to shed more light on this subject. In the meantime, grassroots campaigns such as this one are aiding in spreading awareness.
  • I've been a doula at several births which has made a difference in the Mom's level of awareness and trust in her capabilities. At each birth I've been present at, the Mom has pushed her baby thru her canal and avoided a C-Section.
  • We are all in this together!

Risks & Challenges

As much preparation and rallying as I do, complications are very real. I am in no way shunning the hospital setting in these emergency situations. I can only do everything in my power to NOT make this a reality for myself and my unborn child. However, midwifes are equipped to handle these circumstances.

  • I'm only human.
  • If I do need emergency intervention, it is included in my birth plan and I'd still be working with a midwife who works within a hospital setting.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, please get the word out and send positive vibrations to the success of this campaign:

  • Begin educating yourself on natural birthing.
  • Share on your social media networks or spark a conversation with family and friends!

It's the seeds we plant today that impact tomorrow.

I've been a doula at several births which has made a difference in the Mom's level of awareness and trust in her capabilities. At each birth I've been present at, the Mom has pushed her baby thru her canal and avoided a C-Section. We are all in this together!    Risks & Challenges  As much preparation and rallying as I do, complications are very real. I am in no way shunning the hospital setting in these emergency situations. I can only do everything in my power to NOT make this a reality for myself and my unborn child. However, midwifes are equipped to handle these circumstances.  I'm only human. If I do need emergency intervention, it is included in my birth plan and I'd still be working with a midwife who works within a hospital setting.    Other Ways You Can Help Even if you can't contribute, please get the word out and send positive vibrations to the success of this campaign:  Begin educating yourself on natural birthing. Share on your social media networks or spark a conversation with family and friends!   It's the seeds we plant today that impact tomorrow.

story:
Notre histoire

Jubi est une société de jus d'hibiscus sadariffa (bissap) et de jus de gingembre crée en 2013 par Marie Nouyrigat dans un petit atelier de fabrique à Montreuil dans la banlieue de Paris. Ces jus sont rafraîchissants, mais ils ont aussi des vertus médicinales connus et vendus partout en Afrique de l’Ouest depuis belle lurette.

Ressortissante de Burkina Faso et vivant en France depuis 12 ans, Marie a hérité des recettes secrètes de jus de sa grand-mère. Entrepreuneur dans le sang, avant le lancement de Jubi, Marie vendait déjà ses jus à Montreuil sur tous les évènements de la ville depuis 7 ans et elle avait déjà une clientèle fidèle et prête quand sa société a été créée.

Jubi vend sur les festivals tels que la Fête d’Humanité, le Festival des arts de la rue à Aurillac, Festival de Reggae à Bagnole-sur-Ceze ainsi que sur les marchés, dans les boutiques d’épicerie fine, les bars et les restaurants à Paris et en province.

Ses jus sont fabriqués à la main avec les produits biologiques et ils sont en cours d'homologation bio (AB). Ils sont suivis et analysé par le laboratoire Agro-All à Evreux, Normandie pour la normalisation et la stabilisation des jus.


Nous avons besoin de vous !

Aujourd’hui, pour diversifier son offre et attirer les distributeurs de boissons, Jubi a pour objective de lancer deux nouveaux produits : le jus de tamarin et le jus de baobab (pain de singe). Nous avons tous les produits pour lancer la fabrication importés du Burkino Faso, mais nous avons besoin des analyses supplémentaires demandées par notre laboratoire.

Par ailleurs, pour la visibilité de notre marque et l’aisance de distribution de nos produits au niveau local, nous souhaitons acquérir un triporteur électrique comme celui sur la photo.

Nous croyons que les jus artisanaux africains bios restent une alternative désaltérante et saine face à l’alcool et aux boissons sucrés.  Nous souhaitons rester une entreprise artisanale,  suffisamment solide pour pouvoir faire face à la concurrence du marché des boissons.

Our Story

Jubi is a hibiscus sadariffa juice and ginger juice company created in 2013 by Marie Nouyrigat in a small workshop in Montreuil in the suburbs of Paris. These juices are non-alcoholic thirst-quenching refreshments, to accompanying meals or as a substitute to soda, but they also have medicinal virtues and have traditionally been drunk throughout West Africa.

Originally from Burkina Faso, Marie has lived in France for 12 years. She inherited these secret juice recipes from her grandmother. A born businesswoman, before creating Jubi, Marie had already sold her juices in Montreuil at all the city’s events for the last seven years, creating a faithful clientele before launching her company.

Now, Jubi is present at festivals, in bars and restaurants and in gourmet food stores in Paris, throughout France, and with several small distribution outlets abroad.

Jubi juices are fabricated by hand with organic ingredients and are in the process of receiving organic certification. The company is followed by Agro-All in Evreux Normandy for the standardization and stabilization of its products.

We need your help!

Today, in order to extend its offer and attract larger juice distributors, Jubi would like to introduce two new products: tamarind juice and baobab juice, also widely sold throughout West Africa.

We have imported from Burkina Faso all of the raw products to begin fabrication, but our laboratory requires that we do supplementary analyses.

Furthermore, in order to market our products more easily and visibly on a local level, we would like to acquire an electric delivery tricycle like the one in the photo above.

We believe Jubi’s handmade African juices remain a refreshing healthy alternative to alcohol and soda and would like to remain an artisanal juice company stable enough to compete in the beverage marketplace.

story:
Bentonville has a super-rare opportunity to construct a community radio station by October 2016.

We need to raise $15,000 for equipment, engineering and licensing.

KOBV's mission is to share Bentonville event info (festivals, gatherings, parties, etc.) and play an eclectic mix of music (rock, electronic and hip hop).

Fortunately, KOBV has made it through the application phase and is FCC-approved to start constructing Bentonville's very own community radio station. 

This is a rare chance for community radio because most cities' radiowaves are completely full and the FCC hasn't accepted LPFM applications since 2001 - and it may never happen again.

Thank you for your support. Every dollar helps.


Extra background info: 

My name is Garrett Brewer and I love downtown Bentonville and good radio (e.g. KUTX). In 2013, I heard that there may be a chance to start a new radio station in Bentonville so I applied for a low power FM (LPFM) license for Bentonville's only open frequency (103.3 FM). Through a very lucky series of events, the FCC granted me a construction permit!

We've got until October 2016 to create the station and have everything up and running. We need to raise $15,000 for equipment, engineering and licensing. KOBV's mission is to share Bentonville event info (festivals, gatherings, parties, etc.) and play an eclectic mix of music (rock, electronic and hip hop). Let me know if you have any questions or would like to get involved.

story:
We have nearly reached the $1000 mark. Donate and help us reach $1000 and we'll reveal what these two guys does with 10 mopani worms.... you won't believe it....

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KZ1cHv23dMw

OUR VISION: DRINKING COFFEE TOWARDS COMMUNITY UPLIFTMENT

https://youtu.be/KZ1cHv23dMw

We are based in Limpopo Province, South Africa, in the town of Louis Trichardt. We are surrounded with many social-economic challenges we want to turn into opportunities for community UPlift.

With the dawn of the café’s centenary year, we have celebrated the occasion by UPgrading our 40 seater coffee shop to better serve our community. This has been a crucial development because the more customers we are able to serve, the more we are able to donate to our registered NGO partner.

UPcafé’s first priority as a business is to donate 10% of all profits to our registered NPO partner. The drive behind our equity, ethics and excellence is to first serve the community through generosity and then fulfill the demands of business.

OUR NEED:

The first phase of our UPgrades is completed, which includes: new shop fitting, an improved menu, an expansion of our take-away services, new apparel for our staff, open wifi and electronic payment facilities. Your contributions will enable us to:

·  Complete the second phase of the UPgrade which involves replacing our 10 year old coffee machine with a commercial machine.

·  Improve the workflow to serve more customers and better quality coffee.

·  UPcafé currently employs four ladies, of which three are mothers who are the sole breadwinners in their families. Your generosity will not only help us to obtain a commercial coffee machine but will also enable one of these mothers to train as a qualified Barista.

If we are able to exceed our campaign goal, the funding will go towards

·  Helping the two other mother’s employed by UPcafé to obtain proper qualifications in their field of work (Chef/Baking).

·  A baking oven.

·  Bigger community UPliftment projects.

OUR CHALLENGE:

·  Our current coffee machine delays our entire workflow and does not cope with the coffee shop demands. Working with a ‘office coffee station’ is just not the ideal for a café

·  UPcafé funded the first phase of UPgrades and we desperately need to obtain a commercial machine without compromising our contributions towards community UPliftment.

·  A great looking café is only as good as the coffee it is able to serve.

OUR NPO PARTNER: ()

Our NPO partner has been serving our community for 25 years and uses our contributions to:

1.  Care for community members who are in need.

2.  Establish equality and peace between different cultures and races.

3.  Provide counseling for vulnerable individuals.

4.  Train leaders from rural villages in the region.

5.  Establish a hub from which resources can be distributed responsibly into the community.

6.  Run UPliftment programs for children and youth in our community.

7.  Assist students and rural leaders with obtaining tertiary qualifications.

8.  Offer support to the elderly.

9.  Run a community choir that embraces all cultures and races.

Please follow these links to check out our NPO partner:

http://www.agapegeneration.com/

http://www.agapeafricanchoir.com/

HOW YOU CAN HELP US:

·  Please donate to our campaign. There are a few creative and interesting perks that can change lives in South Africa.

·  Please share our campaign with your friends on all media platforms.

·  Follow us on our facebook page https://www.facebook.com/upcafeltt?fref=ts&ref=br_tf

CONTACT US:

marcelvn86@gmail.com

https://www.facebook.com/upcafeltt

UPcafé – UPgrades towards greater community UPliftment.

Thank you for considering our project!

Marcel van Niekerk

story:
Our names are Amy and Cooper.

We are asking you to be a part of our big dream of building a tiny home.

In return, you will receive your choice of our handmade ceramics, gift packages, and experiences, through this campaign.

If you would like to order more than one of an item, please email us at ourbigtinydream@gmail.com.

We are using this campaign as a store where your purchase goes straight towards our dream. A perfect place to do your Christmas shopping!

We will also be donating 15% of the raised funds to Color Outside the Lines, a non-profit organization based in Portland, Oregon that believes creative self-expression is imperative to the development of a growing child. They provide programs for foster children, underprivileged children, their families, and their community. They nourish creative development and provide artistic outlets for children.

Meet Amy and Cooper

Cooper is a ceramics artist, and Amy is a massage therapist. We are so grateful to have careers that fulfill ourselves deeply, and the Portland community has been a huge contributor to our paths to these careers. 

Read more about us and our careers at ourbigtinydream.com

The situation

With the struggle of finding affordable housing, we have been saddened with the thought of leaving Portland, but we know that would be taking steps backwards in our careers. We feel that we need more time in this amazing city, surrounded by the like minded people that have been by our side while approaching these unconventional careers.

The answer for us....tiny living.

The average cost of building a tiny home is $23,000, a much more attainable price for a space that we would not only own, but have the ability to move with us where ever the future may lead. This also gives us the opportunity to pay off student debt and become financially stable.

More info on tiny home costs here.

Our Plan

The money raised in this campaign will be used to construct a tiny house that is 224 square feet. We will be using salvaged materials as much as we can as well as using the awesome resources that Portland has to offer such as tool libraries (a place you can borrow tools for free...how cool is that?!)  

So why donate to us?

We know we are not the only people dealing with the high price of rent and housing, not only in Portland, but pretty much everywhere, so why donate your hard worked money to us? 

1. You will be receiving your choice of perk, which embody who we are and the careers we love. We are even guaranteeing that some of them will get to you before Christmas!

2. You will have peace of mind that your donation is allowing us to continue along the path of the careers we love so much!

3. We will be sharing our journey with all of our supporters. It will be an exciting and life changing adventure that we know you will enjoy watching come to fruition. 

We know that you work hard for your money, so we want to thank you so much for your time and donations. We really can't express our gratitude enough, even if you can't donate, we thank you for taking taking the time to learn about and share our adventure with your friends. 

We are simply wanting to live a sustainable life (both environmentally and economically), have the ability to continue working in our careers without the financial strain of high priced rentals and truly embrace all that life has to offer.

We are beyond grateful for the support we have received thus far and continue to receive in this venture.

We will be posting updates on a regular basis telling about our process (our accomplishments and struggles), events we will be hosting, the lessons we are learning, the amazing people we are sure to meet, and the great handmade perks we will be offering our generous supporters. 

We can't thank you enough for your time and support. Every tiny bit helps :)

Follow us on:

Instagram

Twitter

Facebook

Website/blog

If you want to support us directly through our careers,

you can schedule a massage at medicinetreemassage.com,

or purchase ceramic goods on Cooper's Etsy page


Thank you again for all of your support,

Amy Gwartney and Cooper Jeppesen

story:
Handmade One Of A Kind Pens


You have heard the phrase that the pen is mightier than the sword and when you think about it, then you see that there is some truth in that statement.

With the stroke of pen people can start a war and also end it, you can destroy or save the environment with a pen, you can sign the fate of another person and you can make people happy or unhappy just by the way you use the pen.

With the stroke of a pen you can fix problems or make them much worse.

As you can see then you can change everything with the stroke of a pen.

With that in mind I need to do my best in making my pens, because you never know what decisions are sealed with that particular pen.


Introduction

Hello and thank you for taking a look at my page on Indiegogo.

My name is Thordur Sigfridsson but everybody knows me by my nickname, Tóti Sigfrids.

I am Icelandic and live in Sweden with my wife and two kids, Melissa 10 and Daniel 8.

Melissa and Daniel are also my team mates in this campaign.


For the last few years i have been running my own, one man transport company but last year I was forced on an involuntary retirement due to a severe back problem.

So we had to make some changes in the household, mainly by switching roles.
My wife started working and I became the stay at home parent taking care of our kids,

Even though I got the better part of the deal then I really need to do something else then sit at the computer all day while the kids are at school and I also want my wife to be able to do something besides working two or more jobs to support us.

So I had to find a solution for these two problems.

I have always loved working with wood and metal so I acquired an old lathe and started making pens.
Now I have made quite a few of them and I am in the process of starting my own pen making business.

And that is why I am turning to you all, in the hope that you will help me make this happen.


The concept


I will be selling the pens on the internet through my own webpage but I am also going to sell them on fairs and markets.
In Sweden there is a long tradition for weekend markets and many of them have visitors in the tens of thousands every day.
I am in the process of building a market trailer in which I will have my whole workshop. The plan is to have it ready next summer and travel between markets with a “live workshop” where visitors can see the making of a pen.


Funding Goal

I am hoping to gather enough funding to get a better lathe and better tools as well

With your help I hope to raise 1.000 $ that will be used in the following manners:

500 $ for a new lathe
150 $ for tools
100 $ for setting up a homepage
250 $ for the material and shipments of the pens that are the perks

In the lucky event of exceeding that goal I will publish my stretch goals and the extra perks to carry on.


The Pens

In order to craft a superior pen, I want to use superior materials.  I have therefore in my campaign selected a handful of pens and the unusual material that make them unique.

Each pen is made of the best available hardware but what makes these pens stand out is the "wood" used in them.
It is called "Acry-woods" and is made up by blending two completely different elements.
A natural wood called Spalted Hackberry and an acrylic material with a twist.
Part of the acrylics glows in the dark.

How brightly and what portion of the pen glows, is different between each pen.

This campaign is the only time I will offer pens with this material.

They will not be available on my webpage.


How I Make the Pens

Every pen is handcrafted and no two pens are the same. Each pen starts out as a block of wood/acrylic material which is called a pen blank, and a handful of hardware components.

The inside of the pen is lined with a brass tube that allows for a strong structure .
To begin the process, a hole must be carefully drilled through the end of the pen blank. .
The hole has to be drilled straight through the middle of the blank.
Once the hole is drilled, then the tube must be glued to the inside of the hole.

Once the blank has been prepared and the tube inserted, it is then ready to turn on the lathe. I use wood turning chisels to carefully shape the blank by hand,
The blank is then sanded using different grits of sandpaper from 120 to 600. I then put 20 coats of hard finish on the blank, followed by sanding with a set of 6 MicroMesh pads that sand and polish it all the way to 12,000 grit, giving the blank a super-smooth surface
After the finish has been applied and sanded, the blank is removed from the lathe and assembled with the hardware. The assembled pen is then examined and analyzed to ensure that it meets all quality standards. If so, the pen is then complete, and ready to be used!


Perks

Following perks are offered as thanks for your support.
All perks are available in all 7 colors.

Each perk will be shipped in a velvet pouch.

All fountain and rollerball pens will be shipped in a wooden pen box like this one


As soon as you have made your contribution, I will send you a questionnaire regarding material and color choices.


My campaign has flexible fundings, so all supporter will be receiving their perks

Keychain

A keychan with a hidden compartment, perfect for your medication or for emergency money to carry.

Aremis

Aremis is a slimline twist style pen with a touchscreen stylus at one end.

Iris

A short and somewhat heavy twist style pen.

Poseidon

A sierra twist style pen which fits perfectly in your hand.
The size and weight contribute to a smooth and even writing.

Ares

A pen in the shape of a bullet.
The mechanism that is used to push the ink cartridge out is designed to imitate the mechanism on a rifle.

Apollo

Baron II, available both as a Fountain pen or a Rollerball. 

Hera

A delicate Jr. gent pen,  available both as a Fountain pen or a Rollerball.
This pen is a little bit bigger then Apollo 

Zeus

A beautiful instrument, available as a fountain or rollerball.


The fountain pen features a Iridium Point Germany nib.

The hardware is made from solid brass pieces. The only plastic bit used in this pen is for the female thread in the cap. It is necessary to use the nylon thread because it helps the lid secure the pen in place. A metal on metal thread will result in the plating wearing away very quickly.


This hardware is made in Taiwan to high specification.

And is beautifully detailed 

 

We also offers perks with combination of these pens.

Color choices

All perks are available in following colors.



Other ways to help

I know that not everybody are in a position to contribute to our campaign but if you share this page with your friends, family, or followers and ask them to share it too, then that would be incredibly helpful and appreciated.
You have our most sincere thanks for spreading the word!



Risks and challenges

There are two foreseeable challenges that this project may face but they will not prevent the completion of the project.

The first involves the numbers of Backers that this project receives. If I receive far more Backers than I anticipated, then I will need to extend the timeline of this project. If this problem arises then I will contact you and inform of the cause of delay.

The second of the risks involves the materials used for this project. Given that I have chosen to use a unique and rare material, there is a risk that a particular color may not be available at that particular time. Usually, all of these colors are available or will be available in few weeks.

If however the color that you have selected is not available, I will let you know and give you the option to either select a different color or wait until the color that you originally selected becomes available again.

I would like to thank you again for taking the time to look at my page and if you decide to assist me in my quest I will be extremely grateful for your support.
story_txt:
Handmade
One Of A Kind Pens


You have heard the phrase that the pen is mightier than the sword and when you
think about it, then you see that there is some truth in that statement.
With the stroke of pen people can
start a war and also end it, you can destroy or save the environment with a
pen, you can sign the fate of another person and you can make people happy or unhappy just by the way you use the pen.

With the stroke of a pen you can fix problems or make them much worse.
As you can see then you can change
everything with the stroke of a pen.
With that in mind I need to do my
best in making my pens, because you never know what decisions are sealed with
that particular pen.

Introduction 

Hello
and thank you for taking a look at my page on Indiegogo.

My name is Thordur Sigfridsson but everybody knows me by my nickname, Tóti
Sigfrids.
I am Icelandic
and live in Sweden with my wife and two kids, Melissa 10 and Daniel 8. 


Melissa and Daniel are also my team mates in this
campaign.


For the last few
years i have been running my own, one man transport company but last year I was
forced on an involuntary retirement due to a severe back problem.

So we had to
make some changes in the household, mainly by switching roles.
My wife started working and I became the stay at home parent taking care of our kids, 



Even though I got the better part of the deal then I really need to do
something else then sit at the computer all day while the kids are at school
and I also want my wife to be able to do something besides working two or more
jobs to support us.

So I had to find
a solution for these two problems.
I have always
loved working with wood and metal so I acquired an old lathe and started making
pens.
Now I have made quite a few of them and I am in the process of starting my own
pen making business.
And that is why I am turning to you all, in the hope that you will help me make this happen.

The concept


I will be selling the pens on the internet through my own
webpage but I am also going to sell them on fairs and markets.
In Sweden there is a long tradition for weekend markets and many of them have
visitors in the tens of thousands every day.
I am in the process of building a market trailer in which I will have my whole
workshop. The plan is to have it ready next summer and travel between markets
with a “live workshop” where visitors can see the making of a pen.

Funding Goal
I am hoping to gather enough funding to get a better lathe
and better tools as well
With your help I hope
to raise 1.000 $ that will be used in the following manners:

500 $ for a new lathe
150 $ for tools
100 $ for setting up a homepage
250 $ for the material and shipments of the pens that are the perks

In the lucky event of exceeding that goal I will publish my stretch goals and
the extra perks to carry on.

The Pens
In order to craft a superior pen, I
want to use superior materials.  I have therefore in my campaign selected
a handful of pens and the unusual material that make them unique.
Each pen is made of the best available hardware but what makes these pens stand out is the "wood" used in them.It is called "Acry-woods" and is made up by blending two completely different elements.A natural wood called Spalted Hackberry and an acrylic material with a twist.Part of the acrylics glows in the dark.
How brightly and what portion of the pen glows, is different between each pen.
This campaign is the only time I will offer pens with this material.
They will not be available on my webpage.

How
I Make the Pens
Every pen is handcrafted and no two
pens are the same. Each pen starts out as a block of wood/acrylic material
which is called a pen blank, and a handful of hardware components. 
The inside of the pen is lined with
a brass tube that allows for a strong structure .
To begin the process, a hole must be carefully drilled through the end of the
pen blank. .
The hole has to be drilled straight through the middle of the blank.
Once the hole is drilled, then the tube must be glued to the inside of the
hole. 
Once the blank has been prepared and the tube inserted, it is then ready to
turn on the lathe. I use wood turning chisels to carefully shape the blank by hand, 
The blank is then sanded using different grits of sandpaper from 120 to 600. I
then put 20 coats of hard finish on the blank, followed by sanding with a set of 6 MicroMesh
pads that sand and polish it all the way to 12,000 grit, giving the blank a
super-smooth surface
After the finish has been applied and sanded, the blank is removed from the lathe and
assembled with the hardware. The assembled pen is then examined and analyzed to
ensure that it meets all quality standards. If so, the pen is then complete,
and ready to be used!
Perks
Following perks are offered as thanks for your support.All perks are available in all 7 colors.
Each perk will be shipped in a velvet pouch.
All fountain and rollerball pens will be shipped in a wooden pen box like this one




As soon as you have made your contribution, I will send you a questionnaire regarding material and color choices.
My campaign has flexible fundings, so all supporter will be receiving their perks

A
keychan with a hidden compartment, perfect for your medication or for emergency
money to carry.

Aremis is a slimline
twist style pen with a touchscreen stylus at one end.

A
short and somewhat heavy twist style pen.
Poseidon



A
sierra twist style pen which fits perfectly in your hand.
The size and weight contribute to a smooth and even writing.
Ares



A
pen in the shape of a bullet.
The mechanism that is used to push the ink cartridge out is designed to imitate
the mechanism on a rifle.

This hardware is made in Taiwan to high

story:
www.pawpawmurphys.com

Murphy’s Corn in a Jar

The Other White Whiskey

With the courage to choose quality over quantity, Rick Murphy changed White Whiskey, better known as Moonshine from the ground up. Painstakingly following his Great, Great, Great, Great "Paw Paw" Samuel Aldous Murphy Senior’s old world recipes brought to this country in 1850 from Ireland.  The result is a richer and more robust flavor moonshine, with a sweet aroma that is pleasing to the plate without compromise. Distilled at Muddy River Distillery under the watchful eye of Rick Murphy.

The Players

Tony Curella Founder and President, Andy Dollinger Graphic Designs and Marketing,   Rick Murphy the legend.

What Else Do We Do

Carolina Heritage Co. - The Vision

What started as a vision is now our goal, to supply our customers and retailers with the best possible life style products, by exceeding their expectations through innovative products at great prices. Our slogan states “A North Carolina Life Style Company”. Lifestyle is a broad term because people live in so many ways with different cultures, ethics, ideals and ideas. So whatever your background is, let Carolina Heritage products put a little ray of sunshine in your daily life. Enjoy… www.carolinaheritageco.com

Tea for Two Anyone?

Brew a cup of our Great Aristocrat Herbal Tea of your preference. Our herb tea has the added benefit of being packed with antioxidants, which could help relieve the symptoms of that cold or sore throat. Combine a teaspoon of honey and lemon juice with Raspberry Aristocrat Tea and ginger and a shot of Paw Paw Murphy’s Moonshine for the perfect drink while curling up on the couch when it's cold outside. All our products are Certified Organic with the exception of the Sweet Matcha.

The Potato Bag - 

We take great pride and care in the design and construction of Mr. Spud Jacket. Our bag is all-sewn, measuring approximately 10 x 10 inches, our bag is designed to hold two to four potatoes and the flap opens easily to allow you to remove the potatoes without burning yourself! Mr. Spud Jacket is designed for use in microwaves for preparing any type of baked potato, such as a white, red or sweet potato (yam), and can also be used for corn on the cob, acorn squash, spaghetti squash, broccoli, cauliflower, carrots & more. The cooking is done in a much faster time than most conventional cooking techniques.  www.mrspudjacket.com

Today we are MOVING FAST

Paw Paw Murphy’s “Mule Kickin’ Midnight Shine: We are in production and distribution of our White Moonshine. 

Here are our bottles in the ABC shops :


The formulas and labels for our other 6 flavors have just gotten approval from the TTB Federal Government and will be ready for distribution in 45 days or less. (Peach Cobbler, Amaretto, Peppermint Patty, Orange Marnier, Lemon Drop and Apple Pie). FLASH-The Amaretto is now in production and will be available for sale in two weeks. We have contracted with Southern Wine and Spirits to be the exclusive broker for North Carolina, Virginia and West Virginia. We presently distribute in the state of North Carolina. Once we have saturated those markets we will have the opportunity to go into the other 37 states Southern Wine and Spirit distributes in.  Our White Moonshine is now available on line with Schneider’s of Capitol Hill (a warehouse liquor distribution center and liquor store in Washington DC) Available in 48 states. www.cellar.com

Aristocrat Herbal Tea and Mr. Spud Jacket are ecommerce products featured on Amazon and our own website (Carolina Heritage Co.).  We are in the process of adding one new item to our product line, an Organic BAOBAB Powder from Senegal which is a powerful new superfood and Africa's best-kept secret until now. Its unique nutritional profile offers more Vitamin C than oranges. 

The funds raised in this campaign will be used to further launch the 6 flavors of Paw Paw Murphy’s Moonshine. (Peach Cobbler, Amaretto, Peppermint Patty, Orange Marnier, Lemon Drop and Apple Pie).

Challenges and why should you invest with us?  

Your generous contribution will help move the company forward at much faster pace.  You can say I remember when a small start-up company by the name Carolina Heritage “a North Carolina Life Style Company” had a dream in the year 2015 and I was able to help them see that dream come true.  For your willingness to have faith in our venture you will receive some of our fabulous products to enjoy for your generous contribution. The funds raised in this campaign will be used to further launch the 6 flavors of Paw Paw Murphy’s ”Mule Kickin’ Midnight Shine”.


Social Responsibility

Tony Curella, the founder of Carolina Heritage Co. is an activist of the Noon Optimist Club of Gastonia, NC which supports  the Boy's and  Girl's Club of Gastonia NC supported by community fund raising and donations ( http://bgcgreatergaston.org ) .

Your support goes towards projects that benefit the youth of the Gastonia area.  Some of the projects include essay and oratorical contest with scholarship opportunities at state level. “Get Fit” summer exercise program, partnering with YMCA certified trainers for teens.  Back–To-School supplies for foster children partnering with Jaycees. Feed 150 to 200 children daily with a healthy and nutritional meal.

5% of your perk goes towards this project!


Other Ways You Can Help 

Please help tell the world   about our campaign. Use the indiegogo tools or facebook and Twitter to let your friends, colleagues, communities and others know about the Carolina Heritage Co.'s mission. Every person we reach can make a difference and help to get Carolina Heritage Co. products on shelves in stores near you. Some of the most valuablephy support you can give is by simply spreading the word to as many people as you can.

The Legend 

We at Paw Paw Murphy’s and Carolina Heritage want to thank you from the bottom of our hearts for taking a look at of campaign. Five generations of Murphy’s.

Our Perks


Thank you !

Every person we reach can make a difference and help to get Carolina Heritage Co. products on shelves in stores near you. Five generations of Murphy’s.Our Perks



Thank you !

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Sangu Delle. I was born in Ghana, and have lived in Ghana and also in various cities in the US. As you heard in the video, in 2007, my college room-mate Darryl and I sat on the steps of Weld at Harvard University and discussed our various upbringings in inner city Indianapolis for Darryl and in Ghana for me. My father is a doctor and a human rights activist and I had grown up with refugees from the civil wars in Sierra Leone and Liberia, which profoundly shaped my worldview.

Darryl and I were frustrated with charitable models and wanted to figure out sustainable ways to make an impact on the lives of others. We were blown away when we discovered that a billion people globally didn't have clean water. And almost three billion did not have access to safe sanitation. We take clean drinking water and our WCs for granted, but it's crazy when you realize that wow this many people do not have this 'luxury," this basic human right. 

We co-founded a 501(c)(3) called the African Development Initiative and worked on projects in water and sanitation, microfinance, education and agriculture among others. We decided to focus our efforts exclusively on fighting water and sanitation poverty, starting in Ghana and are now rebranded as CLEANACWA. 

Building latrines and working with communities to build and sustain water infrastructure isn't the sexiest work in the world. But we're excited and passionate about it!! 

Why? 1)  Because it matters. Too many lives are lost because of lack of access to clean water and sanitation. I've hugged too many mothers who have lost children to diarrhea because of E-coli infested springs. We can solve this. It's not rocket science.

2) Because we are different. We are taking a fresh innovative exciting approach to what has traditionally been a slow moving sector. We don't want to exist in the next 20 years. We are really hoping the challenge will be solved by then and have this crazy ambitious goal: can we achieve 100% coverage by 2025?! We don't care about credit and are only focused on results and outcomes. We are lean and have little overhead. We are completely focused on sustainability and community ownership. We don't just solve water and sanitation problems; we empower communities. We train them on leadership, financial literacy, and give them the tools they need to have ownership of the infrastructure, to maintain it, and to use the human structures in place to catalyze their village's development in other areas. It starts with water and ends with community transformation.

So Why Kili? Kilimanjaro is the highest peak in Africa and the highest free standing mountain in the world! It's a monumental artifact of nature, and represents the giant challenge we face in taking down water and sanitation poverty. Help me take down the mountain and take down water and sanitation poverty! I hope to raise $15,000 for cleanacwa so we can build boreholes in 5 communities in Ayensuano. This is part of a cluster of 120 villages where we are currently working. And it will be so much fun. I've been training last few months and I'm super excited. I hear the views of the Serengeti are mind blowing. I'll share pictures of the climb with all of you :)

I was originally just fundraising for cleanacwa's water projects, but recently in Ghana, the capital Accra experienced record floods that sadly took the lives of over 200 people, most of whom died in a tragic gas explosion leaving many poor homes without breadwinners, kids without parents, really sad. I hope to raise an additional $10,000 in partnership with Assist Ghana to support relief efforts and to assist the victims and survivors. I'm typically worried about transparency with relief fundraisers and want to make sure that any monies raised goes directly to the victims. Stories from the Haitian earthquake relief about mismanaged funds saddened me and I'm committed to ensuring this doesn't happen. 

You can check out more of my work at sdelle.com and cleanacwa.org. 

Thank you so much for your generous support!! God Bless You!

What We Need & What You Get

  • $15,000 will go towards our projects in Ayensuano, specifically to 5 villages for the construction of a borehole to provide clean drinking water. 
  • $10,000 will go to Assist Ghana towards relief efforts. They are keeping receipts, invoices and taking pictures of all donated items. The plan is to deliver care packages to 1,000 victims. I have personally vetted all the individuals involved and have full confidence and trust that every dollar donated will reach the victims. Both cleanacwa and Assist Ghana are doing this on a voluntary basis and there is 0 overhead associated with our flood relief efforts.
  • If we don't reach our goal, we will divide up whatever we raise proportionally between the 2 causes
  • If you are a US taxpayer, you will get a tax deduction letter from cleanacwa (we are a registered 501(c)(3) based in Massachusetts).

The Impact

Clean Water

  • This will impact an estimated 8,000+ community members in 5 villages
  • The impact of clean water goes beyond diarrhea incidence rates and infant mortality; it also affects gender and education (young girls typically are the ones who fetch water early in the morning and end up missing a lot of class hours as a result)
Victims of Accra Floods
  • This will impact 1,000 relief victims

Risks & Challenges

Clean Water

  • Sustainability of water infrastructure and sanitation / hygiene 
  • cleanacwa always works with the community, local government and local NGOs to create community led committees that are trained in book-keeping, pump maintenance and all the different skills needed to ensure the sustainability of the infrastructure. We take a three-pronged approach to water and sanitation and engage in household latrine construction and intensive hygiene education to complement the provision of water infrastructure. The community invests in every project, no matter how small, so they have a stake and feel ownership. In addition, we monitor each community for up to 5 years post-project completion.
Victims of Accra Floods
  • Ensuring donations reach actual victims
  • We are working closely with vetted local organizations to ensure that the donations and care packages reach the victims

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word!!! Thank you
