I hope to raise an additional $10,000 in
partnership with Assist Ghana to support relief efforts and to assist the
victims and survivors. I'm typically worried about transparency with relief fundraisers and want to make sure that any monies raised goes directly to the victims. Stories from the Haitian earthquake relief about mismanaged funds saddened me and I'm committed to ensuring this doesn't happen. 
You can check out more of my work at sdelle.com and cleanacwa.org. 
Thank you so much for your generous support!! God Bless You!   What We Need & What You Get 
$15,000 will go towards our projects in Ayensuano, specifically to 5 villages for the construction of a borehole to provide clean drinking water.  $10,000 will go to Assist Ghana towards relief efforts. They are keeping receipts, invoices and taking pictures of all donated items. The plan is to deliver care packages to 1,000 victims. I have personally vetted all the individuals involved and have full confidence and trust that every dollar donated will reach the victims. Both cleanacwa and Assist Ghana are doing this on a voluntary basis and there is 0 overhead associated with our flood relief efforts.


 If we don't reach our goal, we will divide up whatever we raise proportionally between the 2 causes
If you are a US taxpayer, you will get a tax deduction letter from cleanacwa (we are a registered 501(c)(3) based in Massachusetts).    The Impact Clean Water  This will impact an estimated 8,000+ community members in 5 villages The impact of clean water goes beyond diarrhea incidence rates and infant mortality; it also affects gender and education (young girls typically are the ones who fetch water early in the morning and end up missing a lot of class hours as a result) 
Victims of Accra Floods

This will impact 1,000 relief victims

   Risks & Challenges Clean Water  Sustainability of water infrastructure and sanitation / hygiene  cleanacwa always works with the community, local government and local NGOs to create community led committees that are trained in book-keeping, pump maintenance and all the different skills needed to ensure the sustainability of the infrastructure. We take a three-pronged approach to water and sanitation and engage in household latrine construction and intensive hygiene education to complement the provision of water infrastructure. The community invests in every project, no matter how small, so they have a stake and feel ownership. In addition, we monitor each community for up to 5 years post-project completion. 
Victims of Accra Floods


Ensuring donations reach actual victims
We are working closely with vetted local organizations to ensure that the donations and care packages reach the victims


   Other Ways You Can Help Please spread the word!!! Thank you

story: Keeping Roxanna available to the community requires maintenance, upkeep, and of course money to continue to pay the mortgage. All money raised will go strictly toward the June 2015 mortgage.

story:
What we want to do.

Iron & Grain Co. will bring fresh, locally inspired cuisine to those looking for a truly unique catering experience.  Clients will be able to choose from a number of different dishes, many of which will be prepared on our wood fired grill, as well as a selection of local craft beer, wine and cocktails. All food and beverages will be served through our mobile bar & grill, a remodeled 1959 Chevy Viking 60 Series Flatbed Truck.

Here is a picture of our truck pre-restoration and fabrication.

The tenets of Iron & Grain Co. are as follows:

1.  Provide the highest level of customer experience.

2.  Cultivate and serve food with integrity.

3.  Leave our community better than how we found it.

Our goal is to create a company that not only enriches the lives of the people we serve, but also promotes growth and sustainability both among the local farms and vendors we work with as well as the local community we live in.

Once the truck restoration and fabrication is completed it will look similar to these trucks.


What we are asking for...please.

We are asking for $5,000.  This money will be put towards the fabrication of the truck.  We have committed everything we can to the company, but we need some extra help from you to make Iron & Grain Co. possible. 

We are also interested to see how passionately people feel about a business/model such as this; one that is built around supporting local economic growth and sustainable food practices.  We strongly believe in this concept and its growing popularity is evident in many other businesses/categories, so we are hopeful that people will feel compelled to help Iron & Grain Co. become a reality. 

What else can you do to help?

Whether you can or can't donate, we ask that you please share this campaign with your friends.  Also, we would love to get in touch with you or anyone you know who might be able to help Iron & Grain Co. in other ways.  We are always looking to grow our network of local businesses, farms, and other people who might be interested in working with us and helping support the growth of our local community.

Much Thanks,

story:
ISSUE 4 - 'A LENS INVERTED - ESSAYS ON GREAT BRITAIN' - has interviews with Taylor Wessing Portrait Prize finalists, a Richard Billingham expose and even words by Will Self. It’s packed. Full of features*. Not quite in boxes yet. Help us get it packed – into boxes – by pre-ordering a copy --->

 

Richard Billingham - from "Ray's a Laugh"

 

Jon Tonks - "Empire"

 

 

 

‘I have decided that Matter is dark, brooding, melancholic, interesting, thought-provoking, real, hard-hitting and challenging. I learnt a lot’. (Reader about Essays on the Middle East)

 

MATTER is an independent, biannual publication of 13 academic and photo essays surveying the social reality of conflict and political tension. By concentrating on a region politicised by big media in each issue, we depart from the traditional domain of politics, deconstructing speculative narrative through philosophy, gender studies, contemporary literature, psycho-geography, art and architecture. 

 

 

Why we need your support:

 

We have decided to go completely advertisement-free for the fourth issue. We are a refreshing voice on current affairs, distinguished by being independent and critical. These qualities sustain our publication and we are not willing to sacrifice them. 

As we are a not for profit publication, all of the money coming in goes directly to the production of the publication. We are asking you to help us make the fourth Issue "A Lens Inverted - Essays on Great Britain" our best one yet. Of the £4,000: 

£2,800 - will go towards the printing costs

£600 - will pay our writers, guest Illustrator and other artists 

£450 - will go towards funding a venue for the launch of the 4th Issue

£150 - will pay our GIF designer

 

Of course, tit-for-tat: we will give you rewards for your donations. Look to the right.

 

 


Last year we launched our latest Issue 3 'People Between the Lines - Essays on the Middle East' which featured (among others) well-established journalists from Al-Jazeera and the Telegraph, the bombastic Brendon O'Neill, the award-winning photojournalist Zoriah Miller and investigative journalist Jenny Nordberg. In case you missed it, a few copies are still available to purchase online here. 

While the ultra-fast tabloid cycles can only afford a slither of airtime before moving onto the next conflict, our aim is to reflect back on political tension with the benefit of hindsight and a critical eye, especially once conflict has dissolved from the eye of the public. 

 

 

Our Team:

Robin - graphic designer - Robin dreams about typography, and, as a mini-lawyer in training, in particular which law subjects are most appealing according to their corresponding textbook’s font.

 

 

 

Florien - culture editor - A 21st century female Dionysus. Lover of all things tasty and beautiful.

 

Liv - editor at large - Liv would ideally love to be a perpetual student of the arts and although her favourite author is Beckett, she does laugh occasionally. She's the metaphorical glue to every issue produced so far.

 

 
Become an advocate of Slow Journalism. Treat yourself to one of our rewards.
 --->

 

*on the rise of UKIP and the legacy of EDL; psychogeograhy of London; ASBOs and other legal mechanisms used to discipline the British society.

 

Photographs by Katie Sheppard

Digital Art by Mary Sims-Howlett

Music Score by Adrian Lo

story:
The Project.
         Palm Beach Board and Train will provide a safe, comfortable, free roaming, pampered environment for dogs. The facility will include a fenced in yard, swimming pool, and comfortable dog beds and furniture for dogs to lounge around on.  Dogs will be treated like family. They'll also be trained while their owner is away. Owners will come back to dogs with better habits and behaviors than when they left.          
        
                        
About Me.
         I left corporate America (where I worked as a recruiter) several years ago to pursue my passion for working with dogs. I've since built a substantial clientele of dog owners and large and small dogs of all breeds (from 12 week old lab puppies to 120 pound American Bull dogs); and with clients and dogs with special needs. Many clients attest to their satisfaction with my work and effectiveness of my training. Accordingly, the bulk of my work has come through referrals.
         This is a business built on trust and relationships--and my clients have motivated me to build the business from the ground up.
            

What We Need & What You Get
      In addition to my gratitude, contributors will be an important part of building a vacation community where you can bring your dogs for years to come.
        You may also look at this campaign as an investment in your dogs short term future and long term future training and care. Take a look at our perks page. If you contribute to this project, your dog is guaranteed to reap the benefits through quality training and care. 
                           
Big Picture                                                                               
            I'm creating Palm Beach Board and Train to bring my work to the next level, and realize my dream of owning a top notch board and train space that will provide peace of mind to owners and dogs.
           This campaign will allow me create a successful training business.  Monies will go towards securing the facility/physical space for dogs and to outfit it with training equipment (dog equipment, fencing, etc). A portion will also go towards bonding, insurance and future specialized coursework to work with dogs for the deaf/blind and other service dogs. 
            Working with animals has always been where my heart is. I have a natural affinity for animals and innate ability for training them. Join me in building an amazing facility where I will use my passion for training to do good work for dogs and owners.  
             My years of working in the corporate world and substantial client base will ensure a successful business.
             Help me to do this thing right.

My Motivation
  •  Over the years, clients and colleagues have approached me looking for a safe, trustworthy place to board their dogs. Extensive Research taught me there are a shortage of good places for dogs to stay, be given freedom to roam and provided with attention and exercise. I've never felt comfortable bringing my own dog to a kennel when I go away.  I realized there was a niche for quality dog boarding, and knew it would be a great fit.  I realized I'd found my calling. 
  • At the same time,  good training for dogs is sometimes reversed when dogs spend too much time away from their owners in kenneled conditions. Likewise, dogs often become despondent and insecure and act out after spending too much time in facilities where they aren't given enough personal treatment.
  • It's been my dream for a long time to open a board and train to share the love I have for dogs and my innate talent and experience training dogs full time, in a manner that is integral to my life and the life of the dogs. Palm Beach Board and Train will be a safe community where dogs and owners feel comfortable, and a place dogs look forward to coming back to. Owners can rest assured that dogs will be thoroughly taken care of; that we will pay attention to dogs special medication, diet, exercise and behavioral needs.

 Tandem Training with Zoe
     Zoe is a one and a half year old German Shepherd I rescued. She gets along with all dogs and kids and helps to socialize other dogs. She is a good training partner.  I picked Zoe because she is such a good natured, easy going dog with an instinctual ability to help with training. 
                                                                     

Other Ways You Can Help
       Please share this campaign with dog owners, dog lovers and your contacts, family and friends. It really is appreciated.

story:
That's a lot of sandwiches... What's the inspiration?

When I was growing up, my mother made me a peanut butter and jelly sandwich for lunch every single day of school. If you count all the school days there are over 13 years, that's 2,340 sandwiches! 

My name is Jessica Olah, and I am a multi-media artist with a background in visual arts. 2,340 PB&J Sandwiches is a performance piece during which I will exercise empathy for my mother, who made me these sandwiches from September 1990 - May 2004. Along with exploring what it is like to commit to making this many sandwiches, I would like to recognize her for making this daily gesture of love. I plan on performing this piece in a gallery space in New York City over a period of 5 days. It will be open to the public, and I'd love for you to join!

My mother is also an artist - a photographer - and in the gallery space where I perform this piece, I will be showing photographs that she took in 1989 of the step-by-step process of making a PB&J. 

Helping me with this project is HATE Creative, a not-for-profit collaboration of artists, whose aim is to make the world a more beautiful, kinder place.


What's going to happen to all those sandwiches?

All of the sandwiches made during this project will be donated at the end of each performance day to the Bowery Mission, who accepts donations 24 hours a day to feed the homeless and hungry. 


What We Need & What You Get

Needs

To complete 2,340 Peanut Butter and Jelly Sandwiches, I will need support in the form of:

  • Peanut butter - a 9 lb tub of peanut butter ($66 from Once Again) has 135 servings. I will need 18 tubs, totaling $1,188
  • Jelly - Beth's Farm Kitchen (a local NY jam maker) sells 3-gallon containers for $177. I'll need 18 gallons for a total of $1,170
  • Bread - Hot Bread Kitchen's Pepita Multigrain loaf, at $2.89/loaf will be $846.77 for 293 loaves
  • Bags - plastic sandwich bags $72
  • Gallery or performance venue for 5 days will be approximately $2,400
  • Transportation - of sandwiches to the Bowery Mission $50
  • Prints - of my mother's photographs - 15 prints at 24"x30" at $120 each totals $1800
  • Felt Hearts - felt plus pins for HATE Creative to hand cut 2,340 hearts $200
  • Press printing - postcards for the gallery event $184
  • Stipend for the artist, film crew, and HATE Creative - $3,000

This comes to approximately $11,000


What You Get

The Impact

Through this project, I will be exploring the themes of empathy and understanding, the mundanity of daily tasks in motherhood, and the lack of value given to some of those seemingly minor tasks. I also hope to pass on some of that care that I received to the people receiving the sandwiches at the Bowery Mission. I would like to provide them with sandwiches that are made with high quality, local ingredients that they usually may not have access to.
HATE Creative, who gives out felt hearts as a way to pass empathy and love to those they come across, will be including a heart with each sandwich. They know a gift as small as a hand-cut heart can brighten or even change someone's day.

It would mean so much to me to be able to complete this art piece. Beyond recreating the thousands of moments my mother spent making school lunches, and feeding the homeless, I expect there are unknown lessons waiting for me in completing this project. In every endeavor approached with an open mind and heart, there is room for growth and change to occur. 
If I don't reach my entire goal for 2,340 PB&J sandwiches, I will still plan to perform this piece. If I only get enough to purchase the ingredients of the sandwiches, I can still make the piece privately and donate 2,340 sandwiches to the Bowery Mission. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to help by donating, I would still love your help in getting the word out! Let your friends know by sharing on FB, tweeting about it, or plain old email. Indiegogo also has some easy to use share buttons on the left side of the page! Thank you so much for your interest in this project, it means so much to me.

story:
Small summary

We are "Hirue" a team of 9 young entrepreneurs from Bilbao (Basque Country, Spain). We are traveling to different hamlets around Pune in India this coming September for two months. The idea is to take our main project forward there, which is bringing some water filters with us and hand them to the people also teaching them how to use them.

We believe on getting clean water to every single person who needs it. Is a basic necessity for us human beings, and as this is just not like that in the real life yet, we want to contribute on the way there.

With the help of the collaborators we will be able to bring these filters which makes contaminated water drinkable, they last 5 years with a daily use of 100 people. Because the problem in India is not that they don’t have water, but drinkable water.

This project would also keep many people from contracting diversity of diseases from the contaminated water.

What do we need

We need 15.000€  for taking the project forward; buy the filters, take them with us, travel around the Indian hamlets, to provide the training needed.

Risks and Challenges

The risks and challenges that we could face along the way to reaching our goal are such as: not getting the financing needed and therefore not being able to take as many filters as we have planned with us. We would like to take as many filters as possible with us for a bigger impact and for this project not to end on that journey but for it to be able to get to much more people.

Other ways you could help us

The 9 of us want to thank all the people that support this project and that will help us make this possible.

Any little kind of help is huge for us, you might not be able to help us financially but you can help us spread the word and help us take it as far as you can.

THANK YOU TO ALL OF YOU, WITHOUT YOU THIS PROJECT WOULD HAVE NOT BEEN POSSIBLE!

Other collaborators

In order to make this project successful we are also looking for other kind of collaboration; sponsors or collaborators (private or public companies) who see the value of our project and want to help us to make it happen.

We already have to support of one collaborator, Alzola basque water, that provides us with all the personalized water bottles for the sale; and also a sponsor, Basquetour, public society of the Economic Development and Competitiveness Department of the Basque Government with an input.

Thank you for this help and from here we want to tell everybody who is interested on helping or getting farther information to contact us.
story_txt: Small summaryWe are "Hirue" a team of 9 young entrepreneurs from Bilbao (Basque Country, Spain). We are traveling to different hamlets around Pune in India this coming September for two months. The idea is to take our main project forward there, which is bringing some water filters with us and hand them to the people also teaching them how to use them.We believe on getting clean water to every single person who needs it. Is a basic necessity for us human beings, and as this is just not like that in the real life yet, we want to contribute on the way there.With the help of the collaborators we will be able to bring these filters which makes contaminated water drinkable, they last 5 years with a daily use of 100 people. Because the problem in India is not that they don’t have water, but drinkable water.This project would also keep many people from contracting diversity of diseases from the contaminated water.What do we needWe need 15.000€  for taking the project forward; buy the filters, take them with us, travel around the Indian hamlets, to provide the training needed.Risks and ChallengesThe risks and challenges that we could face along the way to reaching our goal are such as: not getting the financing needed and therefore not being able to take as many filters as we have planned with us. We would like to take as many filters as possible with us for a bigger impact and for this project not to end on that journey but for it to be able to get to much more people.Other ways you could help usThe 9 of us want to thank all the people that support this project and that will help us make this possible.Any little kind of help is huge for us, you might not be able to help us financially but you can help us spread the word and help us take it as far as you can.THANK YOU TO ALL OF YOU, WITHOUT YOU THIS PROJECT WOULD HAVE NOT BEEN POSSIBLE!Other collaboratorsIn order to make this project successful we are also looking for other kind of collaboration; sponsors or collaborators (private or public companies) who see the value of our project and want to help us to make it happen.We already have to support of one collaborator, Alzola basque water, that provides us with all the personalized water bottles for the sale; and also a sponsor, Basquetour, public society of the Economic Development and Competitiveness Department of the Basque Government with an input.Thank you for this help and from here we want to tell everybody who is interested on helping or getting farther information to contact us.

story:
Help kick-start new social enterprises make a difference to ‘people and planet’ - here in Scotland and beyond...

SIIA 2014-15 Awardees (current year)

The next SIIA programme starts in September 2015. We need you to make it a reality for 2 (or more) new and emerging social entrepreneurs. Become part of their journey and improve lives here in Scotland (and beyond).

For the past 3 years, the Social Innovation Incubator Award (SIIA) has helped 30 social entrepreneurs start, pilot, grow, and establish their business, having a positive spiral effect locally, nationwide, and even internationally. There have been new jobs created, loads of volunteering, tremendous growth in the ‘beneficiaries reached’ and of course, the financial growth and viability of new-start businesses.

Become an investor in our collective future, receive great rewards, and feel good about yourself! Your contribution will make a real difference, and rewards start from just a fiver!

£10,000 will cover the cost of two places on the SIIA programme. If you help us to raise more, even better, we'll be able to offer more places, more workshops, give them more time in coworking space, and more 1-2-1s with experts!

All of the funds raised will go straight into covering the costs of coordinating and delivering the SIIA programme. The Melting Pot is a non-profit social enterprise where all profits are re-invested into our mission: to stimulate and support social innovation.

Check out very short video (above) – and hear just what being on SIIA has meant to various people who’ve got a great idea for social impact and are figuring out how to deliver innovative and complex business models.

The Perks...

We have some amazing perks for you – as an individual and/or as an organisation - give them a browse, see what takes your fancy and help yourself to one, two, or three!

Aw, and don't forget to spread the word, tell your friends and loved ones using #SIIAmoney for the Twitter lovers.

The Impact of SIIA!


SIIA 2012-14 Impact

For a full description and to understand the impact of SIIA, read our longitudinal evaluation of the first two years of the programme. It's a short and easy read - nothing too dry! 

See our SIIA Alumni  - here are some fantastic examples of social entrepreneurs who’ve got through those first few years of pain and are making progress thanks to SIIA. 

Remade in Edinburgh - Sophie Unwin

A social enterprise which teaches repair skills and works in partnership to campaign for goods to be built to last.  At our central hub we teach sewing and mending, computer repair, run workshops from leather repair to bookbinding, and sell good quality affordable laptop and desktop computers. Watch their video!

Fathers Network Scotland - David Drysdale

The national torchbearer and voice for fathers in Scotland by supporting individuals and organisations to positively engage, support, and empower men to become the best fathers they can be.

We work with a range of organisations to help them make their family services father-friendly and inclusive. We do this through practical services including training, events, peer support and research.

Emotion Works - Claire Murray

Develops and shares new ideas and approaches that enable all children to learn and communicate about emotion in meaningful ways. Watch their video

Who’s The Melting Pot? Why are we doing this?  What’s involved?

The Melting Pot is Scotland’s Centre for Social Innovation. We opened in central Edinburgh in the heady days of 2007.  Since then we’ve been helping thousands of people working for ‘more than profit’ to work, meet, connect, learn and share with each other.

The Melting Pot understands the complexities, trials and tribulations of the journey of creating & developing a  social enterprise – we’ve been there, done that and got the T-shirt.  That is why we are uniquely placed to provide some well crafted assistance, knowledge and connections - through the SIIA programme.

Good becomes great when we work collaboratively with others. Over 20 partners generously contribute their expertise into the programme, and others get involved as mentors and board members.

The 12 month programme is designed and delivered by social entrepreneurs especially for social entrepreneurs, taking a structured approach, covering topics built around the Business Model Canvas, delivered through group workshops, 1-2-1s, mentoring, Action Learning Sets, and coaching. These are delivered by practitioners, all experts in their own fields and our partners in the programme.

SIIA also provides the all important ‘incubation space’ within our coworking resource base, located in the heart of Edinburgh.

Thank you...and welcome to the world of SIIA!

* If you'd like to give some of your time as well as money, talk to Mohammad (SIIA Coordinator) about becoming a mentor to one of our Awardees!

* If organisations wish to receive an invoice, this can be provided - let us know.

story:
My beautiful sister is successful: she is a qualified doctor,she is loving and kind, and one day wants to have a family. There's just one not so small issue in the way... She also suffers from Anorexia Nervosa and has been trying to recover for the last eight years. 

My sister has tried many means to recover, but unfortunately there has been no suitable or successful methods in Australia. My family were fortunate enough to meet Carolyn Costin, the founder of Monte Nido Treatment Facility in California: a facility that has one of the most successful rates of recovery in the world.  We were so excited to see my sister and Carolyn click, and for the first time in a very long time we began to feel hopeful. 

This treatment facility  is going to cost 1500 US dollars per night and the minimum successful amount of time spent there is 6 weeks.  This average at about $ 63, 000 US dollars. Your help will go toward the cost of travel, as well as the cost of a minimum of six weeks treatment.  By donating you will supporting my sister in recovery and be changing the lives of not only my sister, but every single person who loves her.  

According to the strategic template on ' My Campaign Pitch' I have to tell you about the perks. I'm sorry I wont be able to give you any material things because every cent I have to spare will be going toward my sister. However, I think the best perk will be is that you will transform my sister's life. She will be able to perform her role as a doctor to the best of her ability and maybe even one day she will go on to help others in recovery.  She will able to go for a run without feeling guilty and my mother's hair might not go grey as quickly. 

I would like to thank you in advance for your kindness and look forward to telling you all about how well my sister is going at the Monte Nido Treatment Facility.  

To find out more about the treatment facility visit here http://www.montenido.com/ 

To find out more about my sister and her recovery visit her blog: http://recoveryisnevereasy.tumblr.com/

story:
What is happening here?

At first, please understand that English is not my native language.

So please be aware:

  • There will be typos.

A couple of years ago my friend Gero spent some time in Asia for his studies and to visit a part of his family who’s living in Singapore. Of course he was using this vibrant hub in Asia to hop in almost every country nearby. It was during these times where he fell in love with Cambodia and after we met and went back there again: So did I.

There's something about this country you can't describe. The wild, the nature, it's heritage and these awesome people who try to make a living day by day and still manage to stay unbelievable friendly and optimistic.

On our third visit we made contact with a French Business Owner who came up with a great idea:

  • Almost everything can grow in this country and there's practically no need for any artificial ingredients when it comes to agriculture.
  • Labour is cheap yes, but does it have to be unfair? Why not create a healthy business and give everyone who supports this idea a fair share?

On the other side there was us.

Me, currently a student but former working as a branch manager for one of Europe biggest cosmetics company and Gero: Not a student anymore but quite successful when it comes down to business computing.

The moment I tried these Cambodian products I thought to myself:

  • "You can't find this kind of quality and business ethics in our home city. Why aren't we funding this"?

So here we go. We already set up a working business model with our French partners in Cambodia, giving us the opportunity to introduce their products to the German and later to the European market. 


What could you possible sell in Germany that was made in Camobida?

The answer is quite simple: A lot.

We're planning to sell a wide selection of products beginning from handmade soaps and SPA products:


over to hand rolled candles, incenses and home perfumes:


Everything, including the ingredients, will come from the region around Seam Reap and is produced organic.

Clothes are another goal. We're already in contact with a French designer working in the area but we'll have to check the production chain in person before we make any commitments.


Why should I support you?

What makes us different from other companies? A valid question:

First: We don’t fake
If we say: "Handmade" we don't mean: Well yes, produced in China by a semiconductor, shipped to eastern Europe by another one, put together somewhere there BY HAND, shipped back to the stores and suddenly:

"Handmade".

Absolutely not! When we say "Handmade" we mean it. From production to packaging: Handmade and every piece thereby one thing: Unique.


Second: We won't lie
nowadays you have marketing campaigns worth millions of dollars all over the internet and TV doing one thing: Trying to touch your soul and/or conscience to generate particular feelings and bind it to a product. NO matter at what costs.

Well, we won't. The Cambodian products are awesome and they’re 100% naturally. The business concept is awesome because everybody involved gets something out of it. It’s the simple definition of a win-win concept.

Last but not least: It's not about the money
well, of course this campaign is about money. But it's not about making a ton of it by crowdfunding yet another overhyped tech start-up and trying to sell it to the highest tenderer.
It's about building a foundation. For us in the upcoming years and especially for the people who can be employed in Cambodia on a long term. 


Nowadays we know that simple foreign aid is not working at all, when it comes to these long terms. You need to bond between countries and industries. You need sustainability - not a one-time paycheck.

If you want to change a third world countries situation you have to give the people living there a steady income that makes it possible to send kids to school and get food on the table. And this can be done by doing one simple thing: "Fair employment" and a piece of the pie. So every Euro we make, we also make certain that a fix amount is being transferred back to Cambodia into the hands of the people living and working there. We do this by calculating their share into our buying price.

How much do we need?

Our goal is to get around 150.000 USD, so we will have to answer probably this one:

What's the money for?

1st: Stock - We need build up a stock with a sufficient product range. The longest production circle including shipping takes around 3 month. So we need to build up a sufficient stock for at least four month.

  • This will cost us around 20.000 USD

2nd: The Flagship Store

While we want to focus on B2B and online sales we Germans are a little bit strange when it comes to businesses without a proper "real" shop. So we definitely need to rent some space in Berlin and build a showroom or let’s call it a Flagship store

Since you also can't expect to make any money out of it at least within the first 2 years:

  • This will cost us around 48.000 USD for the lease (per year)

And another

  • 5.000 USD for the interior

3rd: Online Sales and Marketing

We don't want to stop in Berlin and hang around in one particular area. We're convinced that we're doing a good thing here and want to establish the product line all over Germany.

So yes, we will have to spend some money on marketing. Consulting and our online website.

We can save some money considering the software development of the homepage and so on. But getting the news out there will costs at least:

  • 15.000 USD for Marketing and PR

And since Germany is the Mecca of bureaucracy:

  • 27.000 USD capital investment for founding and financing a "GMBH" company that can act as a legal person.

However this money is not gone it's simply bound for creditors.

The rest will be 35.000 - this money will be our cash cushion in case of some legal works or problems with customs and delivery companies.

What happens to my money if you can't make the run?

What happens to your money if you can't make it to the 150.000 USD?

Well, if it's under 100.000 USD we will still give it a try and start only with online sells and stands on the city's farmer markets. If we make it to the 100.000 we will take an additional risk and finance the rest via private loans from friends an family.

Risks

The potential risk lies within the consumer. The products are really good but currently unknown.

Also, many people fall for false advertisement by major brands when it comes to beauty products.

To minimize that risk we will set up our business in Berlin which offers:

  • a high educational level
  • a high density
  • Critical Consumers (in a good way for us)
  • Start-up City
  • a high demand for "green products"
  • a high social background with the attitude to help or to change within the community

I want to help directly, how?

Tell people about our idea, travel to Cambodia and leave the main tourist tracks.

And please: Don't spent you money in the next NGO you can google up!

Thank you for your interest and reading (if you have come that far).

story:
Empatico to the Rescue Behind the Scenes - Released!!!

Meet the actors, the film-makers, the Empatico team in their finest hour!
----------

Look for the other episodes under the Gallery...




$359 billion...holy big money, Batman!

When people don't get along at work, the cost is a staggering $359 billion annually - in the US alone. And that's just not getting along at work. Think about all the other people we interact with: families, friends, committees, teams. 


The truth is, we don’t need a report to tell us about this pain – everyone has lived the frustration, stress, and even heartbreak of not getting along. 

What if a software product could drastically increase your understanding of why you click with some people and clash with others? What if it could show why and where people problems will happen and even map out how to solve them? 

Just imagine how much time and money and stress would be saved. At Empatico, we saw a way to help bring compatibility to the people and put a big dent in that $359 billion at the same time...


What the *#%@* is Empatico?

We are a technology company obsessed with human dynamics. For over 30 years, our researchers have been compiling data about interpersonal relationships. Out of this research, we have developed a product, also called Empatico, that measures compatibility. 

Compatibility has a direct impact on happiness, productivity and performance - making it an essential part of our personal and professional lives. And, at Empatico, we want compatibility insight to be at your fingertips - easy to find, easy to understand, easy to cultivate. 


Why is Empatico fund-raising?

We are a bootstrapping start-up with a product just itching to be released. But before that can happen, we need funds to conduct formal usability studies with users from our target market. These studies will entail:

* recording user interaction with the product's design

* compiling quantitative and qualitative results

* cycling design changes back into the product


Just for you!

We have added new perks for you...take a look! Any questions - just email me at teresa@empatico.ca!


Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word as far and wide as possible. The more people who visit the site, the more opportunities we have to get feedback and the better our chances of reaching our fund-raising goal - let's do this together and bring compatibility to the people! 


Let us know!

If you have questions about Empatico or our campaign, please contact us: 

teresa@empatico.ca


Thanks from Empatico

This campaign would not be a reality without the amazing One O Six Media - they helped us bring our video visions to life and created the absolutely fantastic finished products that you will see here over the next 30 days! Thank you One O Six Media!

----------

Look for the other episodes under the Gallery...







$359 billion...holy big money, Batman!


When people don't get along at work, the cost is a staggering $359 billion annually - in the US alone. And that's just not getting along at work. Think about all the other people we interact with: families, friends, committees, teams. 




The truth is, we don’t need a report to tell us about this pain – everyone has lived the frustration, stress, and even heartbreak of not getting along. 
What if a software product could drastically increase your understanding of why you click with some people and clash with others? What if it could show why and where people problems will happen and even map out how to solve them? 
Just imagine how much time and money and stress would be saved. At Empatico, we saw a way to help bring compatibility to the people and put a big dent in that $359 billion at the same time...


What the *#%@* is Empatico?



We are a technology company obsessed with human dynamics. For over 30 years, our researchers have been compiling data about interpersonal relationships. Out of this research, we have developed a product, also called Empatico, that measures compatibility. 
Compatibility has a direct impact on happiness, productivity and performance - making it an essential part of our personal and professional lives. And, at Empatico, we want compatibility insight to be at your fingertips - easy to find, easy to understand, easy to cultivate. 




Why is Empatico fund-raising?
We are a bootstrapping start-up with a product just itching to be released. But before that can happen, we need funds to conduct formal usability studies with users from our target market. These studies will entail:

* recording user interaction with the product's design
* compiling quantitative and qualitative results
* cycling design changes back into the product






Just for you! We have added new perks for you...take a look! Any questions - just email me at teresa@empatico.ca!


    Other Ways You Can Help Please spread the word as far and wide as possible. The more people who visit the site, the more opportunities we have to get feedback and the better our chances of reaching our fund-raising goal - let's do this together and bring compatibility to the people! 


Let us know!
If you have questions about Empatico or our campaign, please contact us: 
teresa@empatico.ca


Thanks from Empatico
This campaign would not be a reality without the amazing One O Six Media - they helped us bring our video visions to life and created the absolutely fantastic finished products that you will see here over the next 30 days! Thank you One O Six Media!

story:
Help us take over the publishing world! 

Okay that might be a bit over ambitious! 

Help us gain dominance in our specialized area of ebook publishing!

Contribute to funding the costs related to hiring additional staff to meet production demand.

Our Story:

Hello, and thank you for taking the time to read about my Indiegogo project. I represent estarbooks.com, an online publisher of classic Sci-Fi, Fantasy, Speculative Fiction, and Pulp Fiction eBooks. Recently, we have come to the realization that the market for eBooks of this caliber has grown, and we are in need of additional staff to help us keep up with the high demand we’ve begun to experience!

In the past year, there has been a resurgence of interest with consumers purchasing and downloading our eBooks. We have struggled to keep up with demand, but have found that our catalog, where you can discover new authors and rediscover old classics, has been sorely lacking due to our inability to keep up with our customers.

We are currently looking to expand our current catalog from 800 eBooks. In order to do so we are seeking funding to hire a second employee and purchase a second computer. Having a second employee will allow us to only create more eBooks in an efficient manner.

There are so many wonderful books out there that are not currently available we will also be working to make sure that we continue to expand our current eBook catalog!

Impact:

Over the past few years, the popularity of eBooks has only grown as consumers have realized the important place they hold in today’s literary market. eBooks are typically less expensive because the costs of publishing are less than for paperbacks. They are ecologically sound. The integrity won’t diminish over time. You can purchase an eBook at your convenience. You don’t need to leave your home or place of work. You don’t need to wait for a store to open. And you don’t need to worry about stock running out. You can literally hold your entire library of books in the palm of your hand.

Our eBook site is unique because it specializes in books in an “alternative” genre. On most other internet marketplaces, you can find a huge selection of books, but if you’re only looking for a specific genre, you’ll have a hard time finding exactly what you need. Maybe you like to read books by brand-new authors, those hidden gems that no one knows about yet. You’ll be hard-pressed to find them on a global site. By utilizing our site, our customers can be assured that they are getting the best of a unique set of literature genres, without having to sift through hundreds of other “mainstream” authors.

What We Need and What You Get:

We are looking to reach a funding goal for our expansion project of $8,000, taking into account the fees and taxes that will need to come out of our total funding. I have personally looked into a number of traditional funding options, but we have not been able to find something suitable for our unique situation. As a very small, online business, we are not eligible for a loan, and wouldn’t need the high funding amounts that would be available even at the “low” range. At the same time, we’re at critical mass when it comes to the work we’re able to accomplish without an additional staff person. We are simply at a standstill -- we haven’t been able to create more eBooks, covers, and get them uploaded to websites at the speed we normally would.

As our work is 99% handled through computers and related technology, we would also be needing the funding to cover the costs of paying for additional computer equipment for this additional staff person to use while working for our business.

We are also running low on ISBNs for our eBooks, and in order to get the best price, we have to purchase them in bulk. Your generous donations would also be used to purchase the ISBNs that we would need to officially publish the eBooks that come to our site.

To thank you, our generous backers, we are offering a number of exciting rewards! These range from a selection of our top eBooks to eBook reading accessories! Take a moment to review our rewards and select the donation amount that matches your desired reward, and we’ll send them out as soon as we reach our funding goal!

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can’t make a contribution at this time, there are still ways you can help. Please take time to share our campaign project with your friends and family via social media, email, and word of mouth. Your support could help us reach our goals, and help hire the staff member we need to keep moving with the current eBook trends!

Thank you in advance for your support!

Check out some of our perks!

A piece of art! 

A custom desktop wallpaper

A Robot USB Drive!

An awesome Robot USB Drive to hold all your ebooks on!

A mustache! 

An awesome mustache perfect for holding up your phone or ebook reader!

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I'm Cindy Stovall, host of Beauty & The 'Burg, a webcast/podcast on Life Improvement Radio. In July, 2014, I went on the air with a show devoted to promoting the arts, artists and culture of St Petersburg, FL. Though I've been a career nurse, spending the last dozen years at All Children's Hospital, I've always been a community servant and an avid art, music and theatre geek. This was an opportunity to contribute to the booming arts culture by promoting artists, events and venues, and to talk about what's so great about the beautiful 'Burg that we love to a world wide audience! To date, I have done 50 consecutive weekly shows, without repeat; the only local webcast to do that!


What We Need & What You Get

Beauty & The 'Burg has provided this platform for local performers and artists to promote themselves, their shows and their talent at little or no cost. Our following has grown to reflect a listening audience approaching 200,000 over the first year!

As we enter year 2, we need your help to keep providing this service to artists who can't always afford expensive advertising and promotion. We are seeking $3,000 to help with:

*Broadcasting costs

*Sound and recording equipment to do remote feeds outside of studio

*Website & Blog development to enhance guest promotion

*Advertising                                           

  

The Impact

This is what the City of St. Petersburg's Director of Cultural Affairs says about Beauty & The 'Burg:

"Cindy's passion and enthusiasm for the arts is incredible and comes across in her radio show and, in fact, most everything she is involved with.The radio show was a lot of fun and helps contribute to St. Petersburg's development as an arts destination for visitors and a creative hub of Florida for residents. We're fortunate to have the show and Cindy."

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

* Please listen to the show! Wednesdays @6pm www.lifeimprovementradio.com

                                                       Fridays @5pm www.lirafterdark.com

*Download podcasts on iTunes or www.lirpodcasts.com

*Please like, share and comment on  posts in social media. (Facebook.com/beautifulburg, @beautifulburg on Twitter and Instagram)

*PLEASE share this campaign with the Indiegogo share tools and help get the word out

story:
Short Summary

Cancer Plus 1 is a passion project that started March 03, 2013 the day my son's dad passed away from Hodgkin's Lymphoma at 30 years young, after a 26 month long battle with the disease.  James Rudolph Watts was young, fun, father of two boys who was supposed to live until he was 110 at least. Cancer came and struck with vengeance. I was his plus 1. I was with him through everything, the radiation, chemotherapy, and surgeries. We did everything that the doctors said and he kept getting sicker. I felt robbed. Like this is some bull. I made a decision that I wouldn't let his memory become a rest in peace T Shirt and a once a year after thought. Or eternal  sorry for your loss comment. I would turn his life and fight into the something big and meaningful. Here I was equipped with all this cancer talk vocab, health insurance knowledge, disability know how, and love with no one to give it to. So I randomly through social media contacted 7 other people who fought cancer like a boss and 1 that was fighting MS like a warrior and the rest is history. We adopted a baby a 4 years old cancer warior named Cassie along the way. We came together and wrote our stories turned it into a book and then turned the book into a free app. Whoop Whoop!  The healing process had commenced. We started Cancer Plus 1 as a custom healing agent and we help families base on their need.  We have paid for headstones hotels, flights,  aided families in getting there disability approved, paid for private chefs, catered funerals, Tshirts, you name it all for free and no real fundraising. 

On June 2, 2015 One of the authors of our book passed away Chapter 2 Rachel L Henley from synovial sarcoma its a soft tissue cancer.  Her passing or graduating like we call it. Reignited our fire and purpose.  

What We Need

This is what we are doing:

  • We are buying a building in Baltimore Maryland that will house families for free while they visit there families members being treated overnight at the cancer treatment hospitals in the local area. - $25,000.00
  • The building will have a mural of James and Rachel on the side of it. - $2,000.00
  • We are doing a documentary on cancer/MS and cancer/MS cures. - $5,000.00
  • We will be giving out 1 monthly grant to a family for $1,500.00 X 12 = $18,000.00.

What You Get

$1-25 Blessing  A praise on our @realcancerplus1 twitter
$25 Blessing Name Added to the supporters page of the C+1  APP
$50 Blessing Name Added to the supporters page of the C+1  APP and on the Website for 6 months. 
$200 Blessing Name Added to the supporters page of the C+1  APP , on the Website for 12 months, and on the closing credited of the documentary. 

$500 Blessing Name A praise on our @realcancerplus1 twitter Added to the supporters page of the C+1  APP , on the Website for 24 months, and on the closing credited of the documentary. 

The Impact

You might think why does the world need another cancer group. 

  • We are different because all of the founders have fought and beat the disease or experienced it first hand. 
  • We help the patients and their loved ones directly. 
  • Everything we do is free
  • We help the quality of life while you are fighting 
  • Your funds will immediately be used for greatness. 
  • Cancer is a group fight.

Risks & Challenges

We have overcome every single challenge that we have been meet with in the past and plan to continue with that track record.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Help US GET THE WORD OUT.. SHARE SHARE SHARE 

We need to make some noise about this campaign.

THANK YOU 
LOVE C+1 

#squad

story:
(Abstract in English/Resumen en inglés)

This Project focuses on youth unemployment. Nowadays with the best educated generation of history, many of young people can not find the first job. This is crucial to motivate them. We propose use the Solidarity in order to help them to achieve their “first job experience”. Your contributions will be used in new contracts for youth. The expected output will be a more motivated and trained youth with more options to continue their labour life. Examples of youth unemployment rates are USA (13,4%), France (24,1%), United Kingdom (16,9% ), Spain (52,4%), Ireland (23,9%). Source: Eurostat. 


LA IDEA

EL PROBLEMA DEL PARO JUVENIL

El desempleo juvenil es el principal problema de España. Si bien el paro en España es del 24% cuando nos referimos al “paro juvenil” la cifra es del 52,4%. Con este dato que sitúa a España como el país con más paro juvenil de la Unión Europea. Es bien conocido que ante este drama, los jóvenes españoles se encuentran con un panorama laboral desolador: pocas probabilidades de encontrar trabajo en España, plantearse emigrar como hicieron en su día sus abuelos y antepasados, serios problemas de autoestima, desesperación de ellos y de sus familias, … . Y eso que estamos ante la generación mejor formada de la historia: muchos presentan títulos universitarios e incluso master, pero no encuentran trabajo en España. La Unión Europea ha advertido a España que el paro juvenil es el problema más serio que tiene España.

UNA SOLUCION BASADA EN LA SOLIDARIDAD

Visto lo serio del problema, proponemos una solución de “urgencias” basada en la solidaridad. En efecto, creemos que lo que necesitan los jóvenes en paro es un CONTRATO. Así de claro. Lejos de ofrecerles más formación, más cursos, etc, que lo que hacen es engordar sus currículums (y finalmente no encontrar un contrato de trabajo), apostamos por dar a un problema urgente una solución urgente: a jóvenes desempleados ofrecerles un contrato para que tengan una ocupación retribuida. ¿De dónde vendrá el dinero? De la solidaridad de las personas, a través de sus donaciones convertiremos ese dinero en contratos para jóvenes desempleados que nunca tuvieron una experiencia laboral. Y la buena noticia es que en Solidaridad nuestro país es medalla de oro, como demuestran los datos: número uno en donantes de órganos, en apoyos a familias sin recursos, en bancos de alimentos, apoyos a inmigrantes,… etc. En fin, España es reconocida por su solidaridad. En esto basamos el presente proyecto.

Esta solución es una medida de urgencia para un problema urgente. Es compatible con cualquier otra fórmula que ayude a los jóvenes en paro a salir de esa dramática situación: planes de formación y capacitación, etc. Estaremos encantados de colaborar con otras entidades que quieran implementar este modelo en sus ciudades, ya que entre muchos podremos alcanzar un mayor efecto ante el problema del paro juvenil.

Ante una situación de emergencia nacional (y una juventud mayoritariamente en paro es en realidad una emergencia) ninguna medida de apoyo sobra. Todos los esfuerzos e iniciativas son bienvenidas y necesarias.

COMO LO VAMOS A HACER

Hemos constituido una Entidad sin Ánimo de Lucro que se denomina Asociación Solidaria para el Empleo y la Formación. El objeto es simple: ofrecer contratos a jóvenes desempleados en base a los fondos económicos que consigamos captar. De hecho ya lo hemos experimentado con éxito: hemos canalizado ya un total de 9 becas-contrato de inserción laboral a nueve jóvenes (3 biólogos, 2 químicos, 2 filólogas y 2 informáticos de nivel Formación Profesional) en el Colegio La Enseñanza de Santiago de Compostela. Nuestra idea con esta campaña de crowdfunding es captar más fondos para aumentar el número de incorporaciones entre jóvenes en paro. 

Hay muchas personas ilusionadas con este proyecto. En todo caso nuestra voluntad es ayudar. Quien se sienta llamado a apoyar el proyecto que ayude en base a querer practicar la solidaridad hacia una causa: nuestra generación de jóvenes que ven pasar los años sin encontrar su primera oportunidad.

Sabemos que estamos en el país número 1 en solidaridad. Nuestro proyecto es transformar tu aportación solidaria en contratos para jóvenes en el paro. La urgencia se deriva de que son el 55% de los jóvenes los que están en esta situación, de hecho ya se habla de la “generación perdida” y queremos contribuir con nuestro granito de arena a este enorme problema.

¡ Haz tu aportación económica y buscaremos el mayor impacto!

basamos el presente proyecto.
Esta solución es una medida de urgencia para
un problema urgente. Es compatible con cualquier otra fórmula que ayude a los
jóvenes en paro a salir de esa dramática situación: planes de formación y
capacitación, etc. Estaremos encantados de colaborar con otras entidades que
quieran implementar este modelo en sus ciudades, ya que entre muchos podremos
alcanzar un mayor efecto ante el problema del paro juvenil.Ante una situación de emergencia nacional (y una juventud mayoritariamente en paro es en realidad una emergencia) ninguna medida de apoyo sobra. Todos los esfuerzos e iniciativas son bienvenidas y necesarias.
COMO LO VAMOS A HACER
Hemos constituido una Entidad sin Ánimo de
Lucro que se denomina Asociación Solidaria para el Empleo y la Formación. El
objeto es simple: ofrecer contratos a jóvenes desempleados en base a los fondos
económicos que consigamos captar. De hecho ya lo hemos experimentado con éxito:
hemos canalizado ya un total de 9 becas-contrato de inserción laboral a nueve
jóvenes (3 biólogos, 2 químicos, 2 filólogas y 2 informáticos de nivel
Formación Profesional) en el Colegio La Enseñanza de Santiago de Compostela.
Nuestra idea con esta campaña de crowdfunding es captar más fondos para
aumentar el número de incorporaciones entre jóvenes en paro. Hay muchas personas ilusionadas con este proyecto. En todo caso nuestra voluntad es ayudar. Quien se sienta llamado a apoyar el proyecto que ayude en base a querer practicar la solidaridad hacia una causa: nuestra generación de jóvenes que ven pasar los años sin encontrar su primera oportunidad.
Sabemos que estamos en el país número 1 en
solidaridad. Nuestro proyecto es transformar tu aportación solidaria en
contratos para jóvenes en el paro. La urgencia se deriva de que son el 55% de
los jóvenes los que están en esta situación, de hecho ya se habla de la “generación
perdida” y queremos contribuir con nuestro granito de arena a este enorme
problema. 
¡ Haz tu aportación económica y buscaremos el
mayor impacto!

story:
My name is Jonathan, and I am your average male student trying to survive on practically nothing for the 3 years it takes to do a degree.

I was struggling to make ends meet each week, which i am sure is a very familiar feeling for most university students in this day and age, so I decided to try and bring in a little extra cash to support myself, while also working 25 hours a week for a market research company.

So I proceeded to source some products to sell on eBay from a digital software company. I had a chat with them and they agreed to supply software directly to my customers for me whenever I received an order, enabling me to avoid paying out any initial costs for stock etc.

With this I proceeded to advertise the software on eBay, sure that I had just sorted my financial struggles for a while.
Within a week I was receiving orders by the hundreds. I was making just over a pound profit on each sale, and slowly but surely was able to pay for the things I needed, and pay back a few people I had to borrow from to survive.

About a month into my eBay success, it all started to go downhill, massively.
I received a few messages one day from PayPal (the company that processes payments for eBay) stating that some of my customers had paid with stolen cards and hacked PayPal accounts, and I therefore would need to refund those customers every penny, as they would not protect me due to the nature of the product I was selling (digital software).
I immediately filed a case with the Police Fraud Department, who after weeks of investigation, said they could not track down the culprits as the majority of them resided in Eastern Europe, and had used fake U.K. addresses when purchasing on eBay.

There was nothing I could do, PayPal immediately withdrew every penny I received from these con artists from my account, along with their processing fees, and left me with a huge negative balance on my account.
They then proceeded to call me twice a day, trying to get me to pay off the negative balance immediately, which had run into the thousands. I was now in a seriously bad state, much worse than my original position, owing thousands to PayPal, having to borrow from my parents, taking out a bank loan, and acquiring a credit card in order to survive and pay my bills.

So I desperately need your help....please help me get afloat again, and fight this case for every honest person trying to make a living.

story:
An incredible way to make money, build credibility, and earn rewards in a fun, online social environment with your friends and family!

A new form of social website, Fair Promise, has officially launched and needs your support for improvement of the beta version. Fair Promise is introducing fresh ideas and far more than just conversation and photo-sharing. It’s aimed at guiding users to personal, professional, social and civic or political achievements.
Featuring the promise, the challenge, and the issue, Fair Promise opens the door to infinite applications in education, motivation, love, health, or even politics, aiming to create action, fix problems, and solve conflicts.

Anyone can use the site to issue a promise or a challenge to a friend, family member, colleague, or group. This revolutionary new site revolves heavily around the concept of ‘promise’. You can create open promises, where people can join freely, issue a promise to yourself that you will achieve personal goals, or promise someone else something privately or publicly.

Anyone can set a personal goal for themselves. We’ve all been there: New Year’s resolutions, generating more revenue from your business, losing a few extra pounds, etc., etc. The trouble is, without someone else holding you accountable, it’s just too easy to let those important goals in your life fall to the wayside.

This is where FairPromise.com comes in. At FairPromise, everyone states their goals publicly to friends, family, colleagues, giving you the opportunity to let others witness your pledge and offer support. They’ll also see you fail if you slip up, so the pressure to reach your goal is always on and positive. The people invited to witness your promise will offer you a different perspective of it, so you can apply corrections in real time.

The principle is simple: You promise to others. They will judge your results through a poll. A true democracy applied to any project. Where the user has the ultimate power. 


Fair Promise gives you the power to judge, the power to improve, the power to help and to do and to provoke action, to challenge others to do reasonable things.

Keeping promises will make you win Fair Coins, the site virtual currency, rewards and money. See below how it works.


Fair Promise treats all kind of promises, from a simple appointment or a love promise to sophisticated projects. A unique platform for all your needs: personal challenges, family projects, professional tasks or civic/political activities. You can now challenge anyone to do reasonable things and move forward your community, your group or just yourself.

The website is loaded with social features to keep the entire process fun, interactive, and challenging. Encourage others to post promises of their own and log in to check their progress, offer support, or even challenge their ability to follow through (see a challenge video).

Ask supporters for funds to help you reach your goal, and let the website send you regular notifications from your followers and other promises you are following. 

When it comes to improving your reputation,solving problems (see video), and fighting for worthy ideas and causes, FairPromise is the ideal platform to make it happen, and we would love your support to see it come to life with all the features! 

We need your help to improve the beta version of Fairpromise, to add new features and to create the mobile applications.

We certainly need your help to spread the word!!!

Features and roadmap for the development of new features: 

End of February 2016 
- improve design 
- improve flows, messages and notifications 
- create new feature: challenge to everyone (allows you to challenge many people in the same time, today this action is possible only challenging a group) 
- create new feature: link the action (allows you to group your actions under a program or see the relationship between two actions) 
- improving new feature: sign-up (for kids). Today we have a beta version of sign-up for kids which complies with 80% of the COPPA rules. We need to improve the reporting system, so the parents could follow effectively their children's activity.

May 2016: 
- Delivery of the mobile application for FairPromise

story:
The traditional guesthouse Alatinos (www.alatinos.gr)  is located at Pilio at village Pinakates.

The Pelion peninsula in Central Greece, 200 kilometers from the global interest monument of Meteora. Pinakates protected by law for architectural and cultural reasons. 

This house was built around 1860 and 30 years ago turned into a guesthouse by the Municipality.

Today needs immediate surgery to repair and maintenance to be saved and to be able to continue operating as a guesthouse. It has 6 double rooms with private bathroom and common area and kitchen.

story:
Hi there, my name is Mark Glassman, I am the proud owner of Sticks and Shakes®.
I am originally from the UK but now live in the USA.
I started thinking about the concept for Sticks and Shakes® whilst still living in the UK, but knew it had much greater potential to grow more rapidly in America. Four years later, I have three stores and would love to have 100 - join me!


 

The Sticks part of the business is centered around our desserts being served on sticks (like popsicles) you can then choose to handcraft them in dippings and toppings of your choice.The Shakes part is a based on the ever so popular concept of UK Milkshake bars.
In the UK you will find Milkshake bars in every major city, airport and shopping mall. In Europe, the Middle East and Asia, Gelato on sticks is one of the fastest growing dessert trends.

I’m really excited that you have taken the time to read my pitch; I truly hope you choose to make a contribution to the growth of Sticks and Shakes®.



On average, Sticks and Shakes® receive two to three franchise requests a week from people all around the world (without us doing any advertising for franchises).
We currently do not have the team or infrastructure to be able to launch our franchise model, that's where you can help!

The money raised will be used to pay for the setup of our franchise model, this will include:
Hiring personnel to join our team to run the future franchise department; hiring lawyers to draft all the franchising agreements and franchise operations manuals. We are going to enlist the help of Big Sky Franchise Team to help us with this process.

   www.BigSkyFranchiseTeam.com

We will be spending approximately $30,000 of the money raised to pay for the franchise lawyers. Another $30,000 will go towards paying for resources to run our franchise department (one employee to start with). Finally, we will spend around $20,000 for marketing the launch of Sticks and Shakes® franchises.

Hopefully with yours and everyone else’s funds we can open a store in a city near you soon.

So what do you get for contributing?

Hopefully in not too long a time, you may get a Sticks and Shakes® opening near you, so you can try all our delicious desserts all the time. If one does open in your City/State, then you will be invited to the grand opening, as you contributed to our campaign.

For now though, you’ll either have to visit Las Vegas to try Sticks and Shakes® or you can receive some of our super cool merchandising.
For those of you who just want to be part of a very cool dessert concept, contributing just a small amount will get your name listed on our Thank You page on our website.
Whatever you choose, we truly appreciate your support!


Our Super cool Fan cup, one of the perks available for our contributors.
( 24 Carat shake modeled by Chelsea)

In the event we do not reach our full funding target, then any money raised will go towards the cost of franchise lawyers, as we are 100% committed to getting our franchising out there. As the legal side of franchising can take between four to six months to complete, we have several months to raise the remaining monies.

 

Many people believe that Sticks and Shakes® is going to be the next big dessert concept.  You can see from our social media that people of all ages love what we are doing.

We also offer a range of desserts for people with Dietary needs including; Dairy free, No sugar added, Kosher, Halal, Vegan and Gluten free, that way everyone can love our desserts!

I understand that not everyone can contribute to every campaign, so I take this time to thank you for reading my pitch.
If you're unable to contribute, I would really appreciate it if you could help us by spreading the word about our campaign, by sharing it on any social media you use. Alternatively, please feel free to use any of Indiegogo’s sharing tools.

 

LASTLY….
If you are ever visiting Las Vegas, make sure you stop by and say hi, mention you saw the campaign and we will give you our "friends and family discount"

Kind regards
Mark

Sticks and Shakes®
