story:
Arizona Salsa and Spice Company

Needs your help  to become an attraction for tour buses, schools, winter visitors and locals to enjoy.  We want to be a down town destination.  

I want to be more than wholesale and retail, I want to be a manufacturing facility where people can see, and learn the process of making food products - sample the product at a salsa bar - and buy the product - all in the same place.  I want to employ more people, support local farmers, and teach the public how my industry works.

My story

Seven years ago, I opened Arizona Spice Company and Arizona Salsa Company here on Main Street in Mesa, Arizona-- without investors, relying only on resourcefulness, and a favorable response from the community to my all-natural, gourmet, peppery products.

As a small, local, family-owned business we are realizing our dream. The business is growing along with our product line which was created from my own original recipes with passion, originality, and plenty of spicy peppers. (of course I have mild products too!)

I have My products in a local gourmet grocery chain, a large warehouse chain, gift shops and specialty stores from Arizona to Canada.  We need to expand locally.

I am currently working on joining up with a large distributor back east opportunities are endless.  


My personal commitment to quality and flavor earned me the distinction of being the Official Salsas', seasonings, and Hot Sauces’ of Arizona’s 100-Year Centennial.  

I’ve won awards and received accolades for our product’s flavors in competitions and have been recognized for our unique products in many publications. 

 

Things were going well, and then last year the City of Mesa began major construction on the street directly in front of my business. The construction continued for ten long months. All the businesses on the street suffered a huge decline in revenues, many closed. 

This year, the City of Mesa has been constructing a new Light Rail Line on Main Street, which ends a few miles from my current location. With the street blocked and detours in place during construction, my businesses retail sales are very minimal.   

Still optimistic

Even after enduring another year of construction and a substantial decrease in business, I was still optimistic that Light Rail Line would revive the area and get me back on my feet.


My current location is not the best location for retail or tourists. ALthough they still call, and they still stop by, there just isn't much to see in my current location.  The landlord wants more money to renew my lease.  It doesn't make sense to stay here.  It is my dream to create a place that people of all ages can come and see exactly how food processing works.  I Could guide them through the process as they watch it through glass.  I would promote other local products and products we co-pack for others.

This where I need your help.  Making a move is one thing, creating a destination is more costly.  Me and my crew have a lot of experience in dealing with the public.  So many local agencies, schools, tour buses, and group homes call asking if we give tours.  I want to make this happen.  I cannot do it alone.  With your support we can be a destination.  A facility that can be toured, sampled, and purchased.  But I need extra support to make this dream come true.


The city of Mesa loves my idea. I am working with them on the possible locations that work the best.  They are excited and supportive of this idea.  We need to bring more people to down town and we can be an attraction to help make this happen.  

The location of the buildings I am looking at have great street visibility. But I will need to do some remodeling to reestablish our FDA Certified Kitchen, create a new production line counter, walk-in cooler and salsas, sauces and spices tasting bar. I have the plans laid out I just need your help to make it happen.

These are the necessary things we must achieve at the new location: Moving expenses for my equipment and inventory, combined with the added costs of renovations plans, inspections, permits and expenditures to reestablish our FDA Certified Kitchen is more than we can afford. 

I’ve worked long and hard to establish the Arizona Salsa & Spice Company as a regionally known brand, perhaps not as famous as the Grand Canyon, but a bit of an iconic name synonymous with spicy southwest gourmet food products. 

Being known as the place for “peppery pleasures” all made with no artificial flavorings, no high fructose corn syrup, no fillers, no GMO’s and no MSG is something we’re proud of, and want to continue that distinction and grow our customer base in a great new location.

We are calling on all foodies, chili-heads and lovers of spicy indulgences, and those who believe in entrepreneurship, sustainability and small business – to help us. 

All contributions are sincerely appreciated! And you won’t find any hotter perks as a reward for your support.

About the founder


Hi, I’m Debrah Roberti. The one that has been talking to you throughout your reading about my company.  I am Certified In Food Processing, as well as in Food Safety Restaurant Management, and a passionate Spiceologist with over 30 years of cooking experience. My education in science combined with my experience in seasoning food’s led to the creation of my own spicy variants and recipes.

Making the decision to plunge into the entrepreneurial world of “fiery” culinary arts and being willing to get my fingers burned competing against the big food manufacturers took some courage, now that I look back I wouldn't have done it any other way.  I am slowly forging my path in this industry as the freshly made, packed to order, all natural alternative to commercial brands.


I have been energized from day one, and continue to be committed to my own style of entrepreneurship by creating products that can’t be copied from what can be purchase from a grocery store. 


All of my recipes are influenced by all-natural ingredients that embody a traditional southwestern cooking method with simple, healthy vegetables, peppers and fresh spices, including many of my own handpicked ingredients.  I didn't start out to create such healthy products.  Only to prove it could be done without chemicals and additives.  As a result of this and using only the freshest ingredients, they turned out to be very healthy.  Low sodium, low sugar and pure.  




I must admit, the popularity of natural foods as well as bold, spicy flavors continues to rapidly grow in popularity and has helped drive the growth of our business.  

I am dedicated to strengthening the local food economy through direct support of growers and suppliers which preserves the viability of family farms, improves the lives of my customers and promotes practices that preserve and protect the Earth.

The impact of your contribution:  

By supporting us you're not only supporting this small business and helping us to expand further by hiring more people, you’ll also be supporting the local community and regional produce growers and suppliers of ingredients.   Please help us become a destination.  Thank you!

These are the basis costs that we anticipate for this move:

•  A moving crew to completely empty the facility and

  re-set commercial cooking equipment at the new facility

•  Truck rental and packing materials

•  Temporary storage unit rental for inventory and misc.

•  New facility renovations and improvements 

•  Plans, permits, inspection costs

•  Small walk-in cooler

•  Moving phones, Internet and office equipment

•  Set-up new and existing displays at new location

•  Temporary signage/marketing materials to explain the move.

•  Storefront signage


Every dollar, every donation, makes a huge difference, and we have some fun “thank you” gifts for your support.  

We know that we are asking you as complete stranger to help support a company you may know nothing about.

In exchange for your support, we would like to honor your kindness with some awesome perks and rewards.

Checkout the area to the right for a listing of the various perks we are offering you for joining this cause and supporting our efforts!

About your rewards

We need your help, and in return we’ll warm up your appetite for gourmet, fiery foods as rewards. Actually we produce our products in mild, medium, hot and extremely hot, so there’s a heat level for everyone who donates. Regardless of the heat level, you’ll love the flavor. 

Thank you very much for helping my small business, my employees, my family, and our community.  We hope to grow big enough to employ many more people who will also directly benefit from this campaign.

Please take the next step, and contribute to our future success by completing the form below.  Welcome to the family and thank you!  We have some great perks to reward you for your generosity.  

We need your help, and in return we’ll warm up your appetite for gourmet, fiery foods as rewards. Actually we produce our products in mild, medium, hot and extremely hot, so there’s a heat level for everyone who donates. Regardless of the heat level, you’ll love the flavor. 

Take the next step, and contribute to our future success by completing the form below.

What you get as our big perks-(Make your choice on the side bar) 

*Exclusive T-Shirts you will find only on Indiegogo.  Never sold publicly before (Color may vary, be sure so specify size).  *Anyone who donates will get their name listed on a large wall plaque of appreciation that will be displayed in our new facility.  

*Any donation gets a vote in picking a name for our new mango salsa due out by January 2016.  $100 or more also gets a free jar shipped to them when it is available. 

  

*A vote for the name of our new mango salsa due out January 2016.

*Your name will be listed on our plaque of appreciation that will hang in our new facility.

*A vote for the name of our new mango salsa due out January 2016.

*Also a vote in picking a name for our new mango salsa one free jar. Due out January 2016.

*Your name will be listed on our plaque of appreciation that will hang in our new facility.

*Also a vote in picking a name for our new mango salsa and one free jar due out January 2016.

*Your name will be listed on our plaque of appreciation that will hang in our new facility.

story_txt:
Arizona Salsa and Spice Company
Needs your help  to become an attraction for tour buses, schools, winter visitors and locals to enjoy.  We want to be a down town destination.  I want to be more than wholesale and retail, I want to be a manufacturing facility where people can see, and learn the process of making food products - sample the product at a salsa bar - and buy the product - all in the same place.  I want to employ more people, support local farmers, and teach the public how my industry works.
My story
Seven years ago, I opened Arizona Spice
Company and Arizona Salsa Company here on Main Street in Mesa, Arizona-- without investors, relying only
on resourcefulness, and a favorable response from the community to my all-natural,
gourmet, peppery products. 
As a small, local, family-owned business
we are realizing our dream. The business is growing along with our product line which was
created from my own original recipes with passion, originality, and plenty of spicy
peppers. (of course I have mild products too!)I have My products in a local gourmet grocery chain, a large warehouse chain, gift shops and specialty stores from Arizona to Canada.  We need to expand locally.I am currently working on joining up with a large distributor back east opportunities are endless.  
My personal commitment to quality and flavor earned me the
distinction of being the Official Salsas', seasonings, and Hot Sauces’ of Arizona’s 100-Year
Centennial.  
I’ve won awards and received accolades for
our product’s flavors in competitions and have been recognized for our unique
products in many publications.   
Things were going well, and then last
year the City of Mesa began major construction on the street directly in front
of my business. The construction continued for ten long months. All the
businesses on the street suffered a huge decline in revenues, many closed. 
This year, the City of Mesa has been
constructing a new Light Rail Line on Main Street, which ends a few miles from my current location. With the street blocked and detours in place during construction, my businesses retail sales are very minimal.   
Still optimistic
Even after enduring another year of
construction and a substantial decrease in business, I was still optimistic
that Light Rail Line would revive the area and get me back on my feet. 
My current location is not the best location for retail or tourists. ALthough they still call, and they still stop by, there just isn't much to see in my current location.  The landlord wants more money to renew my lease.  It doesn't make sense to stay here.  It is my dream to create a place that people of all ages can come and see exactly how food processing works.  I Could guide them through the process as they watch it through glass.  I would promote other local products and products we co-pack for others.
This where I need your help.  Making a move is one thing, creating a destination is more costly.  Me and my crew have a lot of experience in dealing with the public.  So many local agencies, schools, tour buses, and group homes call asking if we give tours.  I want to make this happen.  I cannot do it alone.  With your support we can be a destination.  A facility that can be toured, sampled, and purchased.  But I need extra support to make this dream come true.
The city of Mesa loves my idea. I am working with them on the possible locations that work the best.  They are excited and supportive of this idea.  We need to bring more people to down town and we can be an attraction to help make this happen.  The location of the buildings I am looking at have great street visibility. But I will need
to do some remodeling to reestablish our FDA Certified Kitchen, create a new
production line counter, walk-in cooler and salsas, sauces and spices tasting
bar. I have the plans laid out I just need your help to make it happen.These are the necessary things we must achieve at the new location: Moving expenses for my equipment and
inventory, combined with the added costs of renovations plans, inspections,
permits and expenditures to reestablish our FDA Certified Kitchen is more than
we can afford. I’ve worked long and hard to establish
the Arizona Salsa & Spice Company as a regionally known brand, perhaps not
as famous as the Grand Canyon, but a bit of an iconic name synonymous with
spicy southwest gourmet food products. Being known as the place for “peppery
pleasures” all made with no artificial flavorings, no high fructose corn syrup,
no fillers, no GMO’s and no MSG is something we’re proud of, and want to
continue that distinction and grow our customer base in a great new location.
We are calling on all foodies,
chili-heads and lovers of spicy indulgences, and those who believe in
entrepreneurship, sustainability and small business – to help us. 
All contributions are sincerely appreciated! And you won’t find
any hotter perks as a reward for your support. About the founder

Hi,
I’m Debrah Roberti. The one that has been talking to you throughout your reading about my company.  I am Certified In Food Processing, as well as in Food
Safety Restaurant Management, and a passionate Spiceologist with over 30 years
of cooking experience. My education in science combined with
my experience in seasoning food’s led to the creation of my own spicy variants
and recipes.
Making the decision to plunge into the
entrepreneurial world of “fiery” culinary arts and being willing to get my
fingers burned competing against the big food manufacturers took some courage,
now that I look back I wouldn't have done it any other way.  I am slowly forging my path in this industry as the freshly made, packed to order, all natural alternative to commercial brands.
I have been energized from day one, and
continue to be committed to my own style of entrepreneurship by creating products
that can’t be copied from what can be purchase from a grocery store.  All of my recipes are influenced by all-natural
ingredients that embody a traditional southwestern cooking method with
simple, healthy vegetables, peppers and fresh spices, including many of my own handpicked ingredients.  I didn't start out to create such healthy products.  Only to prove it could be done without chemicals and additives.  As a result of this and using only the freshest ingredients, they turned out to be very healthy.  Low sodium, low sugar and pure.  
I must admit, the popularity of natural foods as well as bold,
spicy flavors continues to rapidly grow in popularity and has helped drive the
growth of our business.  
I am dedicated to strengthening the local food economy
through direct support of growers and suppliers which preserves the viability
of family farms, improves the lives of my customers and promotes practices that
preserve and protect the Earth.
The
impact of your contribution:  

By supporting us you're
not only supporting this small business and helping us to expand further by
hiring more people, you’ll also be supporting the local community and regional
produce growers and suppliers of ingredients.   Please help us become a destination.  Thank you!These are the basis costs that we
anticipate for this move: 
•  A moving crew to completely
empty the facility and 
 
re-set commercial cooking equipment at the new facility 
•  Truck rental and packing
materials 
•  Temporary storage unit rental
for inventory and misc.
• 
New facility renovations and improvements  
• 
Plans, permits, inspection costs 
• 
Small walk-in cooler
•  Moving phones, Internet and
office equipment 
• 
Set-up new and existing displays at new location 
• 
Temporary signage/marketing materials to explain the move. 
• 
Storefront signage 

Every dollar, every donation, makes a
huge difference, and we have some fun “thank you” gifts for your support.
 
We know that we are asking you as complete stranger to help
support a company you may know nothing about. 
In exchange for your support, we would like to honor your
kindness with some awesome perks and rewards. 
Checkout the area to the right for a listing of the various
perks we are offering you for joining this cause and supporting our efforts!
About
your rewards 
We need your help, and in return we’ll warm up your
appetite for gourmet, fiery foods as rewards. Actually we produce our products
in mild, medium, hot and extremely hot, so there’s a heat level for everyone
who donates. Regardless of the heat level, you’ll love the flavor.  Thank you very much for helping my small business, my employees, my family, and our community.  We hope to grow big enough to employ many more people who will also directly benefit from this campaign.
Please take the next step, and contribute
to our future success by completing the form below.  Welcome to the family and thank you!  We have some great perks to reward you for your generosity.  We need your help, and in return we’ll warm up your
appetite for gourmet, fiery foods as rewards. Actually we produce our products
in mild, medium, hot and extremely hot, so there’s a heat level for everyone
who donates. Regardless of the heat level, you’ll love the flavor.  
Take the next step, and contribute
to our future success by completing the form below. 
What you get as our big perks-(Make your choice on the side bar) *Exclusive T-Shirts you will find only on Indiegogo.  Never sold publicly before (Color may vary, be sure so specify size).  *Anyone who donates will get their name listed on a large wall plaque of appreciation that will be displayed in our new facility.  *Any donation gets a vote in picking a name for our new mango salsa due out by January 2016.  $100 or more also gets a free jar shipped to them when it is available.   *A vote for the name of our new mango salsa due out January 2016.




*Your name will be listed on our plaque of appreciation that will hang in our new facility.*A vote for the name of our new mango salsa due out January 2016.*Also a vote in picking a name for our new mango salsa one free jar. Due out January 2016.

spreading the word. Take to Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest and more.

story:
The Story

2 post-graduate students wishing for the chance to supply food, healthcare supplies and school materials to as many children in Northern and Central India as we can! Volunteer sites include Shimla, Mother Teresa's Home for the Dying and Destitute, and Rishikesh Slums. Every dollar goes to the children!

My name is Juan and together with Yana, we decided to book a one way ticket to India to stay in local underprivileged communities and serve them through female empowerment, children education and local community development and empowerment. We wish to make as big of an impact as we possibly can and as a result we are trying to raise additional funds to provide for basic supplies and needs that these communities may greatly need. 

Every single dollar donated will go directly towards buying food, clothing, health products, and amenities for as many children as we can, and we will be updating our travels with photos of all the smiling children who will surely appreciate all of your kindness.

We only hope to inspire others to take time out of their busy lives to remember that serving and loving others is the true key to happiness and a fulfilling life. We don't do great things, we do small things with great love! 

Namaste,

Juan and Yana

story:
Sense of Samadhi

Yoga is not about changing yourself, it is about finding yourself. Sense of Samadhi has found a new home and we need to install a new floor. The current carpeting, while functional, does not provide the ideal foundation for our yoga students from all walks of life. 

We believe that yoga can fit the needs of anyone who wishes to try it. You can have any kind of body type, be any age, be fit or unfit, have injuries, be flexible, or, for that matter, feel mostly inflexible. All bodies are different, and yoga is as much about getting stronger as it is about becoming more flexible.

So what does a new floor mean to us? Well, we offer a wide variety of classes and we welcome beginners. Sense of Samadhi hosts free community yoga every Friday at 6pm. We want to continue growing and supporting our tribe. This new floor will be safer, easier to clean and long lasting, helping us establish a long-term home in the community.

We need your help to continue providing the best yoga, meditation, therapeutic classes and workshops to the community of Yorkville. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $2,000 for supplies and labor to install a wood laminate floor in the studio.

  • The funding will mostly be allocated to materials. The studio is 900 square feet, so we need quite a bit of flooring, trim, and supplies.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign! With your help, we can reach this goal and continue providing amazing yoga to our amazing community. Thank you!

story:
The Pi Kappa Alpha fraternity at American University is proud to announce our seventh annual PIKE Shootout basketball event benefitting the DC YMCA. We will be having a cookout so even if you're not partaking in the tournament you can enjoy a beautiful afternoon and cheer on your favorite team. 

Two years ago, this event raised $3000. Last year we more than doubled our efforts and raised $7500, and this year we plan to double that what we raised again. We are fundraising for the DC YMCA Calomiris Program branch in NE DC. The Calomiris branch is filled with classrooms and young pre-K students eager to learn, and your efforts will supply them with much-needed scholarships.

As sponsors and contributors, your generous donations will benefit families who previously could not send their children to these before and after school programs.  

We look forward to seeing our community at American University on September 26th from 2pm to 7pm! Team registration details will be released shortly, follow us on Facebook at The Pi Kappa Alpha Fraternity at American University for the most up-to-date information.


If you can't make it don't worry, there are other ways to help! Pledge a donation right here on Indiegogo and you can still help the youth in our community.

story:
*****PERKS NO LONGER AVAILABLE AFTER SEPTEMBER 12TH AT 2PM.***********


Why Throw Down?



Throw Down for a Cause (TD4ACause) is an initiative created in 2010 as a vehicle for raising much-needed funds for local programs and organizations that serve homeless, LGBTQ+, and at-risk teens.  We accomplish this through our annual women's JELL-O wrestling extravaganza, where passionate volunteers come together, roll around in JELL-O, and make a lasting difference in the lives of San Diego youth.

Our donors have helped raise over $30,000 in funds since 2010 for:
  • Project LOL (Love Out Loud) 
  • San Diego LGBT Center's Sunburst Youth Housing Project
  • The Trevor Project
  • It Gets Better
This funding has enabled life-changing and lifesaving programs including:
  • Cooking workshops
  • Sporting events
  • Self-expression through art and music
  • An annual indie horror film project
  • Hands on science workshops
  • Museum outings
  • Graphic design instruction
  • Skill-building and development for employment
  • And much more!
Through your donations, we can continue to bolster the efforts of these amazing organizations and expand this list even further!
By supporting this campaign, you will impact the lives of these young individuals by helping organizations that focus on instilling leadership, fostering acceptance, and promoting empowerment.  Your investment will grow strong leaders in our community by teaching vital life and job development skills, providing mentorship and relationship-building, and creating safe and supportive environments.

Are YOU ready to Throw Down???

What we're asking (and what you'll get!)

This Indiegogo campaign is just one component of our overall fundraising effort this year.  Altogether, we are shooting to surpass a combined fundraising target of $25,000. 

Here's where you can grab sponsorship packages, ticket bundles, and unique opportunities to join in on the action!

Help us reach our campaign goal of $5,000 by September 12th by purchasing:
  • Ticket Bundles:  Everything's better with a friend or 10!  Receive discounted prices on ticket packages of 3 or more.
  • VIP Packages:  Your choice of Regular Flavor OR newly-introduced for TD4AC 2015, the Splash Zone!  Spectate from the VIP Eagles' Nest OR get down and dirty with premium viewing, close enough to taste the excitement!
  • Corporate Sponsorships:  Put your business in the spotlight with logo placement at event and on promotional materials, social media shout outs, and special perks! 
  • Sponsor-A-Wrestler:  Want the best logo placement possible?  How about our wrestler sporting YOUR brand as they make their grand entrance into the ring! DEADLINE FOR PURCHASE IS 09/01/15.
  • "Get in the Pool Experience":  Watching from the sidelines not enough for you?  Put your money where your mouth is and throw down against one of our baddest brawlers! DEADLINE FOR PURCHASE IS 09/01/15.   
All funds raised, whether our goal is reached or not will go directly to our hand-picked beneficiaries, Project LOL (Love Out Loud) and the San Diego LGBT Center's Sunburst Youth Housing Project.

Want to donate in another way?  We are on the hunt for some amazing raffle prizes to be given away at this year's Throw Down!  If you'd like to make a raffle donation from your business, please get in touch with us at throwdown4acause@gmail.com and we'll set you up with some sweet perks offline!


What we bring to the table

Our core team of dedicated volunteers has been organizing and growing this event for over 5 years.  We have built solid partnerships with local businesses and community organizations in that time.  
Our volunteer team is made up of professionals from a variety of industries, each bringing their own special skills, knowledge, and talent to this event.  We have our bases covered in all of the necessary areas (and then some!), leveraging our team's expertise in copywriting, marketing, graphic design, promotions, event planning, and nonprofit volunteer coordination.  
This ain't our first rodeo folks!  We've been bringing the excitement, walking the talk, and making things happen since 2010!


Can't make it to the event this year?

No problem.  We'll miss you though!
There are more ways you can contribute!  Visit td4acause.com for more information!
And please share our campaign with everyone you know!!

Thank you for your support!  Let's THROW DOWN!!

story:
Help rehabilitate ex-offenders

The Shirley Community Chaplaincy (formerly known as the Shirley Trust) helps people coming out of prison to make a life worth living on the outside and reduce their risk of re-offending.

Ex-offenders face huge challenges on their release into a fast-changing world which can appear ignorant and careless of their needs. Many desperately just need somebody to talk to – to listen to them, guide them and help them make their way in the world.

The Chaplaincy arranges cultural and spiritual activities for ex-offenders to build confidence and build trust. In particular, we have been running camping trips for vulnerable ex-offenders where they can get away from the chaos of modern life and open up to others around a camp fire.

We know that proper support for people leaving prison makes a huge difference to re-offending rates. We want to continue our intensive work with ex-offenders to create better lives – but we can’t do it without new funding.

To secure the future of the our work into 2016, we need to raise £6,000 before the end of October 2015.

Without new funding, we simply won't be able to continue its vital work next year. We badly need to raise more money to keep our support for ex-offenders going, not just for their sake but also for the benefit of the wider community.

How the Shirley Community Chaplaincy makes a difference

The Chaplaincy works with up to 15 ex-offenders at any one time. With the help of volunteers it arranges a variety of activities with a cultural and spiritual focus, encouraging those present to open up about their past and commit to a brighter future.

Amongst the activities it undertakes are:

  • camping trips
  • fishing expeditions
  • outings to Durham Cathedral and Holy island
  • walks in Northumberland and Durham
  • ongoing personal support
  • developing a new group of peer mentors.

The nature of the work requires a huge degree of flexibility, and a significant amount of time is spent meeting or talking with individuals on a one–to-one basis, liaising with other agencies involved in their care and supervision and networking with other local groups and national networks dedicated to the care and rehabilitation of offenders.

How you can help

The Chaplaincy needs to raise £6,000 to make sure it can continue to help vulnerable ex-offenders into next year. Please give what you can.

If you cannot give at the moment, please pass on this fundraising appeal to friends, family and colleagues who may be able to.

If you are part of a church or community group, please let them know about our work and our fundraising appeal.

More about the Shirley Community Chaplaincy

Paul Hobbs, a prison chaplain for fifteen years, set up the Shirley Community Chaplaincy (as the Shirley Trust) in 2014. He operated in a voluntary capacity before charitable status was achieved in November 2014 and now works part-time on a month to month basis, raising funds as he goes. It is based in, and operates in, the North East of England. 

It is a faith-based organisation run by Management Committee, which meets every other month and consists of trustees and volunteers. It has two Safeguarding Officers and is part of the national Community Chaplaincy Association. 

The charity’s patron is Simon Hughes, Member of Parliament for Bermondsey & Old Southwark 1983-2015 and a former Justice Minister.

This fundraising appeal has been set up and managed by volunteers acting on behalf of the Shirley Community Chaplaincy.

The Shirley Community Chaplaincy is a registered charity under the name 'The Shirley Community Chaplaincy (North East)'. Charity Number 1158939.

Help rehabilitate ex-offenders
The Shirley Community Chaplaincy (formerly known as the Shirley Trust) helps people coming out of prison to make a life worth living on the outside and reduce their risk of re-offending.
Ex-offenders face huge challenges on their release into a fast-changing world which can appear ignorant and careless of their needs. Many desperately just need somebody to talk to – to listen to them, guide them and help them make their way in the world.
The Chaplaincy arranges cultural and spiritual activities for ex-offenders to build confidence and build trust. In particular, we have been running camping trips for vulnerable ex-offenders where they can get away from the chaos of modern life and open up to others around a camp fire. 
We know that proper support for people leaving prison makes a huge difference to re-offending rates. We want to continue our intensive work with ex-offenders to create better lives – but we can’t do it without new funding.
To secure the future of the our work into 2016, we need to raise £6,000 before the end of October 2015.Without new funding, we simply won't be able to continue its vital work next year. We badly need to raise more money to keep our support for ex-offenders going, not just for their sake but also for the benefit of the wider community.
How the Shirley Community Chaplaincy makes a difference
The Chaplaincy works with up to 15 ex-offenders at any one time. With the help of volunteers it arranges a variety of activities with a cultural and spiritual focus, encouraging those present to open up about their past and commit to a brighter future.
Amongst the activities it undertakes are:


camping
trips


fishing
expeditions


outings
to Durham Cathedral and Holy island


walks
in Northumberland and Durham


ongoing
personal support


developing
a new group of peer mentors.

The nature of the work requires a huge degree of flexibility, and a significant amount of time is spent meeting or talking with individuals on a one–to-one basis, liaising with other agencies involved in their care and supervision and networking with other local groups and national networks dedicated to the care and rehabilitation of offenders. 
How you can help
The Chaplaincy needs to raise £6,000 to make sure it can continue to help vulnerable
ex-offenders into next year. Please give what you can.
If you cannot give at the moment, please pass on this fundraising appeal to friends, family and colleagues who may be able to. 
If you are part of a church or community group, please let them know about our work and our fundraising appeal. 
More about the Shirley Community Chaplaincy
Paul Hobbs, a prison chaplain for fifteen years, set up the Shirley Community Chaplaincy (as the Shirley Trust) in 2014. He operated in a voluntary capacity before charitable status was achieved in November 2014 and now works part-time on a month to month basis, raising funds as he goes. It is based in, and operates in, the North East of England. 
It is a faith-based organisation run by Management Committee, which meets every other month and consists of trustees and volunteers. It has two Safeguarding Officers and is part of the national Community Chaplaincy Association. The charity’s patron is Simon Hughes, Member of Parliament for Bermondsey & Old Southwark 1983-2015 and a former Justice Minister.This fundraising appeal has been set up and managed by volunteers acting on behalf of the Shirley Community Chaplaincy.The Shirley Community Chaplaincy is a registered charity under the name 'The Shirley
Community Chaplaincy (North East)'. Charity Number 1158939.

story:
Hello Everyone!

My name is Sarah Bencic, I am tall girl from a small town with BIG dreams! I have been a person passionate about helping others for sometime and have been doing so on various scales in many places; anything from making care packages for the homeless in our capitol and knitting scarves for those without, donating of time and resources for those otherwise alone, assisting with community dinners for those who would go without and in more recent times traveling to other parts of the world less fortunate in resources. I have traveled in recent years to help with projects in Kyrgyzstan that would encourage further internal development and make the organizations more self sustaining. On that trip I caught the "bug", the earnest desire in my heart to see people helped who would not be otherwise, to stop for the "one" in front of me. 

This campaign is to assist with just this! I have the beautiful opportunity to go to Mozambique this October and will be leaving on the 2nd to live in the Village of Joy! This is an amazing place that houses orphans and widows, the ones most at risk in their impoverished society. It also is a medical center for the area, where those without means are fed, a sewing school for women who want to make something more for themselves. And most of all it is a place to be loved! In going there for these 3 months I am going to be privileged with the opportunity to help in all of these areas and to love on those lovely treasures! Where I know not everyone is able to drop their life and go to the far corners of our planet, I am entreating your help for me to do just that!

This is a crazy endeavor and am giving up everything of my own means to fund this venture and hopefully more like it in the future. I would appreciate any and all contributions and support to make this dream a reality! Your contributions will be going directly to the costs of getting to Africa and all of the rest to supplies needed to support the ongoing work in Mozambique. Not all of the current goal is for trip expenses, so their is a large budget already to purchase much needed items (for the Village of Joy, and other local people) to take with me, and of course anything over and above the goal will go to that also. Would you help me bless them? Not just with medical supplies, diapers, etc. but also with time? I have always been a firm believer that "people do not care how much you know, until they know how much you care" and a lot of that comes from just being with people. It is a very good thing to give to the poor but I think even more so to live with them, to care for them as people. Would you help me do this?

Everyone who donates will receive a Thank -you card from myself, access to regular updates via my recently launched blog (super exciting!),  as well as a newsletter of all that is accomplished during my time in Mozambique upon my return. Every level of donation will have certain other perks attached and will be mailed out promptly once the campaign is over. I am an artist by nature and practice and many of the perks you will notice will be related to art, others are by donation thanks to some fabulously talented friends! But more are to follow with the help of some lovely local donors!

If you are not in a position to donate and would still like to help out you certainly can! You can share this with your friends, family and the world, Indiegogo has made this sharing on all of your social media sites super easy! Also please connect with me through my blog; https://truenorthstudios.wordpress.com/, Instagram: https://instagram.com/bencicsarah/, Facebook and Twitter!

story: I am a preschool teacher in the Little Earth community, located in S. Mpls. SOUTHSIIIIIIIIDE. As a former Girl Scouts troop leader, I feel there is a strong need for a Girl Scout troop in that community. I will need some cheddar to get this party started and make it the best troop ever, because it's not the richest community ever. I feel I would have had a lot easier time growing up, if I had positive female role models in my life. Now I want to be one! Donations will be used for supplies, field trips, community events, badges and vests/sashes. Thanks a billion!!! ❤️❤️❤️

story:
This Week's Updates

Well yesterday was the end of our campaign and while we did not hit our target we got to meet a lot of great people during the past month who are just as excited about making this a reality as we are.  

For our amazing contributors we thank you!  We will be contacting you soon for shipment of your perks.  

But before we go for now a little recap.  During this campaign we entered into a partnership with a local land owner is has made 250 acres available to build a Texas retreat, a deal worth an estimated $1-1.5 million.  We also have just begun discussions with the owner of a Costa Rican hotel with an amazing view over San Jose who really liked what we are trying to do and wanted us to meet to work through the details.  We will be visiting them in mid September to put a deal together to rent out 2 apartments of his for techXscapers.

Some pictures of the East Texas retreat location.

A view from across the lake towards the future location of the residences.

This is a point of view shot from the anticipated residence lodging.

A point of view shot from the future location of the residence & workspace facility. 

Todays Traffic Report:  Seagulls & Turtles.  Perfect!

So you're walking down the hall on the way back to your drab cubicle and you serendipitously sneak a peek through your boss's corner office window.  You catch a glimpse of an amazing Spring day.  Where people are hanging out in the local cafe enjoying the sun and fresh air with their laptops out and lattes in hand.

Silently cursing your company’s pathetic WiFi, you realize you're trapped inside. That's when reality rears its ugly head.   Trudging back to your cubicle, you think about that amazing vacation you've been planning. You know the one. The vacation you never seem to find the time to take because of the endless stream of deadlines and demands on your time.

But that dreamy destination isn't as elusive as you might think.  We can bring it right to your doorstep ... literally ... every ... morning.

That's why we created techXscapes.

We're talking about tropical beaches, beautiful vistas, outdoor adventures and more.  Where you can work during the day in one of our remote hi-tech tropical resorts, each duly appointed with all sorts of professional goodies like big monitors, fast wifi, dry/erase boards, etc.  Then step outside to enjoy exotic local activities.

Because we believe in creating experiences where long-term stays (4+ weeks) are fun, safe, and AFFORDABLE.  Where you can get an 'office' view that would make C-level jealous, yet available at a fraction of the price.  Like ... about the cost of your rent (which is a super deal).

Together, we can turn that dream into a reality.

So why work from home?  Being located in the Central Time Zone, it's a breeze to continue to work with your teammates.  Carve out your own private or collaborative workspace.  Enjoy an experience where you live, work, and play.  A normal stay at a resort will cost you over $6,000 for a month, we can do a lot better than that!

Additionally, techXscapes will offer its residents what we call Growth Tracks.  Our Growth Track services are about enabling you to grow personally as well as professionally.  

If you choose to participate in our Growth Track services, you will be able to partake in free and for fee activities and classes.  Our current services include:  

  • Health & Fitness - Based on BootCamp programs and using the latest in connected fitness technologies you will be able to take control of your fitness and health in a nurturing environment.  
  • Adventurer - Partnering with vetted local businesses to provide you access to all that the area has to offer.  Ziplining, whitewater rafting, deep sea fishing, nature hikes, and more.  
  • Cultural - Get to know the host country's history, language, and traditions.  Also for people interested in an expatriate lifestyle, this option provides an excellent way to see if this lifestyle is a good fit for you.  
  • Entrepreneurship - For the startup minded, we will have activities for learning about what is involved with taking an idea and making it into a reality.   
  • Software Development - Developers wanting to refresh or expand their skills, we will have bootcamps, hackathons and more to choose from.  
  • Leadership - For people interested in developing skills for team leadership roles we will have sessions where they can learn the basics.  

Creating the complete vision of techXscapes is an ambitious goal, but one we think will enrich and empower us all.  Ultimately, we believe it will change the way we live and work.  TechXscapes, a mashup of a vacation resort, co-working space, and bootcamp thrown together into a synergistic whole. 

Show Me the Resorts!


Costa Rica's growing tourist market and technology industry makes it an ideal location for techXscapes pilot site and for you too!

While our selection criteria for sites are very stringent, Internet connectivity is at the top of our list.  Providing a combination of resort and condo living experience, you have the freedom to tailor the experience to your budget and preferences. 

Ultimately, any site we choose will be one that we ourselves would love to vacation at.  We're confident you'll love it too.

From Bar Napkins to a Master Plan

So having an idea is great!  Making it a reality a whole lot harder.  We have spent many months refining this concept.  Turning it into something that is lean and mean.  Working through often conflicting requirements, we developed a plan that can be started with only a modest budget.  A plan that will be ready for business in only a few months, not years.  

We're sure you have questions!  Below we have included the most frequently asked ones.  However, if you would like to know more about how we are going to execute this concept, please drop us a line at info@techxscapes.com.  We are more then happy to chat with you.

How You Can Help


For our generous contributors we have created a list of exciting perks.  Stickers to decorate your laptops.  T-shirts to dazzle your coworkers, and Hula Girl Bobbleheads.   Because they're way cool, and you always need more Bobbleheads.

Leaf Frog contributors, can buy discounted rents in 1 and 3 month blocks.  Additionally, Leaf Frog contributors will be the first in line to reside at our Costa Rica location.  Email us if you would like more details at info@techxscapes.com.  We want this to be as fair as possible, but know that site selection will also be dependent on the number of reservations we receive.  If wildly popular, we will get larger and more resorts to meet our demand.  For an extra level of comfort, we will also provide our Leaf Frog contributors our Funding Guarantee.  If we don't hit our funding target you get your money back (Minus the 5% Indiegogo Fees).  So what are you waiting for?  We can't wait for you to join us!

We know that not every hero needs to contribute monetarily.   You can help us by manning the Interwebs and social networks to let everyone know!  This is only the beginning and our plans are ambitious.  

If you or someone you trust has knowledge regarding properties that are a good fit for our concept or interested in creating a partnership with us, please let us know at partnerwith@techxscapes.com. 

Lastly, before you go, leave us a 'Hell Yeah!' on our Comments thread and tell us where your dream location is!

What Your Contribution Means

We have received overwhelmingly positive feedback about this concept and are excited about making it a reality.  After all who really wants to spend their entire professional life in an oversized box.  However, we want this concept to be driven by the people it will mean the most to.  You.  

The more we raise, the more we can do.  This is why we're here today.  Putting you in the front seat, and empowering you to take back your work/life balance. 

Your contribution to the campaign will enable us to perform site selection and secure a lease for the pilot location in Costa Rica.  Additionally, funds will be used for co-working space updates that initially will include: room desk monitors, network related enhancements, dry/erase boards, and portable power for your laptops and electronics.  A small portion of the funds will provide a stipend for the onsite team member who is responsible for site acquisition and site updates.  

Risks & Challenges

While all concepts exploring options abroad incorporate risks, we selected Costa Rica for our pilot site for its natural beauty and strong pro-foreign investment policies.  By leasing our locations before committing to purchase, we have the opportunity to ensure that the property is a good fit for us and an amazing experience for you.

By working through our local connections in Costa Rica, we are confident we will be able to navigate the legal and real estate landscape like professionals.  

A Little About Us

We’re technology professionals just like you, who are also looking for something different.  We are passionate about our work, but want to take back our work/life balance.  So we created techXscapes to realize this dream and we want to share it with all of you.

Pitch & Puzzles


To make this campaign extra exciting we've included puzzle games within our pitch video.  So dust off your Thinking Cap and join us in the video hunts!  

Tune in to our Updates thread for announcements every Wednesday at 8pm CST during our campaign!  Prizes include perks, props from our pitch video and more! 

This is Awesome! But I Have Questions!

We know you have lots of questions, here are the top questions we have received.  Feel free to contact us if you have more questions at info@techxscapes.com.

I have a mortgage/rent payments, how can I afford to go?

Rent out your home on Airbnb or HomeAway to cover your costs.  There are restrictions for apartments and condos so make sure to confirm that this option will work for you.  Additionally, it isn't guaranteed that you will be able to cover all the costs of your stay by using these services.  We still recommend that you create a financial cushion just in case.  (Note: because we're a technology focused concept you might be able to get your employer to help out with the costs!)

I don’t have a remote job so what do I do?

Many employers today already provide the option for their employees to work from home.  If you have demonstrated that you can work well in this environment it is likely that they will be flexible with you to work from our locations.  

If I get a Leaf Frog reservation perk does it ever expire?

That's a BIG no!  As a Funder, you will receive a confirmation code for your reservation that is good forever.  Use it when the time is right for you.  
What does my rent include?
Included in your payment is:  furnished room, weekly turn down, WiFi, desk and monitor in room, and co-working space access.  

Why technology professionals?

Being technology professionals ourselves we wanted to create something that we have a lot of experience with and know what your needs are.  However, that being said we don't have any visitor restrictions.  Just keep in mind that this environment is made to be conducive to technology professionals.

Do I need a work visa?

For Costa Rica stays lasting longer than 90 days you will require a visa.  Work visas are available to professionals and we will be there to help you get one should you stay for longer than 90 days.

How does this affect my taxes?

This is highly dependent on your personal tax situation and we are alas not tax professionals.  However, depending on the length of stay, (greater than 12 months) you may not have to pay US taxes.  But again, we recommend you talk to a professional about this.

Accidents happen, how does health care work there?

Availability of quality healthcare is one of the top concerns of our site selection criteria.  That being said you will need to check with your current provider’s options for out of network costs.  However, coverage for long term residents can be purchased at reasonable prices.

I have a family can they join me?

While we ultimately plan to provide accommodations for the whole family, initially we can only accommodate you and your partner.  

My pets are family to me, can I bring them too?

We’re animal people too and host countries that allow for easy access of our four paw furries is a must!  However, in the beginning we will not be able to host your pets.  But we will definitely announce when you can bring them with you!

I’m curious about this concept but can I rent for shorter terms?

Absolutely!  However, these bookings will be at standard resort pricing rates and depend on current availability.

It sounds like a blast, but how will I get any work done?

While we want you to have a memorable experience, we also know you have a job to do.  To help with distractions, we will minimize extra curricular activities during typical US working hours.  And with our private and collaborative spaces, you have the flexibility to carve out your own ideal place to work.

How is this different from Corporate Housing or Extended Stays?

Corporate Housing and Extended Stays provide many of the basic features of techXscapes in terms of stay length options and room amenities.  However, they are focused on locations in cities and are more about being large multi-unit apartments than on providing boutique resort like experiences.  Additionally, we provide you with collaborative workspace options as well as our growth tracks tailored to your interests.

Thank you!

We’re technology professionals just like you, who are also looking for something different.  We are passionate about our work, but want to take back our work/life balance.  So we created techXscapes to realize this dream and we want to share it with all of you.
Pitch & Puzzles

To make this campaign extra exciting we've included puzzle games within our pitch video.  So dust off your Thinking Cap and join us in the video hunts!  
Tune in to our Updates thread for announcements every Wednesday at 8pm CST during our campaign!  Prizes include perks, props from our pitch video and more! 
This is Awesome! But I Have Questions!
We know you have lots of questions, here are the top questions we have received.  Feel free to contact us if you have more questions at info@techxscapes.com.
I have a mortgage/rent payments, how can I afford to go?
Rent out your home on Airbnb or HomeAway to cover your costs.  There are restrictions for apartments and condos so make sure to confirm that this option will work for you.  Additionally, it isn't guaranteed that you will be able to cover all the costs of your stay by using these services.  We still recommend that you create a financial cushion just in case.  (Note: because we're a technology focused concept you might be able to get your employer to help out with the costs!)
I don’t have a remote job so what do I do?
Many employers today already provide the option for their employees to work from home.  If you have demonstrated that you can work well in this environment it is likely that they will be flexible with you to work from our locations.  

If I get a Leaf Frog reservation perk does it ever expire?
That's a BIG no!  As a Funder, you will receive a confirmation code for your reservation that is good forever.  Use it when the time is right for you.  
What does my rent include?
Included in your payment is:  furnished room, weekly turn down, WiFi, desk and monitor in room, and co-working space access.  
Why technology professionals?
Being technology professionals ourselves we wanted to create something that we have a lot of experience with and know what your needs are.  However, that being said we don't have any visitor restrictions.  Just keep in mind that this environment is made to be conducive to technology professionals.
Do I need a work visa?
For Costa Rica stays lasting longer than 90 days you will require a visa.  Work visas are available to professionals and we will be there to help you get one should you stay for longer than 90 days.
How does this affect my taxes?
This is highly dependent on your personal tax situation and we are alas not tax professionals.  However, depending on the length of stay, (greater than 12 months) you may not have to pay US taxes.  But again, we recommend you talk to a professional about this.
Accidents happen, how does health care work there?
Availability of quality healthcare is one of the top concerns of our site selection criteria.  That being said you will need to check with your current provider’s options for out of network costs.  However, coverage for long term residents can be purchased at reasonable prices.
I have a family can they join me?
While we ultimately plan to provide accommodations for the whole family, initially we can only accommodate you and your partner.  
My pets are family to me, can I bring them too?
We’re animal people too and host countries that allow for easy access of our four paw furries is a must!  However, in the beginning we will not be able to host your pets.  But we will definitely announce when you can bring them with you!
I’m curious about this concept but can I rent for shorter terms?
Absolutely!  However, these bookings will be at standard resort pricing rates and depend on current availability.

It sounds like a blast, but how will I get any work done?
While we want you to have a memorable experience, we also know you have a job to do.  To help with distractions, we will minimize extra curricular activities during typical US working hours.  And with our private and collaborative spaces, you have the flexibility to carve out your own ideal place to work.
How is this different from Corporate Housing or Extended Stays?
Corporate Housing and Extended Stays provide many of the basic features of techXscapes in terms of stay length options and room amenities.  However, they are focused on locations in cities and are more about being large multi-unit apartments than on providing boutique resort like experiences.  Additionally, we provide you with collaborative workspace options as well as our growth tracks tailored to your interests.

Thank you!

story:
Please help raise money for a Fire Truck

by keith balka

 
 


  • As we've seen in our most recent fire seasons,  there  were more fires, more aggressive spread and longer containment times.  This has  and will continue to impact more of our forests and human habitats just as our resources to combat them continue to diminish..

     

There is a incredible need for more wildland fire equipment and qualified engine bosses. The urban land scape continues to encroach upon on woodlands putting more and more families in danger.

My name is Keith Balka and I have over ten years experience in this field. 

To continue to better able  serve communities I need a Ford F-550 4x4 with a 500 gallon tank that has pump and roll capibilities, a ultra high pressure foam system and the truck will be built and stocked to NWCG standards.

 My truck, as well as my services as a engine boss will be available to aid our front range communities and will also be available for contract through the National Interagency fire Center when more equipment is needed in specific area's. 

In the off season the truck will be used for mitigation work either through the Forest Service ,  for home owner's and / or business's that need a defensible space built around their property. { creating a break around the homes or business, by removing the fuels for fires } 

You've probably heard this said of first- responders and it is true of me , when I hear of a fire,   I run toward it  not away from it.  My skills are honed and my experience is extensive.

This is my dream to continue my dedication and service to communities in need in times of crisis.

story: CHALLENGES
story_txt: CHALLENGES

story:
Fact: Loneliness kills (many recent studies suggest that it could be the next big public-health issue, on a par with obesity)

Fact: Severe loneliness just in England blights the lives of 700,000 men and 1.1m women over 50, and is rising with astonishing speed1

Fact: Social Isolation is the number one reason for the rapid deterioration of mental health in older people

John is 85 years of age and lives alone.  He didn't see another person yesterday. 

It will be the same today. It will be the same tomorrow.  He is lonely, depressed and in increasingly poor health. 

In one sense, John is not alone because 49% of people aged 75 or over live alone (ONS 2012).  In the most important sense, however, he is alone.

We want to make later life so much better for John and many older people like him.  

We want to do this today, so that he can get the most out of the rest of his tomorrows...  

Balanced Lives beats loneliness

Action for Elders has created a Balanced Lives programme that addresses both of these definitions of balance. How? Well, the programme helps older people with both mobility and mental wellbeing.

We are already helping hundreds of older people with our Balanced Lives programmes and we want to help many more.  The goal of our campaign is to secure funding for 2015 Balanced Lives classes this year. 

Many older people are trapped in their own homes by a lack of mobility and the loss of family and friends.  This lack of social interaction increases their vulnerability to depression and mental health issues. Mobility and mental health are the two major challenges to the quality of life in older age and our approach tackles these two factors head-on and recognizes the linkages between the two.

We need your help to raise £40,300 to offer 2015 older people a Balanced Lives Class this year.


With an increasing number of older people facing a future of paying for their own care and support services, or perhaps avoiding these if they feel they cannot afford them, then loneliness may become an even bigger issue. 

We can’t let this happen; together we can show older people that they are valued. Show your support today.

Why this campaign? : Our Impact

We developed the Balanced Lives Programme in partnership with Sheffield University and have evidence that this model improves the lives of older people. Since 2006, we’ve run 30 programes in 8 places across the UK and helped 535 older people feel more valued and less isolated....

 

On the “keeping in touch” arm of the Older People’s Outcome Star (which measures isolation), the evaluation found that participants moved from an average score of 7.6 (out of 10) at the first assessment, to 8.1 on review.  

 

Evidence also shows that there was a measured marked improvement in social interaction of 16% for those who have been involved with our programmes. 

Life is for living, no matter how old you are. Together, we can make this happen.

About Action for Elders

 

Action for Elders is a charity that was registered in 2012 with the key objective of tackling the major challenges of our ageing society. We deliver a number of programmes that enhance the well-being of older people, bringing respect, dignity, confidence and purpose into their lives – and helping those who wish to live with as much independence as possible.The programmes have a profound impact not only on the older people who take part, but on their whole family and local community.

In 2013, ITV produced a short film on our work which resulted in the charity winning the Public Vote in 'People's Millions' and being awarded £50k.  You can watch the video here.

As Dr Malcolm Fisk, Co-Director Ageing Society, Coventry University so succinctly put it “you have got something that is really, really good here, but now need the resources to deliver it.” 

With your help, we can make this happen.

How we make real, lasting change

To effect real change in the health of older people then short term solutions do not work (Cochrane Review 2009, Big Lottery Well Being Report 2013). Indeed when you are dealing with Social Isolation and Loneliness then our programme becomes a lifeline to those who attend, building on an individual’s confidence and sense of security. To ensure we make real, lasting change:

·  

# We look for the most isolated communities across the UK

# Our programmes are the result of sound academic research and are constantly evolving to meet the individual needs of older people·  

# Everything we do is evidence based 

# We address some of the most challenging issues facing our ageing society

# We’ve already worked in collaboration with Sheffield University, My Home Life, Elderly Accomodation Council, Care & Repair, Public Health Wales

The difference your donation will make

Your donation, whether large or small, will make a world of difference to the lives of older people.  See what your donation will contribute to the lives of older people across the UK:

£ 5.00 will help cover the cost of one older person attending a Balanced Lives Programme 

£ 15.00 will help us with transportation costs to bring isolated and lonely older people to our programmes.

£ 25.00 will pay for an older person to attend our programme and improve their health and well being.

 

Other ways you can help

If you can’t financially support this project, but know someone who can, please share this page with them.  You can also support us on on social media by clicking the Facebook and Twitter logos below.

Thank you so much for your time and for your interest!  Together we can ensure that the scoreboard shows:

Balanced Lives 1   Loneliness 0


Sources of Info

[1] A study by Independent Age
[2] Loneliness increases the risk of high blood pressure (Hawkley et al, 2010)
[3] Loneliness puts individuals at greater risk of cognitive decline (James et al, 2011)
[4] Lonely individuals are also at higher risk of the onset of disability (Lund et al, 2010)
[5] Lonely individuals are more prone to depression (Cacioppo et al, 2006) (Green et al, 1992)
[6] Lonely people have a 64% increased chance of developing clinical dementia (Holwerda et al, 2012)
[7] Loneliness is a bigger problem than simply an emotional experience; lacking social connections is a comparable risk factor for early death as smoking 15 cigarettes a day (Holt-Lunstad, 2010)
[8] Loneliness and low social interaction are predictive of suicide in older age (O’Connell et al, 2004)

story:
Social Impact Decor

Hello! I am Emmy Callero and I am an interior designer with an unstoppable passion for design and Andean textiles.  

I've been in love with Latin America and textiles since I was a child.  I lived in Peru in my early 20s and I left part of my heart there.

This project of mine is near and dear to me.  It is about taking a risk, starting a business, and living my deep authentic dream.  While I push through to make my dreams come true, I also want to give women in the Andes the opportunity to do the same.

The Problem

The majority of fair trade ventures fail within the first three years.  They try to sell multiple products and aim to make impact in multiple villages concurrently.  It's a lose-lose situation.  The ventures in the US fail and the artisans do not receive consistent and sustainable work. 

The Solution 

The solution is to narrow the scope to one community, focus on one product at a time, grow relationships and generate sustainable revenue.   

The Plan 

I am collaborating with two weaving communities in the Andes that are supported by Threads of Peru, a fair trade certified organization.  Saying that these women are skilled artisans is an understatement.  These women are masters of their craft, and ancient craft that spans millennia.  We are collaborating on textile designs that incorporate the Andean with the Portlandian.

These communities are isolated and these women are living in extreme poverty. They live a subsistence lifestyle with little attention from the outside world.  Life is lived close to the edge in the beautiful yet unforgiving Andes.  

My goal is simple: Provide consistent work for these women. 

What does consistent work give? Financial security so they can confidently ride the waves of uncertainty.

What We Need 

This funding will help us in three ways. 

1)  $6000 will fund the purchase of 50 textiles which will provide direct income to the women workers for a whole year.

2)  $2000 will fund my trip to Peru to meet the artisans face to face in August. 

3)  $1000 will further develop my business with the purchase of a high quality camera and Adobe Creative Suite software. 

What Will I Do with the Textiles? 

I have an online store! Did you know that?

I will sell the textiles on my online store. 

I have interested buyers in three (and counting) boutique shops in Portland, Oregon.

What does it mean if I sell all 50 textiles? I can buy 50 more, continue this pattern, and transform the community with sustaining work.  

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by making some noise! 

Share this campaign with 5 people and ask them to share with 5 others. I truly believe together we can make an impact in the Andes and give women work.

You can also buy a textile when they arrive!



-- photo credit: Threads of Peru

story:
Why should I care about autism?

If you don't already know someone whose life is impacted by an Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) diagnosis, chances are you will soon. The CDC estimates that 1 in every 68 children have already been diagnosed with an autism spectrum disorder, and that number continues to rise at an alarming rate every year. While the cause of the escalating diagnoses remains unclear, what is apparent is that a growing percentage of our population has increasingly complex sensory and social issues that never go away.  

What does it mean to have sensory and social issues?

Autism is a neurodevelopmental disorder that impacts typical activities, such as socialization, and is often characterized by displays of repetitive and stereotyped patterns of behavior. Individuals with a spectrum disorder usually display different responses to sensory experiences when compared to typically developing peers. For example, they may find the noise of a baseball game or a crowd too loud and overstimulating, or fluorescent lighting distracting and painful. While the spectrum of autism is varied and differs with each person, individuals with autism – as well as those with other developmental disabilities – usually have a dysfunctional sensory system where one or more senses are either over- or under-reactive to stimulation. 

Why should I support this park?

This is a park designed with the needs of our local community in mind. We want the general public to get excited about this new addition and the positive change it will bring to our communities! 

What makes this park different?

The Sensory Park and Playground, the first of its kind in the nation, was developed in conjunction with national experts in the creation of living and recreational spaces for individuals with disabilities. The park features seven elements of inclusive play (please see below) that will make this a friendly play space for children with ASD diagnoses and their 'neurotypical' peers. 

Where will the park be located?

The Sensory Park & Playground will be located on over an acre of Glade Run’s Zelienople campus with easy access to interstate 79 and the Pennsylvania Turnpike.

Who will get to use the park?

Everyone! While this park was designed to specifically meet the needs of kids with autism, it will be FREE and open to the general public and able to be used by all children. 


The Sensory Park and Playground includes several essential elements for inclusive play:

1.  Bolting can be an issue for children with autism, so a perimeter fence with only one or two ways in and out help to maintain security and safety. The perimeter fence is being constructed with materials salvaged from the deconstruction of historic agency building to preserve aspects of the agency’s history during the transformation.

2.  Vast, unorganized spaces make it difficult for some children to engage in activities. Clear way-finding and delineation of activity zones are essential to the development of the park, and reduce the stress of children as well as their parents. The shape of the play spaces will be ovals, which are comfortable and natural shapes for children on the autism spectrum to move within.

3.  Overstimulation is often a barrier to children with autism spending time outdoors. Nature can set a serene tone and calm children, so soothing and safe areas are included in the design. Paths and landscaping allow for separation between activities. Cozy spaces for retreat and de-escalation are provided as well as areas to observe activities from a distance before engaging physically in play.

4.  Sensory elements are key to the creation of this unique sensory play area. Children with autism have over- or under-responsive sensory systems. Providing various sensory elements in the park can both soothe and stimulate children. Examples of elements include auditory (chimes, music), visual (movement, muted colors), scent (flowers, grass. plants) and touch (water, textured surfaces). Ample space for running and exercise is vital for all children.

5.  Play should increase motor skills, coordination, balance, and movement. Activities in the park enhance body awareness and motion. Physical elements include equipment that spins, slides, swings, and bounces. Opportunities for rocking, climbing, crawling, balancing, jumping, walking and running are also incorporated through the park’s design and equipment.

6.  Opportunity for social skills development in the park provide children with autism spectrum disorders a venue for engaging and interacting with other children while also providing space for individualized play. Many pieces on the playground require more than one person to operate, sparking social interaction.

7.  Finally, the park will include amenities that make it comfortable and pleasant for both children and families, including shelters, restrooms, covered and open picnic areas, benches, paths and hardscapes, efficient lighting, and landscaping.


Founded in 1854 as the Orphan’s Home and Farm School, today Glade Run serves thousands of traumatized youth through educational, mental health, cultural and autism programs in residential school and community settings. Glade Run employs over 550 dedicated professionals to care for over 4,000 unduplicated individuals each year. Over 70% of individuals we serve are youth under age 21, and are referred for services from over 43 counties and 50 school districts across Western Pennsylvania.

Our mission – linking faith and service – epitomizes our dedication to serving those upon which others have given up. Glade Run was created to serve vulnerable children and families in need with programs and services that succeed where others have failed. Our goal is to provide critical and strategic service to the community through exceptional quality programs for traumatized children and families in a safe environment.

On our historic 331-acre campus located in Zelienople, PA, Glade Run serves children ages 6 to 21 through a residential treatment facility and through K-12 education at St. Stephen’s Academy – our licensed private school.  Glade Run also offers community based services through offices located in Butler, Beaver Falls, Cranberry and Pittsburgh. Programs include wraparound services for children with autism as well as individual and family mental health and partnership programs. Through community based services, families are kept together, and children are able to begin the process of healing by learning how to use their unique strengths to lead productive lives in their own homes and communities. Additional information on Glade Run’s programs and services can be found at www.gladerun.org.
