story:
VASI
Visión Amazónica para la Sostenibilidad Integral
Amazonian Vision for an Integrated Sustainability


Para Español, por favor haz clic aquí

VASI is Community, Science, Empowerment, and Chocolate

·  9 Peruvian communities

·  US and Global Businesses

·  Peruvian and international scientists

·  Peruvian University students


VASI empowers communities, bettering 1000s of peoples’ lives, and brings you delicious, sustainable, organic chocolate.

Collaborate with us to contribute to the conservation and sustainability of the Peruvian Amazonian region and the United States by helping to create legal and sustainable business opportunities, providing access to higher education, and developing scientific research to inform both local and regional policy and development decisions.


The Challenge

  1. Extreme poverty and the lack of access to legal, sustainable income producing activities.
  2. Lack of local input. The majority of scientific knowledge about, and development projects in, the Amazon comes from or take place near urban centers or conservation areas, and most often these do not include the voice of the local people.
  3. Education. There is little opportunity to pursue higher education, and even less opportunity for a university graduate to apply their degree working in their home area.

Did you know the Amazon is home to cacao—the fruit that gives us Chocolate, and that a significant portion of the world’s chocolate is produced by forced child labor and slaves?

The VASI Solution

  1. Community driven scientific research
  2. Scholarships for higher education
  3. Community driven sustainable business projects and direct trade agreements to craft chocolate makers, chefs, specialty food markets, and others.

**For a full White Paper, please, click here: https://proyectovasi.wordpress.com/documents-and-publicationsdocumentos-y-publicaciones/

An Opportunity


Few varieties of cacao are used on the commercial scale. Based on the lack of genetic diversity, the increasing presence of pests and fungal issues, and increasing demand, soon there may not be enough production of cacao to meet demand for chocolate.

VASI will use wild, native, and heirloom varieties of cacao to develop unique flavor profiles, contribute to the conservation of genetic diversity, increase resistance to plagues and floods, and be adapted to local conditions. Our cacao will be exported via direct trade agreements to craft chocolate makers. We are already establishing relationships with chocolate makers in Michigan and other parts of the world and Peru.


Growing pressure on the communities, landscapes, and resources, the lack of basic services and extreme poverty, the dearth of legal, sustainable, opportunities, and the fact that few residents have the opportunity to further their studies beyond secondary school, leave project area residents vulnerable, disempowered, and more likely to get caught up in dangerous unsustainable and/or illegal activities.

THE AMAZON

The Amazon is the birthplace of cacao—the fruit from which we get chocolate
  • The Amazon is one of the world’s two largest bodies of fresh water
  • The Amazon Basin contains one of the highest levels of biological and cultural diversity in the world
  • The Amazon plays a significant role in global climate

VASI an integrated vision to contribute to the conservation of freshwater and biodiversity, to help stabilize global climate, and to empower communities to meet these challenges.

_______________________

There are a variety of ways in which you can help. Please, visiting us here (www.proyectovasi.org) or write us at info@proyectovasi.org.

Please, take a minute now to share our campaign link https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/vasi-amazonian-vision-4-integrated-sustainability on all your social networks (Facebook, Linked-in, Google+, Pinterest, Twitter, etc.) via direct emails, and in face-to-face conversation with your friends, colleagues, and family. And, please, share it frequently throughout the duration of our campaign. We would love it if you would follow us on our webpage/blog www.proyectovasi.org, twitter @proyectovasi, and/or Facebook www.facebook.com/proyectovasi.

To see a list of specialized gear and tech we will accept in-kind, please, see our “Wish List” at: https://proyectovasi.wordpress.com/to-donate/


What We Need

For a detailed white paper regarding our budget and plans, please, click here: (https://proyectovasi.wordpress.com/documents-and-publicationsdocumentos-y-publicaciones/)

Our Immediate Goal: $110,791.00.

Stretch Goal: $376,585.00

We have prioritized and divided our budget into three phases, each roughly represents 4-6 months of work.

To implement our first phase, 4-6 months of work,  we need $110,791.00. Our hope: full funding for the first three phases of project, a total of$376,585.00.

These funds will allow us to jump-start the project and develop the project’s credibility as we apply for institutional funds and large grants. If we pass our goal, we will be able to continue moving forward with even more momentum. If we fall short of this goal, we will use what we raise in the order described below. Each activity builds on the one before and will have a significant impact of its own.

______

* Project-wide meeting in the District of Sarayacu: $7795.00

A three day meeting with community representatives,  scientists, regional authorities, other invited experts, and student representatives.

* Create a legally recognized organizational structure (NGO/non-profit or Association) in Perú: $3,362.00

* Scientific studies, providing opportunity for 2 thesis students and 3 interns $36,998.00

1. Characteristics and requirements of cacao growing in the district, 2. Fisheries and water quality, and 3. Effects of climate change on local fishing and agriculture.

* Technology: $1,177.00

Purchase USB and hard drives. If you have technology to donate, please, see:

https://proyectovasi.wordpress.com/to-donate/

*Attend Institute of Tropical Cultivars 5 day Cacao Course and host VASI business and organizing workshops: $29,893.00

THIS IS A ONE OF A KIND opportunity for us. A team of 2 representatives from each town, 3 students, 3 coordinating team members, and the project manager/extension agent will attend a 5 day intensive cacao course led by ICT in Tarapoto Peru (one of the world’s most respected institutions regarding cacao), and hold our own 1 day workshop with invited speakers on the business and organizing aspects of cacao.

*Extension Agent /Project Manager: $19,158.00

Six months of salary and related expenses for a project manager/extension agent with expertise in cacao.

*Work and Travel of the Coordinator Team: $12,408.00

Communication, travel in district, and to Peruvian Cities

_______

Second Phase (roughly four more months of work) ($228,016.00) will be:

Second Project-Wide Meeting in the District: $7785.00

Build Tree Nurseries in Each Participating Town: $77,305.00

Create and Fund first year of Scholarship: $15,882.00

Work and Trips of the Coordinating Team: $16,253.00

Communication, travel in district, to Peruvian Cities, and to USA

________

Third Phase (total of$376,585.00)

Extension Agent/Project Manager (second 6 months): $19,158.00

We will extend the extension agent’s to cover a total of one year.

Continue first three scientific studies (3 more internships & 2 more theses): $35,607.00

Third Project-Wide Meeting in the District: $7795.00

Work and Trips of the Coordinating Team: $20,749.00

Communication, travel in district, to Peruvian Cities, and to various cities in the USA

Specialized Water and Soil Tests, Equipment, and Analyses: $34,773.00

Conduct advanced water and soil tests, looking at concentrations of heavy metals and toxins as well as other ecological factors.

Technology and Specialized Gear: $30,487.00

Are you a technology company? An outdoor gear or equipment specialist? Or do you have used but in great shape technology to donate? We are looking for donations of iPad/tablets, laptops, cameras, GPS’s, and other equipment and gear. Please see our full list at: https://proyectovasi.wordpress.com/to-donate/ or contact us info@proyectovasi.com

_______

More than $376.585.00

If we receive more than $376,585.00 in funds, our first priority will be to ensure we have the first five years of scholarship money put aside, as well as the fund’s for 2017’s activities. We would also then be able to include more communities (other neighboring communities have already begun to express interest) and provide additional scholarships (our long-term goal is 2 per community).

THE PERKS/Las Recompensas

***A few important general notes:

1. Approximate shipping dates are listed here for each item. These are worst-case scenarios. We hope things will ship much sooner than what we list.

2. Perks are listed in both Spanish and English.

3. Limits on the perks are regardless of language in which it is chosen (for instance, there are six total available under Internship and Practicante, we will try to keep the numbers updated based on what has been claimed)

4. Our shirts and baseball hats are unique, one of kind, designed and sewn specifically for us in ethical shops with organic cotton. Unlike most mass-produced shirts and hats, these are unique, and our design will not be re-used.

US $1= True Friends 

We appreciate donations of all sizes and types. We send our sincere and heartfelt gratitude and fully appreciate your support!!!

US $ 5.00 = Star/Estrella Sarayaquina

We will email a thank you video made by the communities (Shipping date: May 2016)

And, after, the first year of the project, we will email you a link to view or download our annual report. It will include details about the project advancements and hurdles, as well as photos, news, essays, information about the Amazon, and other relevant news. It will be written in popular format and be informative, entertaining, and educational. (Date: April 2017)

US $ 15.00 = Student/Estudiante

You can choose a digital image from our collection, and we will email you a link to download it for personal use. You can view the images available at:

https://proyectovasi.wordpress.com/color-photosimagenes-a-color/. (Shipping Date: March 2016)

You will also receive everything in the “Star” package.

US $ 25.00 = Chocolate Lover/Amante

Starting at $25, we will plant one or more seeds in your name (or in the name of a person you give us). At $25, we will plant the seed of a wild, native, or heirloom variety of cacao. We will email a link to download and print a certificate of adoption for each of your seeds. Seeds will be sown in early 2017. (Shipping Date: February 2017)

With your $25 donation, we will also send you everything included in the “Student” package.

US $ 50.00 = Forest Lover/Amante del Bosque

At $50, we will plant a seed of one of several varieties of now rare tropical hardwoods (mahogany, tropical cedar, etc) to go along with the cacao seed planted in your honor. We will email a link to download and print a certificate of adoption for each of your seeds. Seeds will be sown in early 2017. (Shipping Date: February 2017)

You will also receive everything in the “Chocolate Lover” package.

US $ 100.00 = Virtual Traveler/Viajero

We will include in your package of perks a packet of 10 postcards with images of landscapes and community residents. You can use these to return to the ancient art of handwritten correspondence, or they can be used to decorate your home, bedroom, or office. (Shipping Date: September 2016)

You will also receive everything in the “Forest Lover” Package.


US $ 200.00 Architect/Arquitecto Ecológico

We will sow a seed of a slow growing, ecologically important, large, emergent canopy species in your name. These are the tallest, most emblematic, biggest species in the forest; they are the giants whose heads stick out above the rest, extremely important to forest structure.

We will also send you the VASI screen saver, made up of 15 digital images of landscapes and people from the project area. A perfect way to start dreaming about your next vacation and remember the valuable contribution you have made to this project and our world.

And of course you will also receive everything in the “Virtual Traveler’s” Package.

US $ 500.00 Team Member/Miembro del equipo

Team VASI Polo (Women's)

Starting at the $500 donation level, you will receive a Team VASI Polo shirt. A young emerging designer with roots in the project area has designed these unique, organic cotton, polo shirts. Designed and made in Peru, from Peruvian cotton, they are high quality, fashionable shirts you will be proud to wear to the office or out and about. The red organic cotton shirts with white details will carry the VASI logo on the front pocket and the word VASI across the back. Following the tradition of soccer/football team shirts, the Peruvian flag will be embroidered on the right sleeve. The men’s version will be classy traditional cut, the women’s a slimmer version with a deeper v-neck. The logo will be selected through a competition between all the communities that participate in the project. The winner will be announced at the second project-wide meeting. We will send an email to collect your size and preference between the men’s or women’s models (Shipping Date: Sept 2016). 

You will also receive everything in the “Architect Package.”

Team VASI Polo Men's

US $ 1200.00 Padrino de Cacaotero

As the sponsor, or in Peruvian tradition the godparent, of one of the community participants (2 per community), you will be facilitating his/her participation in an intensive trip and series of trainings on organic and sustainable cacao growing practices. The participants will take a 2-3 day boat trip from their home towns, to the city of Pucallpa. There they will be met by the coordinating team, project manager/extension agent, and student representatives. The team will then take an overnight bus to the city of Tarapoto and the ICT, Institute of Tropical Cultivars. http://www.ict-peru.org/.

 Together the team will participate in a 5-6 day course covering everything from harvesting wild cacao seeds, selection, and grafting, to cacao pest and fungal plague management, harvest, and initial processing. At the end of the course, we will return to Pucallpa, where we will have a special daylong workshop with cacao farmers, experts, and organizers, focusing on the business and organizing aspects of cacao production. Community members and the extension agent will then return to their communities where they will serve as local experts for their communities.

You will receive a full color, bilingual, professionally printed, hardbound memory book that covers the trip. It will be written in popular and informative style with a mix of information we learn in the course, information about cacao, and information about VASI. It will be full of photos, and written by participants and coordinating team members. You will feel as if you were really there as a part of the project team, and will have this souvenir to share with family, friends and colleagues. Each book will be personalized with a note to you written by your sponsored participant (Shipping Dates: September 2016).

You will also receive everything in the “Teammember” package.

US $ 2000.00 The Toast

At our first meeting we will hold a toast in your name and send you a thank you card with a photo of this commemorative moment. All of the meeting participants will sign the card, and we will include a few personal notes. (Shipping Date: May 2016)

To acknowledge your generous support of the project, we will also send you a beautifully printed, hardbound, bilingual copy of the annual report. It will have color photographs, and in addition to information about the project, its successes and hurdles, it will include scientific information about the Amazon and cacao. It will be written an engaging, fun, and informative popular style accessible to anyone, and appropriate for your coffee table or office desk. We will list your name in the project sponsors, and, in addition, you will receive two Team VASI organic cotton shirts, 30 tree seeds sown in your honor, and all the rest of the “Architect” package.

US $ 3600.00 Intern Sponsor (Limit 6)

At $3600 you can sponsor the work of an intern who will conduct research or carry out a sub-project in the communities. At the beginning of the internship, you will receive a personalized thank you note from your sponsored student, and a short summary of the project proposal. At the end of the internship, he or she will send you a final report. It’s worth mentioning that these two reports will be academic, scientific reports. In addition, the intern will also help create and send to you a beautiful and engaging memory book, along the same lines as those described in the “Padrino de Cacaotero,” but with a focus on their internship project. (Shipping dates depend on when your student is selected and begins their research project. We estimate September 2016 and March 2017.)

We will also arrange for you to be able to have a telephone or skype conversation with your sponsored intern, and will provide a translator, if necessary.

In addition, your name will be listed in the project sponsors list in the annual report, you will receive two Team VASI shirts and two organic cotton VASI baseball hats, and everything in the “Architect” Package.

VASI Organic Cotton Baseball Hats:A white, unstructured hat, with the VASI logo on the front and the the words Visión Amazónica por la Sostenibilidad Integral around the opening in the back. The logo will be chosen through a competition within the nine participating communities and the winner announced at the second project-wide meeting. (Shipping Date: Sept 2016)


US $ 6,000.00 Cacao Grower’s School – Trip to Pucallpa and Tarapoto with discounts available if you would like to continue to Iquitos

The first 5 that donate $6000, and, therefore sponsor the participation of 5 community members in the cacao training course at ICT (Institute of Tropical Cultivars), will be invited to participate in all our course activities and the special activities we are organizing in Pucallpa.

**Don’t miss this one of a kind opportunity!!! If you have always wanted to learn more about cacao or are considering your own cacao farm or project, this is the class for you. The ICT, is highly respected at the international level, and charges a flat rate for the course. For you to do it on your own, would be both extremely expensive, and you would miss out on the shared experiences and camaraderie and the chance to learn and share with expert Amazonian farmers. We are in the process of working out the course syllabus and schedule, if you are interested, please, write us info@proyectovasi.org.

Our trip will start with a 12 hr bus ride from Pucallpa to Tarapoto. Your bus fare will be included, or you can meet us in Tarapoto. Once in Tarapoto, we will head directly to the ICT for a 5-6 day intensive (7:00 am – 8pm) course. Lodging and meals are included. At the end of the course, we will return to Pucallpa (again, your bus fare is included) for a special one-day workshop focusing on community and cacao producer organizations, associations, and committees. We will assume the cost of your food and lodging, with our team members, for three days in Pucallpa. These will be basic, safe, accommodations and simple, healthy meals. The whole course will be taught in Spanish. A team member will be able to serve as a part-time translator.

We will cover your round-trip expenses from Tarapoto to Pucallpa on the bus with the team, your participation in the course in Tarapoto including food and lodging, your participation in the mini course in Pucallpa, as well as food and lodging in Pucallpa for 3 days. All other expenses, including your ticket to Pucallpa, your travel and accident insurance (a requirement for participation), and your immunizations (also required) will be yours.

If you are interested in a tour of Pucallpa or Tarapoto before or after the event, we can put you in contact with reliable agencies and tour guides. If you are interested in continuing your journey to visit the island city of Iquitos, we can give arrange a 50% discount at the Hotel Emperador Terraza (http://emperadorterraza.com/web/) for a stay of up to four (4) days, in a double room with air conditioning or fan. (The course will take place in late March or early April 2016, date to be determined soon)


US $ 6000.00 Cacao Grower Hero

If you believe in this mission, and want to help make sure we can take our community representatives to the cacao training course, but can’t make the course, you can still sponsor 5 community members participation. We have put together this special package, just for you, our hero.  Due to Indiegogo’s limits on the number of perks, it is not currently listed in the clickable perks, so just let us know, and we can make it available to you.

To begin with, we will send you a thank you card signed by the course participants and hard-bound full color memory book describing the course. For a full description, see the Padrino de Cacaotero perk above. We will also arrange an opportunity for you to have a telephone or skype conversation with one of the course participants.

We will also send a gallery quality, black and white photo, hand printed on archival fiber paper. Each photo will be signed by the photographer and will be printed without any watermark. The photos were taken on 35mm Ilford film. You can choose from those available at: https://proyectovasi.wordpress.com/black-and-white-photosimagenes-en-blanco-y-negro/. (Shipping Date: September 2016)

In addition, you will receive, two Team VASI shirts, two VASI baseball hats, 75 seeds sown in your honor, and all the rest of the “Architect” Package.

US $ 8700.00 Community Nursery Sponsor (Limit 9)

Fundamental to the applied project’s success, will be the construction of community nurseries in each of the towns. These nurseries will be where we initially plant the cacao, tropical hardwood, and emergent canopy species that will go on to form the agroforestry fields.

As a community nursery sponsor or godparent, you will receive a thank you card signed by the town’s residents and a high-quality commemorative plaque in your name (or the name of the person(s) or organization you indicate). The plaque will include the nursery’s inauguration date and the name of the community. A similar, but weatherized plaque will hang over the nursery’s entrance recognizing your valuable and lasting contribution to sustainable development of the community.(Shipping date:  March 2017 depending on nursery inauguration dates)

You will also receive a hardbound, full color, memory book documenting the construction process and inauguration, and filled with interesting and fun facts about the community, cacao, and the project in general. The book will be bilingual, filled with color photos, and written in a fun, engaging, informative format. We will also arrange an opportunity for you to have a telephone or skype conversation with a community representative.

Your name will be listed in our official project sponsors list, and we will plant 100 seeds in your honor. In addition, you will receive four Team VASI shirts, four VASI baseball hats, and two of everything else in the “Architect” package.

$12,500 Thesis Sponsor & Amazon Tour (Limite 4)

You just became a thesis student’s sponsor, or in Perú they would say godparent. With this donation, you cover all the expenses associated with the development, implementation, and publication of a thesis project. In return for this amazing generosity, we offer you a completely one of a kind opportunity : a personalized tour of Iquitos and the surrounding Amazon for you and up to four of your friends or family. Depending on your schedule, we will do everything in our power to coordinate so the student you sponsor can meet you for a lunch, and, if you wish, accompany you as a personal tour guide for a few of your activities.  


You will get to see this unique island city, only reachable by plane or boat, spend time on the river, see where the two major sources of the Amazon join and their different colored waters mix, visit a butterfly farm, a manatee rehabilitation project, and a wildlife rehabilitation center. Your hotel room and most breakfasts and lunches are included. Details of the tour are listed below. In addition to this unique opportunity, we will also send you a personal thank you card from your thesis sponsor and a copy of their academic thesis proposal and final thesis. We will also send a bilingual, hardbound book, based on the student’s thesis, written in an engaging, fun, and informative style and filled with color photographs, that will allow you to learn about the thesis and project in general.  The book will be something you can share with pride on your coffee table or in your office, knowing that without you, this important study would not have happened ! We will also arrange for a skype or phone conversation with your sponsored student and will sow 100 seeds in your honor. You will receive 5 team VASI shirts and 5 VASI baseball hats as well as five of everything else in the “Architect” package.

Details of Iquitos and Amazon tour (a maximum of 5 people total per perk):

-Five (05) nights in the Hotel Emperador Terraza (http://emperadorterraza.com/web/) in up to two (02) rooms with, hot water, internet connection, cable tv, bilingual staff, your choice of airconditioning or fan.

-Breakfasts are included Monday-Saturday (if your stay includes a Sunday, there are excellent options nearby)

Four (04) lunches for your group

A welcoming meeting or meal with members of the project

Four (04) days of activities organized by the hosts, with transportation, entrance, and guide fees paid for by the group. We will work with you to create a schedule based on your interests.

One (01) free day in which you can explore on your own.

Sample schedule : (Again, we will work with you to create a schedule that best meets your interests and accommodates any needs or limitations. If you have particular needs, please, contact us first to make sure that we can properly accommodate them).

Day 1: Welcome lunch with project members, visits to the university campuses, and free time to explore the city and rest from your trip (lunch is included).

Day 2 : Visit to Quistacocha beach and zoo, and to the Manati Rescue Center http://www.centroderescateamazonico.com/index-en.php (picnic lunch included)

Day 3 : River trip with visits to the butterfly farm and animal orphanage (http://www.amazonanimalorphanage.org/), The Amazon River Lookout Tower, and a caiman, paiche, and pirana farm (picnic lunch included).

Day 4: Visit the city of Nauta, and joining of the rivers (picnic lunch included).

Day 5: A free day for you to take a self-guided tour of the city, the historical boat museums, artesan markets, floating neighborhood of Belén, and the rubber-boom era buildings of the city. Information and guide-services can be provided/hired if you prefer.

Day 6 : Return

If you wish to extend your stay with a visit to a Amazon lodge in the rainforest, we can arrange discounts at the Curassow Amazon Lodge (www.curassowlodge.com)-- minimum stay includes three days and two nights, and is dependent on availability.

Availability is dependent on prior arrangements. You must make your reservation with the hotel, before you book your flights or any other part of your trip. Please, do so in advance as the hotel is small and can fill-up quickly. Fares to and from Iquitos, dinnners, and other expenses not metioned above are not included. Travel insurance and vaccinations are required.

RISKS AND HURDLES

Risk: That the cacao does not produce as we expect and/or the market for high quality cacao crashes.

Our Method: Before our participating farmers even clear a weed or field, we are conducting studies to identify and select high-quality, high-producing, and resistant varieties, and we are thoroughly studying their requirements. We are working in close collaboration with multiple Peruvian institutions as well as the USDA. This will, however, be a process in which the farmers make consistent improvements. In addition, though cacao will be a focus, we are working to create a mixed system with a variety of products for both local and export consumption—if one market begins to fail, the other products will be there to help the farmers through.

Risk: One or multiple of the coordinating team members can not remain in their position (due to sickness, a change of jobs, accident, or what-have-you).

Our Method: People change, circumstances change, and life happens. With the idea of creating a long-term sustainable project, we are already recruiting people who can take over the coordinating team member roles (should need arise) and who, in the meantime, are deepening and broadening our expertise, energy, and networks.

Risk: Climate changes affect the communities in unprecedented ways.

Our Method: This is already happening, and is one of the driver’s of our project. Starting with the first phase, we are including research that focuses on understanding the ways in which climate changes are affecting the communities, ways they might affect the communities, ways in which the communities are successfully adapting, and strategies they could pursue. Working with the new effort to establish a cacao germplasm bank in Iquitos, we will be identifying cacao varieties most able to adapt the changing circumstances.

Risk: The exchange rate changes.

Our Method: In calculating our budget, we have used a slightly less favorable (to the project) than the average exchange rate over the past few years.

Conclusion

VASI, in the words of a local teacher, is a vision from Amazonia that proposes to help the world to live in a way that is economically, culturally, socially, spiritually, and ecologically sustainable and which includes and recognizes the rights of all people. We hope you will join us in supporting this exciting project.

Thank You!    ¡Gracias!   Irake!

Spanish version follows here.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

Versión en Español

VASI

Visión Amazónica para la Sostenibilidad Integral
Amazonian Vision for an Integrated Sustainability


VASI es Comunidad, Ciencia, Empoderamiento y Chocolate!

·  9 Comunidades Peruanas

·  Negocios Estadounidenses y Globales

·  Científicos Peruanos e Internacionales

·  Estudiantes de Universidades Peruanas 

VASI empodera a las comunidades, mejorando la calidad de vida de miles de personas, y te trae delicioso, sostenible, chocolate orgánico.

Colabora con nosotros a contribuir a la conservación y sostenibilidad de la Amazonía Peruana y de los Estados Unidos, a través de oportunidades de trabajo legales y sostenibles,  acceso a educación superior, e investigaciones científicas que provean información científica para contribuir a las políticas locales y  regionales.

La Problemática

  1. Extrema pobreza y la falta de actividades productivos cuales son legales y sostenibles.
  2. Las voces locales son excluidas. La mayoría del conocimiento científico de la Amazonía y los proyectos de desarrollo, vienen de fuentes externas o se llevan a cabo en centros urbanos o áreas de conservación, y mayormente no incluyen las voces de la gente local.
  3. Educación. Existen pocas oportunidades de buscar educación superior

¿Sabías que la Amazonía es el punto de orígen de cacao, la fruta de que viene Chocolate, y que una porción significativa del chocolate a nivel mundial está producido por niños y esclavos?

La Solución VASI

  1. Investigación científica colaborativa
  2. Becas para educación superior
  3. Proyectos de negocios sostenibles y dirigidos por las comunidades y acuerdos de comercio directos con chocolateras, chefs, mercados de alimentos de especialidad, y otros.

**Para nuestro documento técnico, haz clic aquí:  https://proyectovasi.wordpress.com/documents-and-publicationsdocumentos-y-publicaciones/

Una Oportunidad

Pocas son las variedades de cacao que son utilizadas a escala comercial. Basado en la falta de diversidad genética, el aumento de la presencia de plagas, y la creciente demanda, predicen que pronto no habrá producción suficiente de cacao para alcanzar la demanda de chocolate.

VASI desarrollará perfiles de sabores únicos, contribuirá a la conservación de la diversidad genética, y aumentará la resistencia a plagas e inundaciones, y utilizará variedades adaptadas a las condiciones locales. VASI utilizará variedades de cacao, silvestres, nativas, y de la vieja usanza. Nuestro cacao será exportado por medio de Tratados de Comercio Directos con Chocolateras Artesanales. Ya estamos estableciendo relaciones con chocolateras en Michigan y otras partes del mundo y Perú.


La creciente presión en las comunidades, paisajes, y recursos, la falta de servicios básicos y la extrema pobreza, la escasez de oportunidades legales y sostenibles, y el hecho de que pocos residentes tienen las oportunidades de continuar sus estudios más allá de secundaria, deja vulnerables a los residentes del area del proyecto, impotentes, y más susceptibles a quedar atrapados en actividades ilegales y/o no sostenibles. 

Amazonía

  • Lugar de origen del cacao, el fruto de donde obtenemos el chocolate.
  • La Amazonía es uno de los grandes cuerpos de agua dulce del mundo.
  • La Cuenca del Amazonas posee uno de los mayors niveles de diversidad biológica y cultural del mundo.
  • La Amazonía juega un importante rol en el clima global.

VASI, una visión integral para contribuir a la conservación del agua dulce y la biodiversidad, para ayudar a estabilizar el clima mundial, y para empoderar a las comunidades para que enfrenten estos desafíos.

_______________________

Hay varias maneras de apoyar, visitando (www.proyectovasi.org) o escribiéndonos a info@proyectovasi.org

Por favor, toma un minute para compartir el link de nuestra campaña  en todas tus redes sociales (Facebook, Linked-In, Google+, Pinterest, Twitter, etc), vía correo electrónico y en conversaciones personales con amigos, colegas y familiars. Por favor, comparte con frecuencia durante la duración de nuestra campaña. Nos encantaría que usted nos siga a través de nuestra página web/blog www.proyectovasi.org, twitter @proyectovasi, y/o Facebook www.facebook.com/proyectovasi.

Por favor visita nuestro pagina de web para ver una lista de material y equipo especializado que aceptamos en especie;

https://proyectovasi.wordpress.com/to-donate/


Qué Necesitamos

Para un ensayo tecnico detallado sobre nuestro presupuesto y planes, por favor, haga clic aquí (https://proyectovasi.wordpress.com/documents-and-publicationsdocumentos-y-publicaciones/)

Nuestro objetivo inmediato: US$ 110,791.00.

Obetivo ideal: US$ 376,585.00

Hemos priorizado y dividido nuestro presupuesto en tres fases, cada una de aproximadamente 4 a 6 meses de trabajo. Nuestro objetivo inmediato, aquí en Indiegogo es para la primera fase del proyectom 4-6 meses de trabajo, US$ 110,791.00. Nuesta esperanza es el financiamiento total de nuestras primeras tres fases del proyecto, un total de US$ 376,585.00.

Estos fondos nos permitirán poner en marcha el proyecto y desarrollar la credibilidad del proyecto, debido a que aplicamos por fondos institucionales y grandes subvenciones. Si pasamos nuestro objetivo, vamos a ser capaces de seguir adelante con más ímpetu. Si no llegamos a la meta, utilizaremos lo recolectado en el orden descrito a continuación. Cada actividad se basa en la anterior y tendrá un impacto significativo en sí mismo.

______

* Primer Encuentro en el distrito de Sarayacu: US$ 7,795.00

Un encuentro de tres días en una de las comunidades céntricamente localizadas, con los representantes de las comunidades, científicos, autoridades regionales, otros expertos invitados, y representantes de los estudiantes.

* Crear una estructura legalmente reconocida en el Perú: US$ 3,362.00

* Estudios científicos, otorgando oportunidad para 2 tesis y 3 internados: US$ 36,998.00

1. Características y requisitos del cacao que crece en el distrito, 2. Pesca y la calidad del agua, y 3. Efectos del cambio climático en la pesca y la agricultura locales.

* Tecnología: US$ 1,177.00

Compra de USB y discos duros. Si usted tiene esta tecnología para donar, por favor vea:

https://proyectovasi.wordpress.com/to-donate/

* Asistir al curso de cacao de 5 días del Instituto de Variedades Tropicales y recibir los negocios VASI y organización de taller: US$ 29,893.00

ESTA ES UNA OPORTUNIDAD ÚNICA para nosotros. Un equipo de 2 representantes de cada pueblo, 3 estudiantes, 3 miembros del equipo coordinador y el administrador de proyectos/agente de extensión asistirá a un curso intensivo de 5 días sobre cacao, dirigido por ICT en Tarapoto, Perú (uno de las instituciones sobre el cacao más respetadas del mundo), y realizar nuestro taller de 1 día con expositores invitados sobre el negocio y aspectos organizativos del cacao.

* Agente de Extensión / Administrador de Proyecto: US$ 19,158.00

Seis meses de salario y otros gastos para un administrador de proyecto/agente de extensión con experiencia en cacao.

* Trabajo y Viajes del Equipo de Coordinación: US$ 12,408.00

Viajes y costos de comunicación del equipo de coordinación y agente de extensión.

_______

SEGUNDA FASE (aproximadamente cuatro meses más de trabajo) (US$ 228,016.00), será:

Segundo Proyecto-Encuentro en el distrito: US$ 7,785.00

Construir viveros en cada pueblo participante: US$ 77,305.00

Crear y financiar el primer año de beca: US$ 15,882.00

Trabajo y viajes del equipo de coordinación: US$ 16,253.00

Comunicación, viaje en el distrito a ciudades peruanas y de EE.UU.

________

TERCERA FASE (Total: US$ 376,585.00)

Agente de Extensión / Administrador de Proyecto (segundos 6 meses): US$ 19,158.00

Extenderemos al agente de extensión para cubrir un total de un año.

Continuar primeros tres estudios en el área (3 pasantías más y 2 tesis más): US$ 35,607.00

Tercer Proyecto-Encuentro en el distrito: US$ 7,795.00

Trabajo y viajes del equipo de coordinación: US$ 20,749.00

Comunicación, viaje en el distrito a ciudades peruanas y de EE.UU.

Pruebas de agua y suelo especializadas, equipos y análisis: US$ 34,773.00

Llevar a cabo pruebas avanzadas de agua y suelo, en busca de concentraciones de metales pesados y toxinas, así como otros factores ecológicos.

Tecnología y equipo especializado: US$ 30,487.00

 ¿Eres una empresa de tecnología? ¿Un especialista en equipos al aire libre? ¿O es que tienes usado en buena forma tecnología para donar? Estamos buscando donaciones de iPad/tablets, PC portátiles, cámaras fotográficas, GPS y otros equipos. Por favor vea nuestra lista completa en: https://proyectovasi.wordpress.com/to-donate/  o contáctenos a info@proyectovasi.com

_______

Más de US$ 376,585.00 

Si recibimos más de US$ 376,585.00 de financiamiento, nuestra primera prioridad será asegurar que tenemos el dinero para los primeros cinco años de la beca, así como fondos para las actividades de 2017. También podremos incluir más comunidades (otras comunidades vecinas ya han comenzado a expresar su interés) y proporcionar becas adicionales (nuestro objetivo a largo plazo es de 2 por comunidad).

Recompensas

Para ver los detalles de los recompensas en español, por favor, visita nuestra pagina de web, y revisa la siguiente: https://proyectovasi.wordpress.com/recompensasperks-por-la-campana-de-vasi-en-indiegog/

. Pedimos disculpa que éste plataforma, no nos da suficiente espacio. 

*** Algunas notas importantes:

1. Fechas aproximadas de envío se enumeran aquí para cada elemento. Estos son los peores escenarios. Esperamos que las cosas vayan a enviar mucho más pronto de lo que pensamos.

2. Los beneficios se enumeran en español y en inglés.

3. Límites de las beneficios son, independientemente del idioma en el que se elige (por ejemplo, hay seis en total disponible bajo los términos de internado y practica, vamos a tratar de mantener los números actualizados sobre la base de lo que se ha afirmado).

4. Nuestras camisetas y gorras de béisbol son únicos, diseñado y cosido especialmente para nosotros en tiendas éticas con algodón orgánico. A diferencia de la mayoría de las camisetas de producción masiva y goras, éstos son únicos, y nuestro diseño no serán utilizados.

Riesgos Y Obstáculos

Riesgo: Que el cacao no produzca lo esperado y/o el Mercado para cacao de alta calidad caiga.

Nuestro Método: Antes de que nuestros agricultores participantes limpien sus chacras, nosotros estamos llevando a cabo estudios para identificar y seleccionar variedades de alta calidad, de alta producción, y resistentes. Estamos estudiando a fondo sus necesidades. Estamos trabajando en estrecha colaboración con múltiples instituciones peruanas, así como el USDA. Además, aunque el cacao será un foco, estamos trabajando para crear un sistema mixto con una variedad de productos, tanto para el consumo local y la exportación; si un mercado comienza a caer, los demás productos estarán allí para ayudar a los agricultores.

Riesgo: Uno o varios de los miembros del equipo de coordinación no pueden permanecer en su posición (por enfermedad, un cambio de puestos de trabajo, accidente, o lo que usted quiera).

Nuestro Método: La gente cambia, las circunstancias cambian, y la vida pasa. Con la idea de crear un proyecto sostenible a largo plazo, ya estamos reclutando personas que pueden hacerse cargo de las funciones de los miembros del equipo de coordinación (si habrá necesidad) y que, mientras tanto, están profundizando y ampliando nuestra experiencia, energía y redes.

Riesgo: Los cambios climáticos afectan a las comunidades de una manera sin precedentes.

Nuestro Método: Esto ya está sucediendo, y es uno de los impulsos de nuestro proyecto. A partir de la primera fase en el proyecto, estamos incluyendo la investigación que se centra en la comprensión de las formas en que los cambios climáticos están afectando a las comunidades, las maneras en que pueden afectar a las comunidades, las formas en que las comunidades se están adaptando con éxito, y las estrategias que podrían seguir. Trabajaremos también con el nuevo esfuerzo para establecer un banco germplasma de cacao en Iquitos, estaremos identificando variedades de cacao más capaces de adaptarse a las circunstancias cambiantes.

Riesgo: Cambios en los tipos de cambio.

Nuestro Método: En el cálculo de nuestro presupuesto, hemos utilizado un tipo de cambio un poco menos favorable (al proyecto) que el promedio en los últimos años.

Conclusión

VASI, en palabras de un profesor local, es una visión de la Amazonia que se propone ayudar al mundo a vivir de una manera que sea económica, cultural, social, espiritual y ecológicamente sostenible y que incluye y reconoce los derechos de todas las personas. Esperamos que se unan a nosotros para apoyar este emocionante proyecto.


Thank You!    ¡Gracias!   Irake!
story_txt:
VASIVisión
Amazónica para la Sostenibilidad IntegralAmazonian Vision for an Integrated Sustainability

 Para Español, por favor haz clic aquí
VASI is
Community, Science, Empowerment, and Chocolate
· 
9 Peruvian
communities
· 
US and Global
Businesses
· 
Peruvian and
international scientists 
· 
Peruvian
University students 

VASI empowers communities, bettering 1000s of peoples’ lives, and
brings you delicious, sustainable, organic chocolate.
Collaborate with us to
contribute to the conservation and sustainability of the Peruvian Amazonian
region and the United States by helping to create legal and sustainable
business opportunities, providing access to higher education, and developing scientific
research to inform both local and regional policy and development decisions.
The
Challenge


Extreme poverty and the lack of access to legal, sustainable
     income producing activities. 

Lack of local input. The majority of scientific knowledge about,
     and development projects in, the Amazon comes from or take place near
     urban centers or conservation areas, and most often these do not include
     the voice of the local people. 

Education. There is little opportunity to pursue higher
     education, and even less opportunity for a university graduate to apply
     their degree working in their home area. 

Did you know the Amazon is home to cacao—the fruit that gives us
Chocolate, and that a significant
portion of the world’s chocolate is produced by forced child labor and slaves?

The VASI
Solution

Community driven scientific research 
Scholarships for higher education 
Community driven sustainable business projects and direct trade agreements to craft
     chocolate makers, chefs, specialty food markets, and others.


**For a full White Paper,
please, click here: https://proyectovasi.wordpress.com/documents-and-publicationsdocumentos-y-publicaciones/

An Opportunity



Few varieties of cacao are used on the commercial
scale. Based on the lack of genetic diversity, the increasing presence of pests
and fungal issues, and increasing demand, soon there may not be enough production of cacao to meet demand for
chocolate. 
VASI
will use wild, native, and heirloom
varieties of cacao to develop unique
flavor profiles, contribute to the conservation of genetic diversity,
increase resistance to plagues and floods, and be adapted to local conditions. Our
cacao will be exported via direct trade
agreements to craft chocolate makers. We are already establishing
relationships with chocolate makers in Michigan and other parts of the world
and Peru.
Growing pressure on the communities,
landscapes, and resources, the lack of basic services and extreme poverty, the
dearth of legal, sustainable, opportunities, and the fact that few residents
have the opportunity to further their studies beyond secondary school, leave
project area residents vulnerable, disempowered, and more likely to get caught
up in dangerous unsustainable and/or illegal activities. 
THE AMAZON


The Amazon is the birthplace of
     cacao—the fruit from which we get chocolate

The Amazon is one of the
     world’s two largest bodies of fresh water
The Amazon Basin contains one of
     the highest levels of biological and cultural diversity in the world
The Amazon plays a significant
     role in global climate




VASI an integrated vision to contribute to the
conservation of freshwater and biodiversity, to help stabilize global climate,
and to empower communities to meet these challenges. 
_______________________

There are a variety of ways in which you can help.
Please, visiting us here (www.proyectovasi.org)
or write us at info@proyectovasi.org.

Please, take a minute now to share our campaign link
https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/vasi-amazonian-vision-4-integrated-sustainability
on all your social networks (Facebook, Linked-in, Google+, Pinterest, Twitter,
etc.) via direct emails, and in face-to-face conversation with your
friends, colleagues, and family. And, please, share it frequently throughout
the duration of our campaign. We would love it if you would follow us on our
webpage/blog www.proyectovasi.org,
twitter @proyectovasi, and/or Facebook www.facebook.com/proyectovasi. 
To see a list of specialized gear and tech we will accept
in-kind, please, see our “Wish List” at: https://proyectovasi.wordpress.com/to-donate/
What We Need
For a
detailed white paper regarding our budget and plans, please, click here: (https://proyectovasi.wordpress.com/documents-and-publicationsdocumentos-y-publicaciones/)

Our Immediate Goal: $110,791.00.
Stretch Goal: $376,585.00
We have
prioritized and divided our budget into three phases, each roughly represents
4-6 months of work. 
To
implement our first phase, 4-6 months of work,  we need $110,791.00. Our hope:
full funding for the first three phases of project, a total of$376,585.00.
These funds will allow us to jump-start the project and develop
the project’s credibility as we apply for institutional funds and large grants.
If we pass our goal, we will be able to continue moving forward with even more
momentum. If we fall short of this goal, we will use what we raise in the order
described below. Each activity builds on the one before and will have a
significant impact of its own.
______* Project-wide meeting
in the District of Sarayacu: $7795.00
A three day
meeting with community representatives, 
scientists, regional authorities, other invited experts, and student
representatives. 

* Create a legally recognized organizational structure (NGO/non-profit
or Association) in Perú: $3,362.00

* Scientific studies, providing opportunity for 2 thesis students
and 3 interns $36,998.00
1. Characteristics and requirements of cacao growing
in the district, 2. Fisheries and water quality, and 3. Effects of climate

RISKS AND HURDLES
Risk: That the cacao does not produce as we expect
and/or the market for high quality cacao crashes. 
Our Method: Before our participating
farmers even clear a weed or field, we are conducting studies to identify and
select high-quality, high-producing, and resistant varieties, and we are
thoroughly studying their requirements. We are working in close collaboration
with multiple Peruvian institutions as well as the USDA. This will, however, be
a process in which the farmers make consistent improvements. In addition,
though cacao will be a focus, we are working to create a mixed system with a
variety of products for both local and export consumption—if one market begins
to fail, the other products will be there to help the farmers through. 
Risk: One or multiple of the coordinating team
members can not remain in their position (due to sickness, a change of jobs,
accident, or what-have-you). 
Our Method: People change,
circumstances change, and life happens. With the idea of creating a long-term
sustainable project, we are already recruiting people who can take over the
coordinating team member roles (should need arise) and who, in the meantime,
are deepening and broadening our expertise, energy, and networks. 
Risk: Climate changes affect the communities in
unprecedented ways. 
Our Method: This is already
happening, and is one of the driver’s of our project. Starting with the first
phase, we are including research that focuses on understanding the ways in which
climate changes are affecting the communities, ways they might affect the
communities, ways in which the communities are successfully adapting, and
strategies they could pursue. Working with the new effort to establish a cacao
germplasm bank in Iquitos, we will be identifying cacao varieties most able to
adapt the changing circumstances. 
Risk: The exchange rate changes. 
Our Method: In calculating our
budget, we have used a slightly less favorable (to the project) than the
average exchange rate over the past few years.
Conclusion
VASI, in
the words of a local teacher, is a vision from Amazonia that proposes to help
the world to live in a way that is economically, culturally, socially,
spiritually, and ecologically sustainable and which includes and recognizes the
rights of all people. We hope you will join us in supporting this exciting
project. Thank You!    ¡Gracias!   Irake!Spanish version follows here.---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Versión en EspañolVASIVisión Amazónica para la Sostenibilidad IntegralAmazonian Vision for an Integrated Sustainability

VASI es Comunidad, Ciencia, Empoderamiento y
Chocolate!
· 
9 Comunidades Peruanas
· 
Negocios Estadounidenses y Globales
· 
Científicos Peruanos e Internacionales 
· 
Estudiantes de Universidades Peruanas 

VASI empodera a las
comunidades, mejorando la calidad de vida de miles de personas, y te trae
delicioso, sostenible, chocolate orgánico.
Colabora con nosotros a contribuir a la conservación y sostenibilidad
de la Amazonía Peruana y de los Estados Unidos, a través de oportunidades
de trabajo legales y sostenibles,  acceso a educación superior, e investigaciones científicas que provean información científica para contribuir a las políticas locales y  regionales.

La Problemática


Extrema pobreza y la falta de actividades productivos
     cuales son legales y sostenibles.

Las voces locales son excluidas. La mayoría del
     conocimiento científico de la Amazonía y los proyectos de desarrollo,
     vienen de fuentes externas o se llevan a cabo en centros urbanos o áreas de
     conservación, y mayormente no incluyen las voces de la gente local.

Educación. Existen pocas oportunidades de buscar educación
     superior

¿Sabías que la Amazonía es el punto de
orígen de cacao, la fruta de que viene Chocolate, y que una porción significativa
del chocolate a nivel mundial está producido por niños y esclavos?
La Solución VASI


Investigación
     científica colaborativa
Becas para
     educación superior 
Proyectos de
     negocios sostenibles y dirigidos por las comunidades y acuerdos de comercio directos con chocolateras,
     chefs, mercados de alimentos de especialidad, y otros.



**Para nuestro documento técnico, haz clic aquí:  https://proyectovasi.wordpress.com/documents-and-publicationsdocumentos-y-publicaciones/Una Oportunidad


Pocas son
las variedades de cacao que son utilizadas a escala comercial. Basado en la
falta de diversidad genética, el aumento de la presencia de plagas, y
la creciente demanda, predicen que pronto no habrá producción suficiente de
cacao para alcanzar la demanda de chocolate.

VASI
desarrollará perfiles de sabores únicos, contribuirá a la
conservación de la diversidad genética, y aumentará la resistencia a plagas e
inundaciones, y utilizará variedades adaptadas a las condiciones locales. VASI
utilizará variedades de cacao, silvestres, nativas, y de la vieja usanza.
Nuestro cacao será exportado por medio de Tratados de Comercio Directos con Chocolateras
Artesanales. Ya estamos estableciendo relaciones con chocolateras en
Michigan y otras partes del mundo y Perú.

La
creciente presión en las comunidades, paisajes, y recursos, la falta de
servicios básicos y la extrema pobreza, la escasez de oportunidades legales y sostenibles,
y el hecho de que pocos residentes tienen las oportunidades de continuar sus
estudios más allá de secundaria, deja vulnerables a los residentes del area del proyecto, impotentes, y más susceptibles a quedar atrapados en actividades
ilegales y/o no sostenibles. 
Amazonía

Lugar de origen del cacao, el fruto de donde obtenemos el
     chocolate.
La Amazonía es uno de los grandes cuerpos de agua dulce del mundo.
La Cuenca del Amazonas posee uno de los mayors niveles de
     diversidad biológica y cultural del mundo.
La Amazonía juega un importante rol en el clima global.
VASI, una visión integral para contribuir a la conservación del agua dulce y la biodiversidad, para ayudar a estabilizar el clima mundial, y para empoderar a las comunidades para que enfrenten estos desafíos._______________________

tres fases del proyecto, un total de US$ 376,585.00.
Estos fondos
nos permitirán poner en marcha el proyecto y desarrollar la credibilidad del
proyecto, debido a que aplicamos por fondos institucionales y grandes subvenciones.
Si pasamos nuestro objetivo, vamos a ser capaces de seguir adelante con más
ímpetu. Si no llegamos a la meta, utilizaremos lo recolectado en el orden
descrito a continuación. Cada actividad se basa en la anterior y tendrá un
impacto significativo en sí mismo.
______
* Primer Encuentro en el distrito de
Sarayacu: US$ 7,795.00
Un encuentro de
tres días en una de las comunidades céntricamente localizadas, con los
representantes de las comunidades, científicos, autoridades regionales, otros
expertos invitados, y representantes de los estudiantes.
* Crear una estructura legalmente
reconocida en el Perú: US$ 3,362.00

* Estudios científicos, otorgando
oportunidad para 2 tesis y 3 internados: US$ 36,998.00
1. Características y requisitos del cacao que crece en
el distrito, 2. Pesca y la calidad del agua, y 3. Efectos del cambio climático
en la pesca y la agricultura locales.
* Tecnología: US$ 1,177.00
Compra de USB y discos duros. Si usted tiene esta
tecnología para donar, por favor vea:
https://proyectovasi.wordpress.com/to-donate/
* Asistir al curso de cacao de 5 días del
Instituto de Variedades Tropicales y recibir los negocios VASI y organización
de taller: US$ 29,893.00
ESTA ES UNA OPORTUNIDAD
ÚNICA para nosotros. Un equipo de 2 representantes de cada pueblo, 3
estudiantes, 3 miembros del equipo coordinador y el administrador de proyectos/agente
de extensión asistirá a un curso intensivo de 5 días sobre cacao, dirigido por
ICT en Tarapoto, Perú (uno de las instituciones sobre el cacao más respetadas
del mundo), y realizar nuestro taller de 1 día con expositores invitados sobre
el negocio y aspectos organizativos del cacao.
* Agente de Extensión / Administrador de
Proyecto: US$ 19,158.00
Seis meses de
salario y otros gastos para un administrador de proyecto/agente de extensión
con experiencia en cacao.
* Trabajo y Viajes del Equipo de
Coordinación: US$ 12,408.00
Viajes y costos
de comunicación del equipo de coordinación y agente de extensión.
_______
SEGUNDA FASE (aproximadamente cuatro meses más de
trabajo) (US$ 228,016.00), será:
Segundo Proyecto-Encuentro en el
distrito: US$ 7,785.00

Construir viveros en cada pueblo
participante: US$ 77,305.00
Crear y financiar el primer año de beca:
US$ 15,882.00
Trabajo y viajes del equipo de
coordinación: US$ 16,253.00
Comunicación,
viaje en el distrito a ciudades peruanas y de EE.UU.
________
TERCERA FASE (Total: US$ 376,585.00)

Agente de Extensión / Administrador de
Proyecto (segundos 6 meses): US$ 19,158.00
Extenderemos al
agente de extensión para cubrir un total de un año.
Continuar primeros tres estudios en el
área (3 pasantías más y 2 tesis más): US$ 35,607.00
Tercer Proyecto-Encuentro en el
distrito: US$ 7,795.00

Trabajo y viajes del equipo de
coordinación: US$ 20,749.00
Comunicación,
viaje en el distrito a ciudades peruanas y de EE.UU.
Pruebas de agua y suelo especializadas,
equipos y análisis: US$ 34,773.00
Llevar a cabo
pruebas avanzadas de agua y suelo, en busca de concentraciones de metales
pesados y toxinas, así como otros factores ecológicos.
Tecnología y equipo especializado: US$
30,487.00
 ¿Eres una empresa de tecnología? ¿Un especialista
en equipos al aire libre? ¿O es que tienes usado en buena forma tecnología para
donar? Estamos buscando donaciones de iPad/tablets, PC portátiles, cámaras
fotográficas, GPS y otros equipos. Por favor vea nuestra lista completa en: https://proyectovasi.wordpress.com/to-donate/
 o contáctenos a info@proyectovasi.com
_______
Más de US$ 376,585.00 
Si recibimos
más de US$ 376,585.00 de financiamiento, nuestra primera prioridad será
asegurar que tenemos el dinero para los primeros cinco años de la beca, así como
fondos para las actividades de 2017. También podremos incluir más comunidades
(otras comunidades vecinas ya han comenzado a expresar su interés) y
proporcionar becas adicionales (nuestro objetivo a largo plazo es de 2 por
comunidad).Recompensas
Para ver los detalles de los recompensas en español, por favor, visita nuestra pagina de web, y revisa la siguiente: https://proyectovasi.wordpress.com/recompensasperks-por-la-campana-de-vasi-en-indiegog/
. Pedimos disculpa que éste plataforma, no nos da suficiente espacio. 
*** Algunas notas importantes:
1. Fechas aproximadas de envío se enumeran aquí para cada elemento. Estos
son los peores escenarios. Esperamos que las cosas vayan a enviar mucho más
pronto de lo que pensamos.
2. Los beneficios se enumeran en español y en inglés.
3. Límites de las beneficios son, independientemente del idioma en el que
se elige (por ejemplo, hay seis en total disponible bajo los términos de internado
y practica, vamos a tratar de mantener los números actualizados sobre la base
de lo que se ha afirmado).
4. Nuestras camisetas y gorras de béisbol son únicos, diseñado y cosido
especialmente para nosotros en tiendas éticas con algodón orgánico. A
diferencia de la mayoría de las camisetas de producción masiva y goras,
éstos son únicos, y nuestro diseño no serán utilizados.


Riesgos Y Obstáculos


Riesgo: Que el cacao no produzca lo esperado y/o el
Mercado para cacao de alta calidad caiga.
Nuestro Método: Antes de que nuestros
agricultores participantes limpien sus chacras, nosotros estamos llevando a
cabo estudios para identificar y seleccionar variedades de alta calidad, de
alta producción, y resistentes. Estamos estudiando a fondo sus necesidades.
Estamos trabajando en estrecha colaboración con múltiples instituciones
peruanas, así como el USDA. Además, aunque el cacao será un foco, estamos trabajando
para crear un sistema mixto con una variedad de productos, tanto para el
consumo local y la exportación; si un mercado comienza a caer, los demás
productos estarán allí para ayudar a los agricultores.

Riesgo: Uno o varios de los miembros del equipo de
coordinación no pueden permanecer en su posición (por enfermedad, un cambio de
puestos de trabajo, accidente, o lo que usted quiera).
Nuestro Método: La gente cambia, las
circunstancias cambian, y la vida pasa. Con la idea de crear un proyecto sostenible
a largo plazo, ya estamos reclutando personas que pueden hacerse cargo de las
funciones de los miembros del equipo de coordinación (si habrá necesidad)
y que, mientras tanto, están profundizando y ampliando nuestra experiencia,
energía y redes.
Riesgo: Los cambios climáticos afectan a las
comunidades de una manera sin precedentes.
Nuestro Método: Esto ya está sucediendo,
y es uno de los impulsos de nuestro proyecto. A partir de la primera fase en el
proyecto, estamos incluyendo la investigación que se centra en la comprensión
de las formas en que los cambios climáticos están afectando a las comunidades,
las maneras en que pueden afectar a las comunidades, las formas en que las
comunidades se están adaptando con éxito, y las estrategias que podrían seguir.
Trabajaremos también con el nuevo esfuerzo para establecer un banco germplasma
de cacao en Iquitos, estaremos identificando variedades de cacao más capaces de
adaptarse a las circunstancias cambiantes.
Riesgo: Cambios en los tipos de cambio.
Nuestro Método: En el cálculo de nuestro
presupuesto, hemos utilizado un tipo de cambio un poco menos favorable (al
proyecto) que el promedio en los últimos años.

Conclusión

VASI, en
palabras de un profesor local, es una visión de la Amazonia que se propone
ayudar al mundo a vivir de una manera que sea económica, cultural, social,
espiritual y ecológicamente sostenible y que incluye y reconoce los derechos de
todas las personas. Esperamos que se unan a nosotros para apoyar este
emocionante proyecto.

Thank You!    ¡Gracias!   Irake!

story:
YES, we are going into production no matter if the full goal is raised or not.

We decided to use indiegogo for our pre-sales because of the simplicity of the platform.

 

SURPRISE!!!!

I am so excited about the Prototype Planner campaign that I couldn't wait to share it with you. I am going to give all of you the PDF version of the Prototype Planner RIGHT NOW. Your support of the Prototype Planner means so much. I'm happy to offer you this special gift.

__________________________________________________________________________

 

Why the name? Is it a Prototype?

No it's not a prototype, it is a ready to go finalized, tested, sampled and re-sampled product.

Then why the name Pro·to·type Planner?

Every one of us is a prototype, and we work hard every day to become a better version of ourselves for our tomorrows. That's what this Pro·to·type planner is all about. 

Pro·to·type Planner was developed to take those big dreams, that often seem unreachable, and cut them into quarterly goals. The layout then allows you to integrate them into your daily life by establishing new habits, weekly projects and focusing on your successes to keep your momentum. 

 

The Prototype Planner makes entrepreneurship easier by eliminating goal paralysis, providing simple financial planning and tracking formats, motivating self-development through a workout tracker and gratitude journal, encouraging social outreach to networking contacts, and facilitating planning for projects and marketing.

The Prototype Planner is a roadmap for entrepreneurs. It puts everything you need in one place, so you can stay on top of looming deadlines and major goals.

Stop Wasting Time, and Start Getting Stuff Done

You can stop wasting your time, wasting your money, and wasting your efforts on research, trying out planner after planner to find one that fits. With the Prototype Planner, you will have a planner that was designed with YOU in mind, by a busy business owner who has been where you are, and knows what you need. Running a business, staying healthy and finding time for personal life and growth... 

now it's all possible in one streamlined planner.   

 

 

This life-changing planner will bring all the little bits together in one cohesive package. Get organized and accomplish everything you want to create the life you envision, while looking like the stylish professional your are.

 

 

 

You'll never lose another business card, because you can simply tuck each one right into the vegan leather cover of your planner - the perfect place for when you sit down and schedule out your follow up communications! Plus, with the built in pen holder, you'll never have to fiddle around in your purse or ask someone to borrow their stuff again!

 

 The Prototype Planner contains these layouts:  

  • Yearly theme, goals, and habit plans
  • Discovery pages for you and your perfect client
  • Content Planner
  • 3 month goal planning
  • Month-at-a-glance with financial tracking
  • Weekly overview with project planning & habit tracking
  • Daily layout with gratitude journaling
  • Project, task, and deadline tracking

 

Make sure to check out our Indiegogo Gallery Page for more closeups of all the features

 

Everybody dreams big, but sometimes actually accomplishing those dreams can seem overwhelming. Take some time to define your biggest goals, and then plan out what you'll do during the year to get there. Find collaborators to help, form new habits that will impact your productivity, and record your progress to stay motivated.

 

 

 

No more Goal-Paralasys!  Pro·to·type Planner helps you determine all those little steps leading you to your big goal.

 

 

Know immediately how many projects you're working on at any given time, how far out you're booked, and when you're available for your next client. 

 

 

Each weekly spread includes a place for you to list potential clients, as well as remind yourself of calls or emails you need to make. 

 

 

Indiegogo allows backers to share campaigns with their own referral link and even better, let's us track those. Now what's better than using that feature to get you your planner for FREE?!
When you share the Pro·to·type Planner through Indiegogo, we will refund you $5 towards your planner for each referral! If you buy early, that's just 6 referrals to get your planner for FREE!

 

How does that work?

While logged in with your Indiegogo account, use any of the links on the top right (right below the goal) to share the campaign. When someone pledges through that link the system will record it and you earned your first $5 ;)
Sorry no cash out, this goes towards your planner only.

 

Just find these buttons on top of the page:

 

I am so excited to bring this new planner to life. If you have any questions about any of it, please don't hesitate to let me know! I would love to help you understand more about the planner, why I built it, and the value it can bring to you! Give me a shout on Twitter, send me a message, or join the Facebook Group! Get to a place where your planner becomes one of the best assets of your business. Pledge now to get the Prototype Planner for yourself, and start creating the success you’ve dreamed of!

 

In 2014, I dealt with the loss of my dear husband, Peter. Paperwork was a nightmare because it was everywhere, and difficult to find; notebooks, sticky notes, random scraps of paper. I was overwhelmed and frustrated with the complexity of the tasks I needed to perform.  

My frustration sparked the idea to build the Prototype Planner. It has evolved into a product that worked so well for me that I know will help you run your business and your personal life – at the same time and all in one place. End the frustration and stress by keeping important information in one reliable place – The Pro To Type Planner.

 

 

Like traveling down a well known road, The Pro to type Planner lifts the burden of coordinating different tasks by putting you in the driver's seat and highlighting the way for you. You can find all the important information you need, together in one place. It will make you more efficient than you ever thought possible.

 

The idea behind Pro·to·type Planner is simple: If you can find it at your fingertips, you are more likely to do it! That leads to success in your personal and business lives. Don’t let goals slip by without following up. A goal without a plan is just a wish.

 

A Model of Simplicity and Efficiency

  • Gain confidence that your personal and business goals will be reached
  • Stay on track easier because all of the important information is at your fingertips
  • Maintain happier clients by streamlining customer service follow-up
  • Increase personal inspiration by keeping up with goals for healthy habits

 

It's a well known fact that the most successful business peoples, the ones who manage to astonish everyone with the sheer volume of work they can accomplish in a day, all have one simple thing in common: They plan their days, and they work their plan. They hold themselves accountable for setting and reaching their goals. They work smart, and find tools that help them do their best work in the most efficient way possible.  

 

The Pro.to.type Planner is such a tool.

 

 

Find more inspiration and productivity tips on Pro·to·type's Instagram.

 

Creating the Pro-to-Type Planner hasn't been an easy road. Many ups and downs, changes, adjustments and lessons to learn... but here we are ;)

Here's the thing: I KNOW this planner can revolutionize your life as a busy boss. I KNOW it can help you get more done in less time. I KNOW it can be your best friend when it comes to your business. I know because it did all these things for me. This planner will be reality and nothing can stop it!

Time is always a big challenge, getting this planner out to our backers as soon as possible and in time for their 2017 planning is hugely important to us. We are doing our best to keep our timetable. Things can happen, so please stay patient with us in case of a delay.

We ask that backers respond to the information survey as quickly as possible after this campaign ends so we can get the planner to you ASAP.

story:
HELLO, WE'RE BACON BOXES.

Dear Friends & Supporters,

We humbly stand before you to request your continued support. Join us for the expansion of Bacon Boxes. 

We are in a bit of a predicament. There is no hiding the fact that we have outgrown our kitchen. Many of you know that we are limited in space and if you do not submit your order early chances are we can’t provide. It breaks our heart just as much as it does yours. It’s time that we invest in the future of bacon. With your help we can eliminate our limitations, offer more products, offer quicker shipping times and impact our community economically and agriculturally.

OUR GOAL:

Bacon Boxes is in need of a larger and more equipped space. So far we have worked really hard to raise funding from sales and our goal is to raise a minimum of $100,000 from sales and crowdfunding. We’re stuck intermittently with a cramped workflow while running at capacity and a limitation to raise higher capital based on those two factors alone. 

Our crowd funder is not all for fun and games. We mean business. It took a lot for us to conclude that this method of fund raising would be best for us. The co-founders, Kim and Logan, applied to receive a loan however with only being incorporated for a year it was found that Bacon Boxes does not qualify for private bank loans or SBA funding until completing two years of business. Instead of asking for handouts we have created incentive packages and teamed up with an artist to bring you the latest styles of bacon apparel in the hopes to meet and exceed our funding goals. Any proceeds raised over the cost of our buildout will be donated to a charity that supports responsible farming and advocates for small family owned farms. 

WHAT WE NEED:

1. Space (est. $2,500-2,800/M)

We currently work out of a 500 sq ft space and are able to cater to 200 orders a week. We aren't able to fit any more refrigeration which means we can't cure for additional orders or even think about offering new products. Having a space will open many doors. We're aiming to expand into a 1,700-2500 sq ft space. 

2. Kitchen Equipment (est. $32,000)

With the buildout of our own space we will be needing to purchase refrigerators, freezers, ovens, smokers, sinks, workstations and more! If you have any used equipment you're looking to get rid of please contact us. To keep the cost and environmental impact low we will be purchasing used, repurposed and refurbished. 

3. Installation (est. $15,000-18,000)

This budget is for small renovations, painting, plumbing, electrical, misc. upgrades and installation of the hood vent and grease traps.

4. Misc. (est. $30,000)

This budget is for hiring more team members, new product development, covering unforeseen complications, planning our grand opening celebration, organization, and marketing.   

WHAT IS BACON BOXES?

Bacon Roses. The claim to our wonderful fame. A for-fun turned for-profit. We are the first company under Department of Agricultural licensing to produce minimal processed bacon roses and ship them nationwide. We are also the first company to offer an alternative to pork...,  duck bacon roses. Bacon Boxes will soon expand into other tasty treats. 

Young Entrepreneurs. Bacon Boxes is an all women powered team of 20-something year old innovators and makers. Our team is diverse we're a group of fun loving college students and graduates with green science, agriculture, tech and business related backgrounds.

B-Corporation Standards. The world needs companies like us. We care about quality. We care about the environment. We care about making unforgettable memories. We care about your satisfaction. 

JOIN US:

Create memories with us! Business aside, Bacon Boxes are fun. Whether you’re celebrating a special occasion or treating yourself our bacon is sure to give you a case of the feel goods. The gratification is real. We make great memories that will last you a lifetime.

Create standards with us! As much as we love the fun we also love our community and planet. We source exclusively from American family owned farms that are responsible and environmentally sustainable. Our farmers use methods that are humane, reduce pollution, and reduce waste. Bacon is bacon, but what if I told you there are no additives such as hormones, steroids or antibiotics in our products. We advocate for change and to standardize quality.

Create jobs with us! We’re a great place to be employed. We offer team building skills, life building and interest centered tasks that make for a happier and healthier work environment. We look for individuals who put their heart and mind into what they do and in return we invest our heart and mind into their futures. With the expansion of the kitchen we will be able to accept more orders which means we will need more hands to help. This means employing more Americans and offering the opportunity to our youth for educational programs to be facilitated in our headquarters for culinary, business and communications.

Continue the fun with us! Bacon Roses are awesome. They’re sweet, a bit whimsical and oh so tasty. We’ve received many requests for other bacon related items especially during events from the breweries and bar folk. The rest of our market has been begging to come visit our kitchen and freely sample our deliciousness. Solutions.. Solutions. At the current moment we do not have the storage or work space to begin a secondary product line however we have experimented and on special occasions offered other bacon treats. With our new space there will be an intimate lounge area for special visits and a back area big enough to add the requirements to bring you the mouthwatering bacon you crave.

OUR CROWD FUNDER OFFERING:

Bacon [is cheaper than] Therapy

Baconologist or Ok, But first Bacon

Bacon Rosé

SHIRT STYLES

 

DESIGNS

WHAT THE FUTURE LOOKS LIKE

Below is the concept and stylistic set up for the future of our open to the public Bacon Boxes location. We hope to root ourselves in a redevelopment part of town as an effort to build community. To keep the cost and environmental impact low we will be purchasing used, repurposed and refurbished. Please note these are not actual photos however are simulations of the direction. 

 

 

Contact Us
